There are many Guardians, but there can only be one Guardian of the Realm, the leader who will lead their combined strength to victory. Bring the greatest resources to the Council and save the most villagers and you will be named the Guardian of the Realm.
  Gather weapons and shields, unearth ancient artifacts, and use magical spells to reinforce your defenses. Avoid the curses that will trick the unwary in these dark times. 
The clans offer aid to each other, but only the leader of the most prepared clan will be named Guardian of the Realm.
Each round, replenish your hand to 6. You can draw from the common face-up pool, or unseen from the deck.
Now you must make an offer of resources to another player, by choosing 1 or more cards that are all the same.
You may tell the truth about what type of card they are, or you may bluff. You must not lie about the number of cards though.
The recipient must decide if you are truthful or bluffing.
When you lose an offer, the Council takes pity on you and bestows to you a coin. You can also win coins by acquiring cards that match your affinity bonus. This can be from an offer you receive or that you make!
If you have enough coins, you can buy resources directly into your tableau for 3 coins.
Or you can spend 5 coins to dispel a curse from the open market and score 5 points.
As you add supplies to your tableau from successful offers, each scores differently. See the breakdown below. How will you choose to pursue victory?
The Council convenes near the midpoint of the game, and scoring takes place with quests and the Castle track. Then finally War is at hand when its card is drawn, triggering the last round of the game. 
The dragon and orcs have arrived at the city gates. Who will lead the Guardians into battle?!?
Watch a playthrough with Man vs Meeple! 
Check out the full rules of the game in the draft version of the Guardian's Call rulebook.

campaign.story:
THE BEAUTIFUL WILDERNESS
Sometimes you need to get off the beaten path to find a beautiful landscape to paint. Wake up early, hike deep into nature, and find your perfect spot. Some paintings sell for commissions, others you’ll keep for yourself, but you’re always going that extra mile to find inspiration! 
LIFE AS A LANDSCAPE ARTIST
Sunset Over Water is an easy to learn, thematic game where you take on the role of Landscape Artists. Players simultaneously play a planning card to determine turn order, navigate the Wilderness, paint Landscapes, match commission sets and vie for daily goals.
Simple, Simultaneous Planning keeps players engaged as they make decisions. 
Commission Sets and Daily Goals give interesting options not just to the player who hurries, but also to those who wait and play wisely. 
6 Turns of Quick-Moving Play makes for a journey of interesting decisions and beautiful results, one you’ll want to take again and again. 
Solo Rules let you head out into the wilderness when you want to seek out some fun and beauty on your own.
Steve Finn of Dr. Finn's Games - renowned designer of Biblios, The Butterfly Garden, and Herbaceous - has created a wonderful compliment to Beth Sobel's stunning landscape art. Eduardo Baraf of Pencil First Games is at the helm of Sunset Over Water to ensure it is the perfect balance of simple play, interesting moments, and wonderful art in a fantastic package. 
Keith Matejka of Thunderworks Games - designer of Roll Player and Herbaceous Solo Play - created the excellent solo rules for Sunset Over Water. Benjamin Shulman of Jelly Bean Soup Games powers the graphic design and instructions.
Kickstarter Exclusive Muse Pack!
All backers receiving the Sunset Over Water game receive the Muse Mini-Expansion! The Muse Cards add additional personal goals to Sunset Over Water's beautiful play.
Give Mom the Joy of Gaming!
Sunset Over Water makes a fantastic gift and we are confident it will ship to backers prior to May 1st, 2018 in advance of Mother's Day on Sunday, May 13th.
In the unlikely, but possible case it is tracking behind, we'll provide you with a backer exclusive digital Sunset Over Water Mother's Day card to let her know the game is on the way!
                 Ant Lab Games did a nice 2-player Playthrough and final thoughts video. (which KS won't let me embed for some reason....)
                    Tantrum House
"The planning cards add interesting decisions and tension...The illustrated landscapes are truly spectacular."
   Board Game Corner
"It's probably one of my wife's favorite games!" - Mark
  Board Game Closet
"If you are interested in a laid back fun, relaxing game with beautiful artwork, then you need to pick up Sunset Over Water."
                                        TwitchTV/Boardgames
"I love this game... I love the artwork, I love games with a set board, I just love the whole thing."- Praveen
TwitchTV/BoardGames: Full Playthrough (from before the review)
     NOTE - None of the (p)reviews on this campaign page received monetary compensation. Prototype copies were lent to each of the reviewers to play/preview and as a courtesy, if the campaign funds, I plan to send a them a final copy of the game.

Everyone has a green thumb when playing Herbaceous. Relax while enjoying this beautiful and elegant game of picking and potting herbs. Pot the best collection of herbs in your different containers, but don’t wait too long or your friend might grab them first. Herbaceous KS Landing Page

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sunset Over Water is Pencil First Games' seventh Kickstarter. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet!, The Siblings Trouble, GemPacked Cards, Heroes and Tricks, and Herbaceous all successfully funded and shipped to backers. Legendary Creatures is going to print. We strive to run excellent Kickstarters and deliver fantastic products.

Sunset Over Water is well tested and balanced. The graphic design is complete and the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but I have been making complex projects with countless moving parts and large budgets most of my career. I've gone out of my way to surround myself with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and I'm sure will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, I will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Voir la page du projet en français.
The 7th Continent is a cooperative game of adventure, exploration and survival, for 1 to 4 players, inspired by the adventure books where ”you are the hero“. It’s also, thanks to the support of over 12,000 backers, one of the biggest board game worlds ever created!
The game became a reality thanks to over 12,000 backers, but the cost of making such a game is so high that a retail version is almost unfeasible. However, we wanted to give you another opportunity to get your hands on it: your last chance… to get cursed.
The Expansion “What Goes Up, Must Come Down” invites you to come and discover, or perhaps return to, The 7th Continent for some fresh adventures! Two new curses are waiting, each with their own unique gameplay elements, for you to discover.
In “A Prison of Clouds” you’ll find yourself aboard a Hot Air Balloon, in search of salvation and in “The Veins of the Earth” you will delve deep below the Continent in order to triumph over the Evil consuming you.
“Easily one of my favourite games of the year. This is an amazing game and possibly the best adventure board game ever designed. Excellent!”
Tom Vasel – The Dice Tower
“The 7th Continent is the best exploration game I’ve ever played. Every decision is interesting, the sense of cooperation and collaboration is strong, the freedom to roam is liberating, and the mystery is fascinating. This is a must-buy!”
Jamey Stegmaier – Stonemaier Games
"The 7th Continent is quite simply a watershed moment in enthusiast gaming. Encapsulating all that was great from the LucasArts adventure games of the past, Serious Poulp has crafted an analog experience that continually inspires exploration and invokes a constant sense of wonder. The ripple effect of this game will be felt for years to come in the Boardgame Industry and should most definitely be enjoyed by all."
Jeremy Salinas – Man VS Meeple
“This is the ultimate survival/exploration board game. Nothing else comes close to touching it in terms of its raw, epic scope, ambition and design.”
Richard Ham – Rahdo Runs Through
"I have over 50 hours of gameplay logged with 7th Continent and I feel like I have just scratched the surface. This is easily the best game of the year, and one of the best I have ever played in my life."
Lance Myxter – Undead Viking
Play solo or in a team of up to 4 players.
30 seconds to set-up the game, 30 seconds to save it!
1000+ minutes of thrilling adventure in a single game.
Relive the sensation of the adventure books where “you are the hero” that thrilled so many of us in our childhood.
No dice rolls! Make difficult choices and face the consequences thanks to the game's innovative mechanics that determine success or failure!
Almost 1,000 cards for the base box alone with hundreds of pieces of original artwork.
Join the expedition any time, even if you missed the beginning of the adventure or died during it.
Live a different adventure every time! There are dozens of random events and several alternatives for each individually numbered card.
There are consequences to your actions. If you kill an NPC, they will remain dead for the rest of the game and any options or alternatives that you might have had by letting them live will be gone…forever. Let them live and they might help you later. Then again, they might not.
An expansion with two brand new curses, each with their own unique gameplay mechanics!
This expansion, which requires the base box, is compatible with all previous expansions.
It includes over 250 new cards, including two new curses, which you will have to overcome if you hope to leave the 7th Continent alive. Each one will provide a unique experience, pushing the survival skills of both novice and veteran explorers to the limit.
This new expansion has its own “collector’s” box that – combined with the base box – can store all of the cards of the base box as well as all of the expansions (even if everything is sleeved) and other materials. It includes:
3 Storage trays
250+ cards
1 Hot Air Balloon miniature (+ alternative cardboard standee)
1 Barge miniature (+ alternative cardboard standee)
7 new Dividers
1 rule sheet
The curse, “A Prison of Clouds”, will send you on a whirling adventure OVER the 7th Continent!
Aboard your hot air balloon, you’ll soar over the continent thanks to an innovative wind management system, which will lead you to new, unexplored tracts of land…
You can land at any time by taking the Terrain card with the same number as your current Sky card, allowing you to continue exploring on foot. When you wish to take off again, simply make your way back to the card where you landed and your aerial adventure continues.
Take care though, as each trip will tax you. Hunger, confinement and violent winds will test your nerves.
Make short trips and improve your piloting abilities if you want to stand a chance of lifting the curse that keeps you trapped in this hopeless land.
“The Veins of the Earth” will drag you down into the bowels of the earth where an underground network of serpentine waterways spans the entire length of the continent.
Aboard a barge of aboriginal design, your actions will be limited as the current draws you ever deeper. Make the right choices at the right time or you’ll end up lost and doomed in the pitch black.
As insane and suicidal as it may seem, you have no choice but to forge ever onwards into the darkness. What manner of horrors await you? It matters not, as long as you can free yourself from this curse!
"Satchel & Journal" Binder
This new accessory will allow you to store all the “Quest Item” cards that you’ll acquire during your adventures, just as if you were jotting them down in your journal!
1907. A renowned explorer, you have just returned from the first expedition on the seventh continent, a mysterious land that was recently discovered off the coast of Antarctica and is very likely the last Terra Incognita in the world.
You are recovering from your adventure when, whilst reading the daily newspaper, you realize that several other members of the expedition have disappeared suddenly, for unknown reasons.
Coincidentally, you have been lethargic for a few days, feeling feverish and finding it difficult to get out of bed. A cold shiver runs down your spine and you are in a constant state of depression and malaise.
You are going to have to face the facts: an evil is consuming you from within. When night falls, you slip into a restless sleep unaware that, for you, this is only the beginning...
You start each new game by choosing one of the available characters. Each one comes with their own set of Skill cards that represent their abilities and personality (adventurer, herbalist, doctor, mercenary, etc.).
Keelan: an explorer and keen Botanist. One of the explorers available to you with an example of her Skill cards.
“The Voracious Goddess”, “An Offering to The Guardians”, “The Bloody Hunt”, "The Dark Chest of the Damned" - Choose which curse (or curses!) has been put on you from those included in the base box (4) or those in the expansions (5).
Your goal? Find out how to lift the curses you have chosen and then purge your soul of them. Each curse offers a very unique adventure and will take you to different places. Obtain the unobtainable, discover that which is forever hidden, and strive against the impossible.
Do you have what it takes?
A Curse that you can attempt to lift and its clue.
You are now ready to begin your unexpected adventure. Similar to the books where "you are the hero”, you will explore the continent by putting numbered Terrain and Permanent event cards into play, which will gradually form the game board.
Forests, deserts, caves and mountains - you will visit dozens of different locations during your adventures as well as encounter random events that coincide with your location.
To progress through the game, you will perform the actions available on the Terrain card your miniature is standing on, the Event cards attached to it, and the Character, Skill, State and Bonus cards in your hand and the Items in your inventory.
In order to perform these actions, you will use the Action Deck that contains your Skills and simultaneously serves as your life force.
Every action makes you draw a certain number of cards from the Action Deck. These cards provide a variable amount of successes and you must obtain a specified number of them in order to succeed.
Fight action: draw 2 or more cards from the Action Deck to perform the action. Get 1 or more achievements to succeed.
Failing when performing an action may have terrible consequences and cause you to get negative State cards, forcing you to discard cards from the Action Deck, and consequently reducing your life force.
Fall off this peak and you will likely get injured.
Want to stack the odds in your favour? You may choose to draw more cards from the Action Deck to get more successes. However, every card in the Action Deck is a bit of your life force, so when the Action Deck is exhausted, so are you. From now on, every action could be your last!
Thankfully, the Skill cards that you may add to your hand when performing actions, your Bonus and Item cards, and the help from your companions will make things easier for you. This is especially true when it comes to decreasing the number of cards you must draw to perform an action or by increasing your chances of success.
A faithful companion and a precious item.
The 7th Continent is a strange land with many paranormal events, hostile creatures and inhospitable locations.
You will have to use your best survival skills to overcome the varied threats you will face in this land, so that you can eventually lift your curses:
Find or craft items to help you escape risky situations or access locations that would normally be unreachable without them.
Gather food, by hunting or fishing, in order to regain some life force, returning Action cards from the discard pile to your Action deck. Make a fire and cook it and you’ll find that you’ll get even more cards back!
Look carefully at your environment. It contains many clues and hidden numbers that can help you uncover the Continent’s many secret locations.
There are countless surprises for you to experience along your journey!
A page from your journal that now allows you to use this plant when you see it on your Terrain card.
You can download the rules (.pdf – 56 Mo) or check this video (26’) to learn how to play The 7th Continent!

Edit: cards from The Past must be returned between two game sessions.
All the expansions and optional purchases from the original Kickstarter will be available during the course of the second campaign.
How to add optional buys to my pledge?
1. Click on the “Manage your pledge” green button at the top of the page
2. On the next screen, click on the “Change your pledge” blue button
3. Then, in the current reward box you’ve chosen, increase the pledge amount by the value of the optional buy then click on the “Continue” green button
4. On the window that appears, click on the “Confirm” blue button.
5. It’s done!
6. A few weeks after the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will open the “Pledge Manager” (PM) and invite you to fill it by telling us which optional buys you’d like to purchase and in which language (English or French).
 
If you want to sleeve the ENTIRE game, including the Stretch Goals and any other content made available during the campaign, then you have to add both optional buys for a total of $79 which includes over 1600+ card sleeves (the “+” is additional sleeves included “for free” for the upcoming Stretch Goals and optional buys).
What would a Kickstarter campaign be without some Stretch Goats?
After 4 years of work, The 7th Continent became a reality thanks to the support of over 12,000 backers. Without them, we wouldn’t be here today.
The cost of making this game is high, notably due to the quality of its components. Due to this a retail version of the game is almost unfeasible.
However, we want the game to live and continue growing as well as allowing those that missed out on the first campaign and/or some of its contents to acquire them.
This campaign is no doubt one of your last chances to take part in The 7th Continent adventure...
This new campaign will allow you to expand upon the adventure we all began back in 2015. With new curses and mechanics, a whole new experience awaits you! It will also allow you to acquire any elements you may have missed from the first campaign.
For those of you only interested by the “upgrade pack”: you will be able to procure it (at production cost) at our online store at www.seriouspoulp.com when it becomes available in 2018.
Free Upgrade pack
This pack contains cards that will allow those of you possessing the first edition of the game to upgrade it to the second edition and 4 additional dividers to help you search for cards more easily (Characters' Skills, "004", "051", "109"). It includes any cards that may have been changed or corrected after the first campaign.
NOTE: This pack is included in the Veteran pledge (which is specifically for those with a copy of The 7th Continent from the first Kickstarter campaign)
New Content
If you purchased all available content from the previous campaign and wish to complete your collection, then all you’re missing is:
The expansion “What Goes Up, Must Come Down”: this expansion includes two new curses along with new ways to explore the continent.
Satchel & Notebook binder: this game accessory will allow you to store all the cards that would normally be placed under the Satchel & Journal card.
All unlocked Stretch goals that become available during the campaign.
These items are included in the Veteran pledge.
Also, new “optional purchases” will become available during the campaign (see "Optional buys" section). 
The USA, European Union, Canada and Australia will all be “Shipping Friendly”. This means that backers from these countries will not incur any import taxes.
After our experience with the first campaign, we are planning on two waves of shipping for this new project.
The First Wave will include the new "Second edition" base box and non-cards optional purchases (such as bone dice & dice bag, sleeves, etc.). This wave is slated for March 2018.
The Second Wave, due in October 2018, will include the new expansion "What Goes Up, Must Come Down", all optional buys with cards (old and new) as well as Stretch Goals from this campaign.
Shipping will be paid AFTER THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN, during the “Pledge Manager” phase. Below, you will find an estimation of shipping costs per shipping area. Despite this, we are committed to these prices being the maximum amount you will have to pay.
During the “Pledge Manager” phase, you can ask to receive everything, including the Base Box, in Wave 2 (due in October 2018) in order to reduce shipping costs significantly when compared to the cost of both waves (although still more expensive than the wave 2 shipping shown below).
*You can choose to have this optional buys shipped on wave 2 – instead of wave 1 – to avoid paying for the shipping fee associated.
**Europe (A): Germany, United-Kingdom, Republic of Ireland, Belgium, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Switzerland and Austria.
**Europe (B): Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Czech Republic.

Note: recently updated for GREECE, ROMANIA and SWEDEN.
Also, South Korea is in Area 4 – lower part of the estimate
Would you like to pledge for multiple copies?
Each copy purchased includes all unlocked Stretch Goals. For areas 1, 2 and 3, shipping costs after the first pledge (up to a maximum of 7) are halved! We are still looking for solutions to get some discount for multiple copies for areas 4 and 5 as well (hopefully by the end of the campaign).
We’re two friends that love playing and making games. Also, one of us is pretty handy with a pencil.
Founded in 2010, Serious Poulp was all about seeing the games we designed come to life.
Serious Poulp Inc. is the name of the North American branch of Serious Poulp. It was created in 2017 to help us develop our business in North America.
The first Kickstarter campaign for The 7th Continent was successfully funded back in October 2015 thanks to the support of 12,103 daring explorers! Two years later, with a lot of experience from this first adventure under our belts, we’re back with some new ideas that we just couldn’t keep to ourselves!
Ludovic Roudy and Bruno Sautter
Two friends passionate about all things gaming! We’ve been working together for almost 15 years in the digital communication agency we created in 2002, then as Serious Poulp, which we founded in 2010, when the temptation to publish games became too strong to resist.
Role-playing games and gamebooks played a significant part in both our childhoods. Bruno was 5 when “The Warlock of Firetop Mountain” was published. Ludovic was 11 and already had a few prototypes on the go (one of which would eventually become The 7th Continent!).
We've been inspired by many great works during our lives, whether from board games, role-playing games or video games. When we started out in the board gaming industry, we naturally brought all of these elements with us.
We are not only the designers of the 7th Continent - Ludovic also creates all of the illustrations and visual elements for our games and Bruno, apart from writing cards and rulebooks, supervises production.
Jamie “Whelpslayer” Johnson
Jamie is the Community Manager for The 7th Continent and the scourge of small draconic beings. Rolling dice, pushing toy soldiers and trading sheep for many a moon now, Jamie is, just like you guys, a gamer at heart. He’s also a publisher himself with his own company, Holy Grail Games. Some of you may recognize him from the first Kickstarter campaign.
To our families and friends for their incredible support and patience as we created the cursed land of the 7th Continent.
To our proofreaders and translators who did an outstanding job!
To Olivier Nkweti for his great work on miniatures.
To the amazing Gary Chalk, Joe Dever, Didier Guiserix, Gary Gygax, Steve Jackson and Ian Livingstone for their inspirational work.
To all the backers of the first campaign who helped us make this dream a reality.
To you, previous and first-time backers, who will allow us to keep on dreaming!
Thank you all!
We wish you a not too gruesome demise in the land of The 7th Continent!

campaign.story:
THE LEGEND OF KORRA: PRO-BENDING ARENA is board game set in the Avatar universe from Nickelodeon's global smash hit Avatar: The Legend of Korra. A miniatures board game designed by Sen Foong-Lim and Jessey Wright, The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena pits 2 players against each other in a sports game that features deep, strategic, head-to-head gameplay, highly detailed and dynamic miniatures, deck crafting and building, and team customization.
The game play of The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena is closely modeled after the popular Pro-bending sport featured in the first season of Avatar: The Legend of Korra. As such, the game is designed for 2 players, each controlling a team of 3 benders: earth, fire, and water.
Based on the events of Avatar: The Legend of Korra, Pro-bending Arena focuses on the championship match between the fresh-faced Future Industry Fire Ferrets and the sneaky and brutal White Falls Wolfbats.
The objective of the game is simple: be on the other team's side of the arena when the game ends and you will be victorious, or dominate the competition, pushing all their benders off the back of the arena to end the game immediately and claim the championship as yours!
  The below videos will give you an understanding of not only how The Legend of Korra Pro-bending Arena plays, but also an understanding of how to play it, plus the strategies involved.
      The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena encourages players to experiment with their team's techniques and trick load out. This deep customization rewards players with endless ways to build their teams and defeat their opponents. 
During your match, you'll be able to focus your benders' chi and purchase new technique cards from one of their three strategy decks, each one separated by bender type. Not only does this mid-game deck building give players a chance to turn the tide of the match when a powerful card comes up for purchase, but it also allows players to min-max each of their strategy decks. 
The strategy deck can be crafted before the game by players really looking to give their team an offensive edge. Being selective about what cards go into each one of your bender's strategy decks will give you the opportunity to control the plays you'll have access to as the game progresses. 
  Not only can you customize your team by crafting your strategy decks before the game, but you can really show your style via the trick cards you can load your team with.
There are two types of trick cards: incredibly powerful ones that can only be used once, or slightly less powerful but much riskier cheats that can be used multiple times but require players to roll a referee die each time they're used.
Collect 2 yellow fans on a single bender and they're out of the game, putting you at a serious disadvantage.
Tricks allow players to supercharge their attacks, escape incoming barrages of elements, or even make their benders impervious to being pushed back. Deciding which tricks to take, and whether or not they're the risky yellow-fan cheats or one-time powerful tricks really allows players to make a team their own.
During the course of this campaign, we will be unlocking 7 mystery teams as a free upgrade for your pledge. These are not stretch goals, they are guaranteed to be a part of your pledge no matter what our funding level ends up being! 
Additional teams offer you a ton of new strategies. Not only will each team come equipped with their own unique special ability and strategy decks, but they also come with 6 universal trick cards that can be used by any team in the game. Meaning that even if you've already built your favorite team,  any additional team you add to your game will expand the options you have for your perfectly-tuned machine.
Once you've learned your new teams' quirks and perks, maximized their power potential, and earned your first championship, why not switch it up and draft your dream team?
Adding teams to your core game will also allow you to participate in the Fantasy Draft variant. In this game mode, players can mix and match their favorite members from their favorite teams and experience the fantasy of combining two powerful special abilities into one devastating power play. 
When missing team members, all members still get their specific special ability, triggered by their technique cards. This can allow for unbelievable power combinations that will have Fire Ferret team members counter-bending elements alongside Wolfbats, dazing the opposition with illegal techniques.
        The White Falls Wolfbats are the reigning Pro-bending champions. Being fan favorites, any question of the legality of their techniques and the legitimacy of their champion status is often brushed off as loser jealousy. Still, something about the way they play does ring a little unfair to even the most die-hard fans.
In The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena, the White Falls Wolfbats have access to the some of the dirtiest tricks in the book. Their team special ability, Daze, allows the Wolfbats to put their opponents at a serious disadvantage with cheap-shots that cripple their next plays.
    Fresh-faced and newly-formed, the Future Industry Fire Ferrets are the surprise stars of the Pro-bending league. Hailing from Republic City, the Fire Ferrets are best known for their teamwork and mastery of the elements. Well, okay, that's the second thing they're known for; they're primarily known for being the team with Avatar Korra playing for them.
Focusing their chi on mastering the elements, the Fire Ferrets have become proficient in redirecting overly aggressive plays back against their opponents. Counter-bend takes your opponents' element tokens and adds them as part of your attack. These counter-bend techniques can change the course of the game in a single, well-planned play.
Known on the Pro Bending circuit for their teamwork, the all-female, all-amazing Rabaroos coordinate to unleash a rapid-fire flurry of elemental attacks. Ada, Ula, and Umi are guaranteed to bring you to your feet with their lightning fast bending. It’s always action-packed when the Rabaroos are in the Arena!
Rally and Blitz 
What makes the Rabaroos unique are their twin icons, Rally and Blitz. Activate Rally to gain Rally tokens which you can then spend when you activate Blitz. Blitz permits you to draw a card from the top of your Main Deck, immediately launching an additional action!
  The self-proclaimed “Bullies of Black Quarry”, the Boar-Q-Pines specialize in relentless pressure. Many a team of Pro Benders have withered under the attacks of the rough-and-tumble Boar-Q-Pines. Chang, Xin, and Shui may be a little prickly, but they should never be underestimated!  
Pressure
Pressure tokens are this team’s unique modifier, making your elemental tokens count for double when they hit. Even the weakest attack from the Boar-q-pines is a credible threat to be taken seriously!
  The nimble and evasive P’Li is one of the rare fire benders who has the ability to focus Chi into a concentrated line of concussive force. This Combustionbending is nigh impossible to block and nearly as difficult to avoid. After years of being held deep in the frozen wastes for 13 long years by the Order of the White Lotus, P’Li has escaped and is once again after her quarry - Avatar Korra! Do not stand in her way!
P’Li's unique and powerful bending type makes her such a fierce competitor that she doesn't need any teammates by her side to be a Pro-bending champion. Her combustionbending cannot be stopped, meaning that elements placed in an attempt to defend against her attacks cannot annihilate her attacks. P'Li is limited by the amount of combustion she can bend, since she is only allotted 6 combustion tokens. Players using her as a team will need to be careful about how often they deploy those tokens, as after all combustion tokens are deployed any combustion icons played are ignored. 
  The pride of the Golden Temple, Haka, Josei, and Kano come to Pro Bending with years of experience under their belts. As they’re not spring chickenpigs anymore, the Tigerdillos rely less on their athleticism and more on their wisdom as veterans of the sport. They know when it’s best to fight and when it’s best to regroup and refocus.
 Veteran
The Tigerdillos, while capable benders, may be past their prime in terms of raw athletic prowess. However, their Veteran status in Pro-bending gives their team members a sense of when to take advantage of the shift in battle gain even more of an edge over the competition.
  The Buzzardwasps have mastered the art of attacking pressure points at a distance, making precise strikes against opponents instead of using brute force. Their infamous “Sting” technique can make even the most iron willed Pro-bender lose focus. Shan, Ko, and Loong are aiming to take the championship trophy back to Bau Ling! 
The Buzzardwasps deliver precision attacks directly to identified weak points. Their famous sting has a powerful bite, distracting opponents, causing them to lose focus and opening them up to more attacks.
  Kuvira is not only a political and military genius, her Metalbending is without peer in single combat and her acrobatics allows her to dance between multiple foes. Kuvira can switch from attack to defense and back again within the same, seemingly effortless, sequence of complex moves. Underestimate the grace of “The Great Uniter” of the Earth Empire at your own peril!
Kuvira, Superior Combatant
Kuvira’s prowess at executing advanced techniques makes it impossible for a referee to judge whether she's cheating or not. As such her Prowess ability is versatile and powerful if you choose from all of the tricks available. To ensure that the game is fair, Kuvira cannot use Tricks that prevent her from being knocked back (such as Determination).
  Unalaq's infamy goes beyond his devious machinations and his skilled waterbending, his ability to siphon off his enemy's spiritual energy makes him a foe unlike any other. Pro-benders find themselves imagining what facing-off against such an unconventional bender would be like. How would Unalaq's soul siphon affect them in the arena, how wound he combine his most peculiar ability with his incredible waterbending skills?
Soul Siphon
If you have your Spiritbending token on your Villain board, you may spend it (return it to the supply). If you do, choose 1 bender in the target space of an attack. Your opponent must discard a card of that bender’s element from their hand. If they do not have a card, return your Spiritbending token to your Villain board.
      If you'd like to add the Amon expansion to your pledge please press the "Manage my Pledge" buttom at the top of the page and add $30. 
The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena Amon's Invasion expansion includes 3 game modes: 
1. Fully cooperative mode where 2 players, controlling 2 bending teams, face off against Amon and his equalists henchmen. Amon and his equalists are controlled by an A.I. dekc that indicates what they will do.
2. Avatar Korra mode, where Korra becomes a single bender team and has special cards that allow her to use all the elements that she has mastered. 
3. Amon controlled mode, in this mode Amon is playable and he uses his equalists to move around the board attacking his opposing team.
The Amon Invasion expansion includes:
1 Amon Miniature
1 Amon's Lieutenant Miniature
3 Equalist Chi-blocker Miniatures
1 Double Sided Amon team board (Cooperative A.I. side & the Solo Bender side)
1 Avatar Korra team board 
Amon A.I. Deck 
Avatar Korra Deck 
Amon Solo Bender deck
3 Avatar Korra Trick cards 
6 Trick cards usable by any team 
The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena Kickstarter campaign features NO STRETCH GOALS. That's right, no dollar amounts need to be met, no struggle to hit the next cool goal. Instead, you are GUARANTEED the following upgrade to your core game by backing the deluxe edition:
Exclusive, Limited Deluxe Edition Packaging. 
A limited edition championship promo-poster.

We will reveal a new item for your pledge almost every day during the campaign. All but one of these revealed items are guaranteed as part of your pledge. Each day we'll invite you to return to our campaign page to learn which team, trick cards, or component upgrade we've unveiled. 
The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena Deluxe Edition is exclusively available through Kickstarter. Make sure you back today to guarantee your access to all the incredible rewards!  
IMPORTANT: Shipping Information & Retailer Verification
Retailer Pledge Levels
We will be verifying via our fulfillment partners that pledges for the retailer level are indeed for retailers. Please be prepared to provide a business address for delivery.
We will be charging shipping through our pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign has successfully completed. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
IDW Games has Kickstarted and fulfilled 3 campaigns and is about to fulfill their 4th campaign, Rayguns and Rocketships. That campaign is scheduled to deliver 1 month early. We've also been publishing games into retail via standard distribution channels for over 4 years. 

All of our games are manufactured in China, and as such there are a few issues that could potentially slow the delivery of our campaign. The most common issues are production delays due to plastic quality, shipping delays due to vessel schedules and weather, and customs clearance when the goods come into America. 

While we have never had any of the above-mentioned delays vastly affect our delivery of a final product, there is always the potential that one of these things could cause a delay in the delivery of pledges of this campaign to backers.

campaign.story:
Having narrowly escaped from your nemesis, the Ancient Ones, you have sought refuge on a mysterious space station that is badly in need of assistance to repair its systems. You must explore the station to discover powerful technology in the hopes of preparing your team, restore the functions of the Station while uncovering its true power, and battle against the other races that seek to control the Station as a means of ruling the galaxy. Do you have what it takes to survive? Are you ready to reveal the Secrets of the Lost Station?
 Secrets of the Lost Station is a cooperative story game of sci-fi, action-adventure, and exploration. It is a highly detailed and unique sequel to Secrets of the Lost Tomb, one thousand years into the future! With a new story and a thematic universe, extending the lore of the Secrets of the Lost Epic Saga, Secrets of the Lost Station will stand on its own, with a completely overhauled yet familiar rule-set and outstanding miniatures.
Players assume the role of the last surviving members of a 4000-year-old secret society known as the Eternal Order of Perseus. Their perpetual mission: to face intergalactic dangers, seek out and collect alien artifacts of immense potential, all to protect humanoids from the otherworldly powers in the fight against their mortal enemy: a primordial race known only as the Great Old Ones. The ancient race that exists only to feed upon the life force of planets, world-killers that must be stopped once and for all…
Each of the game’s Campaign-based Storytelling, Exploration-Driven Scenarios has its own unique theme, flavor, and powerful boss monster bringing you into the rich and detailed world of The Station. Prepare to face Captain De'sotoh, the most feared space pirate captain under the orders of an ancient one. Her leader, Sil'ahan Empress of R'lyeh, strives to impose her will through her Eldritch Forces, and if successful, bring imbalance and chaos to the galaxy! Each scenario within the campaign offers new challenges, fateful choices that will lead your team to thrilling adventures and cliffhangers! As you progress through the self-expanding storyline, player characters will unlock new character abilities as well as new Station powers that make the players more powerful and more prepared for the dangers that lie ahead.
For more Story details, see the Secrets of the Lost Station: Story Details underneath the Add-Ons section.
     We started out as Gamers & Script writers and wanted to share our passion with you in a game that is: Immersive, Expansive, Highly Replayable. You are the star of the story and get to shape the outcome of your adventure by making critical decisions that will determine the outcome of your unique, choose-your-own-adventure style campaign. You will be at the edge of your seat as you battle against time and all of the mysterious agents of evil contained in the Secrets of the Lost Station Universe.
Scalable Player Count and Difficulty. Everyone has a different skill level preference when playing a game, and everyone’s game group has different sizes and levels of experience. But all gamers have something in common when playing games: They want to have FUN! So, in this spirit, we have created a modular game which can be adapted to fit your group's playing style.
Proven Track Record of making EPIC Story telling Games. 3 Years ago we launched the Secrets of the Lost Tomb Universe. Since then we have created 35 different stories that took our fans on EPIC Adventures. Now, back by popular demand, we venture 1000 years into the future with up to 74 new EPIC Sci-fi adventures in, Secrets of the Lost Station.

    Overview: Having narrowly escaped from your nemesis, the Ancient Ones, you have sought refuge on a mysterious space station that is badly in need of assistance to repair its systems. You must explore the station to discover powerful technology in the hopes of preparing your team, restore the functions of the Station while uncovering its true power, and battle against the other races that seek to control the Station as a means of ruling the galaxy.
What is the Station? - The Station is a technological marvel that is currently floating nearly derelict in space. You are unsure of its origin, how it was damaged or how to fit it. But one thing is for sure, if you do not repair its systems in enough time to repel the enemy forces that are bearing down on your location, you will surely be destroyed. A fate that will most likely be shared with the rest of the galaxy.
Who is Sil’ahan? - An Ancient One, known as the Empress of R'lyeh, is your greatest enemy. She and her Eldritch forces have not only destroyed the Seraphic Homeworld but also eliminated nearly all of the escaped refugees as they were ruthlessly hunted down. You are unsure why she has such a hatred for the Seraphic, but you do know that the two cultures have existed for nearly all of recorded time and have been at war with one another for just as long. Her advanced fleet is commanded by her four daughters, their hunger for genocide appears to be a long standing family tradition. They destroyed your world and the station is now your last hope of survival. You must find a way to stop the reign of this ultimate evil before she and her forces destroy the galaxy.
Who is Captain De’sotoh? - The Captain is a Starling and a mercenary. It is not uncommon for those of the Starling race to take up this kind of trade, but it is shocking that De’Sotoh would agree to work with the Ancient Ones and spread their villany throughout the stars. She is well known in the galaxy of being cunning and heartless. Some say she was not always this way. 
What kind of story can we expect from the Core Game? - The Secrets of the Lost Station core game will first help train you on how to play the game before you embark on two fantastic campaign expeditions. The first campaign will peel back the veil of secrecy that shrouds Captain De’sotoh as she hunts the Station, seeking to capture it as a prize for her master Sil’ahan. In the second campaign you will encounter the full wrath brought upon by the Ancient Ones. Your only advantage is that both Sil’ahan and De’sotoh seem fearful of the Station. Perhaps if you can discover why, you may have a chance of surviving the encounter.
The Inside Scoop: Secrets of the Lost Station was conceptualized during the creation of Secrets of the Lost Tomb. Together their stories weave an Epic tapestry of adventure, treachery and survival. Once you have explored both sagas, you will truly understand the Secrets that each hold.
Overview: Oblivion uncovers the secrets behind the war of the races and offers a new level of difficulty as you battle against those tainted by Cosmic Dark Energy. Beware of the Darc Arc, as its powers rival that of the station and it has the ability to assimilate its technology. Also unlock new Darc abilities and items that have untold power, but also great consequence.
What is the DARC? - The DARC is a new race of beings born from a cosmic energy that has entered this universe by untold means. All the EOP knows about this energy is that it corrupts all those who are infected by it, its affinity skews towards evil and the source is a titan known as Cosmos.
Who is Cosmos? - Cosmos is a god-like being that is more powerful than anything the EOP has ever encountered. His origins do not appear of this dimension. His intentions appear to be of self-preservation and assimilation by feeding off of planets and the beings that inhabit them. A unique characteristic of this titan is that he is so powerful that he ensnares small planets and uses them as a satellite shields around his body, connected by Darc energy, to use as defense against any that try to stand against him.
What happens to those tainted by Darc energy? - Both organic and mechanical beings can be infected by Darc energy. Once they are affected, they become possessed by the symbiotic energy and are enveloped into the collective mind of Cosmos. In addition to cosmos having complete control over these creatures the Darc energy also has the ability to synergize with its host making them more powerful than their native state of existence.
There seems to be lots of extra components in this expansion, what do I get? This expansion has content equivalent to that of a Core game. As you explore the galaxy you will encounter planets tainted by the Darc. These encounters may yield the assimilation of infected rooms to be absorbed into the Station. There are also Upgrades and Items of "Untold power and Consequence". These resources are infused with Darc energy, if you use them in an attempt to gain the power for an ultimate victory... be careful, you may also end up paying the ultimate price!
What kind of story can we expect from this expansion? - The Story Arc in Oblivion features the climax of the Secrets of the Lost Stations Series. You will go on a cosmic "CHOOSE YOUR OWN ADVENTURE" journey where the Station attempts to track down the Darc Arc in a race to rule the galaxy. During your journey you will be orbiting planets seeking resources to defeat the Darc Arc while trying to rid the planets of the corruption spread by the Darc Energy. This Epic conclusion will yield multiple boss battles including a station stand off and the ultimate battle against Cosmos. If your team can survive the encounter, you will ultimately discover the secret of the Lost Station... AND the Lost TOMB!!!
The Inside Scoop: There are multiple ways to defeat Cosmos, one of which depends on your ability to unite the races of the galaxy to form a collation. This special union is symbolized as part of the self-expanding nature of Secrets of the Lost Station by collecting the special tiles that are found in each of the expansions. Don't worry, you won't need every expansion to conquer the oblivion expansion, but if you do, you will be able to unlock a special ending!
 Overview: Machinations continues the Starling Saga cliffhanger introduced in the Core game. Further explore the backstory behind the Starlings and why members of their noble race would resort to piracy to survive. Reveal the story of Kon'hor the 1st mate of Captain DeSotoh and why he now must wear his exo-mech to survive.
Who are the Starlings? - The Starlings are a noble high-born race reminiscent to a breed of space-elf-like creatures. Next to the Seraphic and the Ancient Ones, the Starlings are the third oldest race in the Stations universe. Similar to the other ancient races, their origins are not known by many, the only thing that is commonly known is that they are a very old race, not many of them exist in the universe, and they are well known for their sense of self-entitlement. They respect the other ancient races but look down on them nonetheless. The lower races however, they view them with such intense indifference that they see their freedom and culture are an opportunity for Starling expansion. This is why many of the Starlings have resorted to Mercenary tendencies. Another interesting point about the Starling culture is their breeding practices. Over the years, perfection has become a standard, and imperfection is not tolerated. Thus, the Starlings turned to science to engineer their culture to ensure not only survival but dominance. This point is exemplified by the existence of their caste system. At the top of the hierarchy stands the royals, which become captains of the pirate Armada. Next in line are the Quartermasters who act as the mutated bodyguards of the Royals. At the bottom of the social ladder are the Pirate Crew. These sniveling space lemmings are basically the Laser fodder of the race. However, be warned, what they lack in strength, they make up for in their numbers.
Who is Kon’hor? – Kon’hor’s is one of the only known humans to work in the service of the Starling race. He is also well known for his loyalty to Captain DeSotoh and the exo-skeleton that is required to keep him alive. The reason he requires the exoskeleton is both a story of legend and myth. The stories have been so wildly exaggerated over the years that the true story may be lost to history. One thing is for sure though, at the root of the story is Captain DeSotoh.
What is Kon’hor’s relationship with Captain DeSotoh? – Kon’hor is Captain DeSotoh’s 1st mate, even though they command separate ships. *** The remainder of this section has been classified ***
How did the Starlings become enslaved by the Ancient Ones? Much of the Starling race are mercenaries. They have been under contract by the reigning queen of the Ancient Ones for hundreds of years, so it is a common misconception that they are enslaved, but in actuality, they are actually employed. The most infamous relationship is that between Captain DeSotoh and Sil’ahan, empress of R’lyeh. Their notorious partnership has held captive most of the galaxy for generations.
What kind of story can we expect from this expansion? - The story arc in Machinations reveals the hidden story of Captain DeSotoh that is initially developed in the core game. You will also be introduced to the backstory of Cassy Opia and how she became a member of the EOP. At this point in the Epic saga you will have already experienced the treachery of Starling pirate mercenaries, however, this expansion will take all that you know of this race and blow it out the airlock! Expect the unexpected and brace for impact in this hard hitting expansion to Secrets of the Lost Station.
The Inside Scoop: If played in order, this story will reveal one of the 1st Special Paladin Tiles in the Story. Its function will be hidden for some time, but with great power comes great responsibility. Do you have what it takes to learn the secrets of the Starlings and survive?
Overview: The challenges of Earth have become the challenges of Mars. You thought that part of your history was left in the past, until now, where you find you and your team caught between a long embattled civil war between the human resistance and their mortal enemies, the Draconians.
Who are the Draconians? - For those that are fans of Secrets of the Lost Tomb, you already know the backstory. For those that are new to the lore, the Draconians are a race of half-human, half-dragon creatures. The pure bloods originally enslaved humans thousands of years ago, however after the uprising, their numbers were diminished so greatly the Dracs needed to breed with the humans for survival. Over the years their inherent magic ability has been almost bred out of existence. There are still a few that have enough blood of the elders running through their veins to harness the power of magic, but those with this ability are hunted with ruthless intent. Needless to say, the humans and the Dracs don't quite get along, in fact it's this relationship that brought the downfall of Earth and turned Mars into an Alien wasteland.
Who is Kammora? – Kammora is one of the last Drac magic casters. She is the warrior princess of the wastelands and stands as the only opposition to "King Rex". Her might on the battlefield is well known on Mars... and will soon be known on the station!
Who is Rex? – "King Rex" is the self-proclaimed ruler of Mars. He is the leader of the humans and of the Draconian resistance. Although he claims his manifesto is that of survival of humankind, his methods are more reminiscent of genocide, and his totalitarian style of rule has him more feared than respected. With the appearance of the Station over his planet, his aspirations to imposes his will now extend to the stars.
Why does the EOP have a Drac part of the team? Balthazar is a very unlikely ally of the EOP. His alliance makes him a lighting rod of hate from both narrow-minded humans and Draconians alike. The EOP however, has a great respect for their alien hero and are proud to call him a brother and advocate of peace. His skill on the battlefield is only matched by his understanding of alien technology.
Why are the Dracs and Humans at War? - For just about all of recorded history, from the time of the Elder Dragon Haltuth, though the reign of Emperor Dracus, to the current domination of Kammora, humans have been at war with the Dracs. The biggest difference is that now both human and Draconian are on the brink of extinction and both races are determined to help the other achieve this status. The root of this conflict for the humans is their long standing vendetta they have held against their original subjugators. For the Dracs, it's a matter of pride. They were born from the flame and being forced to breed with the low-born humans for survival makes them want to destroy them as a way of erasing the regrets of their past.
What kind of story can we expect from this expansion? - The Station has sought refuge in orbit around Mars and its arrival activated local dormant technology. When a dirt-side portal activates and a moon-sized silhouette appears in the sky, it was only a matter of time before the Station would become enveloped in battle. Now that Rex has come to know of the station, he seeks to expand his influence beyond Mars. It won't be long until Kammora shows that she too has similar intentions, and with this, you know the EOP will be the last line of defense.
The Inside Scoop: A double boss expansion makes Resistance a must have. Double the story, double the threat. Do you have what it takes to survive and defend the Station from apocalyptic domination?
 Overview: Resurrection brings to life an evil thought destroyed over 1000 years ago. Battle against D.O.M.I.N.U.S. as he and his Cybermorph army try to take over the Station. A true battle of man vs machine in a struggle to either protect or enslave the galaxy.
Who is D.O.M.I.N.U.S.? - The origin of the D.O.M.I.N.U.S. battle Satellite stems back to his creation by the humans back in circa 1980-90. But one can argue that he was actually his own creation. Humans originally created him as a Defensive Orbital Missile Interceptor and Neutralizer of the United States back during the Cold War against Russia. However, when his artificial intelligence prompted him to save Earth by eradicating its biggest threat, humans, the world found itself part of the Metal Dawn! Now 1000 years later, the Station faces a similar threat.
What are the Cybermorphs? – Cybermorphs are the spawn of D.O.M.I.N.U.S. they are hive-minded machines that are sourced from local resources and used by D.O.M.I.N.U.S. to overpower local inhabitants as a means of protecting them. This artificial race consists of three designs, each with a specific purpose. First are the drones, they are flying sentinels that are the spotters for the stronger ground forces. They are many and come equipped with a mini railgun. Next are the Cyborgs, they are the soldiers of the A.I. army. They are nimble and come equipped with double Gatling guns. Next are the Exterminators. As the name would have it, these roving tanks have one purpose, to eliminate opposition. They are slow but very powerful enemies. And last, let's not forget D.O.M.I.N.U.S., he currently is an orbiting satellite, but you have a feeling there is more than meets the eye...
Why was D.O.M.I.N.U.S. orbiting Mars? – You can only speculate how he arrived around the red planet. With the limited intel you were able to gather from the Station archives, all indications are that he was destroyed back on Earth over a millennia ago.
Who is T.I.M.? - You found T.I.M floating in an escape pod drifting in a distant orbit around Mars. When you brought the pod aboard the Station there was nothing inside it accept a silver metallic liquid. Once you entered the lower orbit of Mars, the liquid morphed into the shape of a human-like figure. Jack was the first to find him. Initially his programming was still activating, so when he introduced himself as a Technological Intelligent Mechanism, Jack just referred to him as the acronym T.I.M. and that is what the E.O.P. has called him ever since. His is believed to be an ally, and a very resourceful one at that. With limited resources, you need all the help you can get. So fingers crossed, he seems to be on your side, for now.
What kind of story can we expect from this expansion? - Just When you think things can't get any worse... During a recent battle you hurriedly requested Darwin warp the Station to the nearest Human-sympathetic world. As luck would have it, you arrived at your own home world of Mars. Shortly after arriving, a sensor sweep of the area accidentally awakens dormant technology. Your question of what you activated was quickly answered as the portal activation system was hacked and the Station becomes overrun with Cyborgs. You have become accustomed to fighting aliens with enhanced technical weapons... but fighting enemies that are themselves technical weapons, is a whole other story!
The Inside Scoop: D.O.M.I.N.U.S. is one of two cross-over bosses of Secrets of the Lost Station. He was originally designed for a separate game called Metal Dawn that was designed earlier in 2017. He became such a beloved enemy of the Epic roster, we decided to extend his story into Secrets of the Lost Station.
 Overview: Rhaz-Azul Ahmet, an ancient evil well known by the EOP, exists in the future and in the past. He has arrived on the station to impose his will on the universe. Battle against this foe of legend, protect the station from his Fallen Seraphic minions, and learn more about how the Secrets of the Lost Tomb and Station are interconnected!
Who are the Seraphic? – In the Secrets of the Lost Station universe, the Seraphic are the race with the highest affinity towards good and they live in opposition to the only race to rival their inherent power, the Ancient Ones. On the surface, the Seraphic seem to be a race of benevolent, god-like beings, living in a utopian society. But the E.O.P., having firsthand experience of their culture, know this perception is only partially true. The only way this “golden” race is able to maintain its prestige and power is through a strict code of rules, which if broken, yield an ultimate consequence. To maintain a perfect society, there is little margin for error, thus most punishment usually results in banishment or exile. For non-Seraphic races that are exiled, they are cast out, which in most cases, results in death as these adopted lifeforms were usually unfit to survive on their own. For the Seraphic that are banished, they are no longer considered part of the society, and to ensure they are no longer seen as representation of the ideal race, they have their most distinguishable feature removed, their wings! Now they must live the rest of their life marked as “unworthy”. Over the eons, this practice has resulted in the unintentional creation of the counterculture known as the Fallen.
Why did the Seraphic save the Humans from Mars? – The Seraphic by nature look to bring balance to the universe. Those that are worthy of being saved from overwhelming opposition are granted safe passage to the Seraphic home world to rehabilitate and become emissaries of peace. It is not a surprise that the E.O.P. qualified for this stay of extinction, as they had acted as the protectorate of humanity for centuries. However, not all Seraphic agree with the decision to have saved this select group of humans, and in the end, some actually blame the humans for having brought the destruction to the Seraphic home world.
Who is Rhaz-Azul? – For the fans of Secrets of the Lost Tomb, you know Rhaz as the iconic pharaoh-villain from the first Scenario of the Core Game. For those new to the Secrets of the Lost Station universe, you will come to know Rhaz as a futuristic Dark Paladin, hell-bent on revenge against the humans. His character Arc is one of the most dynamic and twisted reveals of the Secrets storyline!
Who is Feonix, and why does she not have wings? – It is true that although Feonix does not have wings, she is in fact a Seraphic. To be more specific, a Fallen. She is an amazing warrior, but very secretive of her past. Some of the E.O.P. know of her deeds and why she was banished, but none dare to speak of it. Some remain silent out of respect, but most do so out of fear.
Who is Brey’del? – Breydel is a powerful friend of the humans. She had been completing her training to become a paladin when the Seraphic home world was attacked. She never completed her training, but was successfully able to find the Seraphic caravan and reunite with her father one last time before the final fateful attack by the Ancient Ones. She may be young and inexperienced, but one day her greatness will be known throughout the entire galaxy.
What kind of story can we expect from this expansion? – The Seraphic story line revels a key narrative that joins the secrets of the Lost Tomb with that of the Lost Station. Many backstory plot lines will be uncovered as you seek to protect the Station from the fury of Rhaz-Azul. On the horizon of your timeline, you see the past and the future converge. Can you muster the courage to press on? Will you look into the mirror of fate and survive? Have your brothers in arms taken up arms against you? The only way to find out these answers, and many, many more, is to step through the portal to discover the Secrets of the Lost Station!
The Inside Scoop: Rhaz-Azul was a keystone character from Secrets of the Lost Tomb. He was such a recognizable boss from the franchise we had to have him make a triumphant return in Secrets of the Lost Station.

Risks and challenges
This is our 12th Kickstarter Campaign, and there are usually some vague areas in terms of timing when it comes to anything normally produced in China, such as: 
Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays 
Due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards later than others, but this is normal as with all Kickstarter campaigns.
We know what it takes to print a big game. Secrets of the Lost Tomb, our first title, now has 14 SKUs including expansions and miniatures. That means we have produced an astounding amount of different boxes of game product for our past campaigns.
We endeavor to please our backers in any way we can! We want you to enjoy our games, our stories, and our creations to their fullest. If there is anything that we can ever do to make your experience better, we're always here to help!
Our Motto is "Of the Gamer, by the Gamer, and For the Gamer!" we know what it's like to be Ignored by Project Creators, to never get an email back from a Game Company, to have to post on a blog to get a response... We're not Like that... Here's the President of our Company's email: Chris@EverythingEpic.us you can email me directly for anything you ever need and I will always respond to you directly and help in any way I can.

campaign.story:
Get your pizza ready... Italian Hot Sauce is back and better than ever!
Stronger: Our new and improved recipe is thicker, bolder, and jam-packed with Italian flavor.
Faster: We're all set with our manufacturer to guarantee delivery by the holidays.
Better: We lowered our prices, so you get more bang for your buck.
Growing up in New York City, we've eaten our fair share of Italian food. Sunday dinners, deli runs... and "Pizza Night" was almost every night. A big family with seven hungry sons, we were always fighting over that eighth and final slice.
Now we have our own families, and we can eat as much pizza as we'd like, but something seemed missing. Maybe it was the nostalgia... or maybe just a few tastebuds. Whatever it was, we found ourselves putting hot sauce on everything... especially pizza!
There's Sriracha for Asian cuisine, Cholula for everything south of the border, but what about Italian food? How about a legitimate hot sauce made for pizza, pasta, and paninis? A lightbulb went off, and "The Original Italian Hot Sauce" was born.
We've spent the last few years perfecting our recipe and jumping through all the necessary hoops to get Italian Hot Sauce ready for market. It's too great an idea and too damn delicious not to share with the world. So, here we are! With your help, we can keep the dream alive!
Our handcrafted recipe begins with red hot cayenne peppers, aged to perfection to ensure a rich and earthy taste. We add the classic Italian flavors of garlic and oregano to create the ultimate hot sauce for pizza, subs, and all things Italian food. Buon appetito!
Made with only five simple ingredients (peppers, garlic, oregano, vinegar, and salt), Italian Hot Sauce is preservative free, gluten free, fat free, sugar free, non-GMO, vegan, all natural, and hippy friendly.
Our ultimate goal is to bring Italian Hot Sauce to every table across America. Your generous pledge will allow us to:
Order bottles, equipment, and ingredients for larger scale productions.
Produce thousands of bottles of Italian Hot Sauce for commercial sale.
Develop an impressive online presence and social following.
Present and contribute to trade shows, local festivals, stores, and restaurants. 
Thank you for helping our hot sauce dreams become a reality! It's been quite an adventure, and we're so excited to share this journey with you. You're going to love our new Italian Hot Sauce! Check out these rewards:

campaign.story:
The Devil's Swamp is a Call of Cthulhu adventure book for the classic 1920s era, licensed by Chaosium. The book contains a series of five or more adventures set in the Hockomock swamp in Massachusetts to be used with 7th edition Call of Cthulhu RPG.
This product is produced under license from Chaosium Inc. (www.chaosium.com). Call of Cthulhu is the Registered Trademark of Chaosium Inc., and is used with their permission. www.chaosium.com
The Devil's Swamp includes adventures that can usually be run in one or two evenings. They can be run as independent one-off adventures or strung together as a mini-campaign using the same characters. All of the stories are set in the Hockomock which literally means 'the place where spirits live.'
As a member of the Bridgwater Preservation Society, you and your friends investigate the stories people plague the city and area with. The stories the police won't investigate, or quit on way too easily. Living next to the Hockomock, at the heart of what will later become known as the Bridgewater Triangle, gives you easy access to delve into any of the stories that arise. 
The Hockomock Swamp, named the Devil's Swamp by the original English settlers, is a known site for paranormal activity. Everything from Bigfoot, aliens, thunder birds, huge snakes, strange lights, Puckwudgies, Native American curses, cultists, mutilated animals and more have been reported in the area. So join me and my team as we help unravel the Mythos tied to the mysteries of the Hockomock.
The Devil's Swamp is written by Ben Burns, features the artwork of Evgeny Maloshenkov, the cartography of Bryan McWhirter, player handouts by Elizabeth Bakowski and edited by Alex Burns. In other words the entire team that produced The Star on the Shore. We are the same company, just a change of name.
Join us in completing this great adventure book, so that we can share it with the world. Please back our Kickstarter today to help make these adventures a reality.
The funds will go toward the artwork already commissioned, extra adventures by guest writer(s), allow for more artwork, commissioning of the cartography for the maps, the editing, printing and shipping.
Stretch Goals
$5,000: We successfully funded!! (UNLOCKED)
$10,000: Add in a 6th Adventure by Brian Courtemanche (UNLOCKED)
$15,000: Add in professional Cartography (UNLOCKED)
500 Backers: Add in a 7th Adventure by Christopher Smith Adair (UNLOCKED)
$20,000: Upgrade Player Handouts to be Photorealistic (UNLOCKED)
$25,000: Add in a 8th Adventure by a guest writer
$30,000: Add in a fold out removable Player Map
$35,000: Add in a 9th Adventure
$40,000: ???
Rewards
ADD ONs
You will have the opportunity to include Add Ons after the campaign is complete including purchasing extra copies, prints, the Art Book, Insanity Dice, and copies of The Star on the Shore.
Our Artist
We are always asked who does our art work. Evgeny Maloshenkov was the main artist for The Star on the Shore and will be doing 90% of the art work in Devil's Swamp. He is a professional artist from Ukraine. He now lives in Kiev working for Frogwares doing software CGI art. He still freelances commission work for several companies including Chaosium as well as New Comet Games. You can see more of his work at his portfolio site here: emaloshenkov.carbonmade.com
Page Count
While we will not guarantee any minimum page count, the first 5 adventures are almost finished, and the book is currently around 60-70 pages. The more people pledge, the more adventures we will add in and the longer the book will be. If we hit the stretch goal for 6 adventures, it will probably be 70-85 pages. If we hit the stretch goal for 7 adventures It will expand to be 85-100 pages. If we hit the stretch goal for 8 adventures, it will expand to be 100-120 pages. If we get all the way to 9 adventure modules, we could push this well over 130 pages!
The delivery time for the books includes the anticipation of the extra adventures.
Guest Writers
Our first guest writer is Brian Courtemanche. He will be joining our team at the $10,000 stretch goal level. He wrote one of the adventures in the award winning 'Doors To Darkness' book produced by Chaosium. In addition, Brian has been in Arkham Now; Terrors From Beyond; House of R'lyeh; Atomic Age Cthulhu; and More Adventures in Arkham Country for the Miskatonic River Press.
Our $20,000 stretch goal level will open up the 7th Adventure. This author worked with Brian on the award winning 'Doors to Darkness' book, Christopher Smith Adair.  https://csmithadair.com/  His works include A Cold Fire Within, Atomic Age Cthulhu, New Tales of the Miskatonic Valley, Strange Aeons II, and articles in the Arkham Gazette.
Our $30,000 and $40,000 stretch goal scenario authors will remain under wraps until we draw closer.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is almost no risk at all unless we sell a million or more copies, then there might be some delay in shipping, but I am willing to take on that challenge. Otherwise I do not see any real chance for any delays barring real life tragedy, or perhaps the stars aligning and Cthulhu rising. 

The adventures are almost finished. The initial art is complete and the artist, Evgeny, is standing by ready to draw any stretch goal art. Our cartographer, Bryan, is ready to start on the maps as soon as we fund. We are working with the same printer that created the beautiful copies of the Star on the Shore.

I have published 6 other modules before this one, including The Star on the Shore, so I am very familiar with the process, and do not expect any surprises. I have also run 8 successful Kickstarters before this one. All have been successful and either delivered on time or are currently on schedule. Several of my Kickstarters have even delivered early.

I look forward to completing this project with the same efficiency and quality that I put forward with all my projects.

campaign.story:
Make up Stories, Break the News. News@11 is a cyclical story-telling game for 4 to 11 anchors. Fill in cue cards, incorporate the topics on them into your segment as you build the story. Stories from the morning news come back in the afternoon and evening, getting stranger and more tangled each time. No points, no scoring, just a hilarious time telling the news! Lights, Camera, you’re on in 3, 2, 1...
  Learning to play News@11 is super easy!
           Want to learn more? Awesome. Here's a link to the rulebook for you readers... and a gameplay video below for everyone else.
Check out the Rule Book Here
To help you get a feel for how the game works, we gathered up some friends and recorded a play through for you. Enjoy!
For this demo, we only filled in 1 cue card each (to keep things moving). Normally you'll fill in 1 blank on each card during setup
News@11 will come in a sturdy, portable box -- easy to bring with you, and has room to sleeve your cards. Besides a full color rule book, each box is packed with high quality components:
Cue Cards (130) - Every card is unique! Each card has 1 topic supplied by us and 2 prompts to customize. You'll fill these in with your group's topics each time you play.
Segment Cards (10) - The Lead Anchor uses these to pick which Segment each Anchor delivers during a broadcast.
Producer Cards (6) - The Producer uses these to help the game move smoothly - or to cause a little chaos. No talking required to use the Producer cards!
Marker (1) - A permanent marker, used to fill in the Cue Cards. Style TBD 
Rulebook - Learn to play quickly with game play examples.
Technical Details: All cards are 63 x 88mm. The box will come with room for the cards to be sleeved.
We have 2 reward tiers available, depending on if you want to get 1 or 2 copies of News@11. Want 1 for friends, 1 for family? Got 2 gaming groups? Planning to make 1 clean and 1 naughty? Great! Get 2 copies of News@11 delivered to your door.
Shipping will be added on based on your country after you select your pledge level.
Shipping to Canada, UK, EU, and Australia will be Customs Friendly and should not incur import duty.
If we hit our funding goal, we'll be able to put even more great content in the box for you! More to come...
What are stretch goals? Great question! Once a Kickstarter project reaches its initial funding goals, stretch goals give us new targets to strive for to make News@11 even better!
The Tabletop gaming community is thriving! It's been an incredible experience as a publisher watching the community grow so much over the past few years. It's an exciting time for us as gamers with so many unique and interesting games, and I'm honored to have you consider News@11 as one of those options. 
Here are just a few reasons why we feel this project is worth your support: 
Approachable Gameplay - You can learn News@11 in just moments and get right into playing. The game is designed to give structure and flow to your experience while leaving room for players to take the story where they want it to go.
High Customizability - As you play, you're creating a customized copy of the game that's unique to your group. The topics you add can be anywhere on the spectrum of family friendly to edgy; it's up to you!
Supporting Independent Game Design and Publishing - Everything you see in this project is the product of a massive effort by several passionate, independent creators. The efforts that went into the game design, graphic design and publishing are all crafted by individuals who absolutely love our hobby. Without you, we wouldn't be able to bring these creations to life!
We're excited to partner with the Infectious Play team to bring you News@11. It's been great working with the designers (Jon Gilmour, John Burns, Ian Moss, Travis Magrum, James Schoch, Earl Tietsort). They've worked hard to refine the game's flow and tune the content to help facilitate the best possible story-telling experience. Peter Wocken,  our veteran graphic artist, helped make sure the look and feel of the components make gameplay as smooth as possible.
Greetings News Anchors!   
For those who are new to our games, welcome! For those who have supported us in the past, it's great to have you back! We're thrilled to be back on Kickstarter with our 9th project! Starting with Legacy: Gears of Time in 2012, all the way through Sagrada and Dome Crushers most recently, running these projects have each been incredible experiences, and I cannot wait to see where this one goes!
