campaign.story:
Designed by Justin Blaske (Area 1851, Mint Works), Mint Delivery is a refreshingly light pick up and deliver game for 2 to 5 players with easy-to-learn rules and exciting strategic gameplay, all in about fifteen minutes.  
Its compact size makes it easy to put in your pocket and take it anywhere. Coupling that with its approachable ruleset, Mint Delivery is a great tool for introducing new players to the genre of pick up and deliver.
Check out the Mint Delivery rules to see more detail about what makes Mint Delivery tick.
All Cards contained within a copy of Mint Delivery are printed upon Premium 305GSM blue core card stock. Mint and Truck Tokens are made of Wood and all other tokens are made from 2mm thick chipboard. All printed components will have a linen finish.   
James Hudson - Druid City Games  
Married with Board Games 
Lindsay - Shiny Happy Meeples
What's Eric Playing
What's Eric Playing - #125 - Mint Delivery [Preview]
 Board Game Geek Comments 
"...Even if pick up and deliver games are not your cup of tea try this one out and you might find a renewed interest in the genre." - MHGreenleaf
"Played a prototype yesterday and really enjoyed it. Similar to Mint Works, even though it's small there's a lot going on." - MichaelDyrud
You can download the rules here
In Mint Delivery, players take the role of a mint delivery truck driver, driving around the area taking orders for mints, then delivering them. Each player has two actions on their turn, such as moving, loading their truck, and upgrading the mints they are carrying. Once enough orders have been taken, the game ends.
Whoever has fulfilled the highest value of orders will be deemed the employee of the month and win. 
Five24 Labs on Social Media:
Facebook
Twitter
Newsletter
Discord
Mint Delivery was created after the success of Mint Works, with the idea to introduce another mechanism to non-gamers while still being interesting enough for gamers to want to bring it to the table.
I wanted to come up with another quick easy to teach game for a mechanism that I felt didn't have a lot of options that didn't take a long time to play, while also straying away from games with direct conflict between players.
Pick up and deliver seemed like a really good place to start. Since the vast majority of these types of games tend to be quite long, and have a lot of gotcha kinds of rules.
That gave me this set of constraints that I utilized for making Mint Delivery:
Has to fit in a mint tin 
Has to be taught as easy or easier than Mint Works 
Has to play quickly 
With those constraints in mind, I started the task. 
Since it was to fit in a mint tin, I decided to continue the same visual style that we used with Mint Works, and also to continue the overarching narrative of Mort from the first game. It seemed logical to me that Mort has had a lot of success with his mint making company and has started to branch out and provide mints to more than just the local neighborhoods.
That gave a great foundation for the supply/demand chain that would be the foundation of the pick up and deliver mechanism. I didn't want the mint requests to be too flat, so i added some "improved" type mints to the mix at that point. Which essentially gives us 3 forms of currency instead of just one.
From that point, it was all about creating orders for mints, a few locations to pick mints up from, and a map to lay it all out. And that's where we are now.
If you are excited enough for Mint Delivery that you just can't wait for the fully produced copies to get here from the factory, I have provided a limited pledge level.
This level will entitle you to a copy of the fully factory produced version of Mint Delivery as all other backers, but it will also include a hand made advance copy delivered shortly after the campaign ends.
The advance copies will be entirely hand made by me in my workshop and numbered. (e.g. 03/50.)
The advance copies will be of similar quality to the prototypes that you see in the review videos. See below for examples.
Photo Credit Eric from whatsericplaying.com
Because Mint Delivery is a small game in terms of physical size and weight, shipping costs are very reasonable. The manufacturing costs are low enough that VAT shouldn't be a concern.
I wish that I could provide free shipping to the majority of places, however the low price point of the game means I have very little wiggle room for costs.
That said, I will be providing free shipping within the US, and applying a discount to shipping elsewhere equal to the cost of shipping within the US. Here is a brief chart explaining the shipping costs:
* The vast majority of countries falls in this region, including: Argentina (AR), Australia (AU), Austria (AT), Bahrain (BH), Belarus (BY), Belgium (BE), Belize (BZ), Bulgaria (BG), Brunei Darussalam (BN), Canada (CA), Cayman Islands (KY), Chile (CL), China (CN), Colombia (CO), Costa Rica (CR), Croatia (HR), Cyprus (CY), Czech Republic (CZ), Denmark (DK), Estonia (EE), Finland (FI), France (FR), Germany (DE), Greece (GR), Hong Kong (HK), Hungary (HU), Iceland (IS), India (IN), Indonesia (ID), Ireland (IE), Israel (IL), Italy (IT), Japan (JP), Korea, Republic of (KR), Latvia (LV), Lithuania (LT), Luxembourg (LU), Malaysia (MY), Malta (MT), Montenegro (ME), Netherlands (NL), New Zealand (NZ), Norway (NO), Peru (PE), Philippines (PH), Poland (PL), Portugal (PT), Qatar (QA), Romania (RO), Saudi Arabia (SA), Serbia (RS), Singapore (SG), Slovakia (SK), Slovenia (SI), South Africa (ZA), Spain (ES), Sweden (SE), Switzerland (CH), Taiwan (TW), Thailand (TH), Turkey (TR), Ukraine (UA), United Arab Emirates (AE), United Kingdom (GB)
** Brazil, Mexico, Russia and any countries not previously listed fall into this category.
We have partnered up with Mr. B Games to assist in the fulfillment process to ensure that everyone gets their rewards quickly, correctly and in great condition.
I would like to support retailers who are interested in getting Mint Delivery before the game makes its way into distribution. If you're a retailer, please send me a message here on Kickstarter, or email md.retail@five24labs.com during the campaign for pricing information.
We will also be funding a re-print of Mint Works with this campaign, you can add extra copies of Mint Works at $10 each during the campaign, or later on during the pledge manager.

Note: Any add-ons that you select will be delivered at the same time as the rest of your rewards from this campaign.
Since the map doesn't change from game to game, we came up with the idea of using a mat for the game to play on during demos, it worked out so well that we have decided to add custom mint delivery mats on as add-ons to any pledge level as well.
Currently we are a small but potent team that consists of two Mad Scientists myself and Mel (you might recognize him as Mort) and our awesome testing group. 
I'd like to use this space to acknowledge and thank them. I have an amazing, excellent and dedicated group of players that tolerate my crazy ideas and endless iterations.
They are up to the task of attempting to break things, and giving real feedback as we develop projects. I can't possibly thank them enough for all the work they do for the wages of snacks and fun and mild torture (in the form of terrible game ideas.)

That said, this is still a production and things can fall behind or get off track, which could lead to the ever-present delivery delays. While I don't anticipate any problems that would through us off track, it's always possible.

campaign.story:
In Horizons, you are a star faring species taking the first steps into a new star cluster. Explore new worlds to grow your knowledge and Adapt to living in the varied habitats you discover. Expand your presence in the cluster with new colonies and Exploit the metal and energy resources you find. Ally yourself with assorted interstellar species and Acquire covert missions to increase your influence. Do all of this and you could become the dominant species in this cluster and to begin your reach into the galaxy.
5-player Setup
We love the scope and majesty of 4X games but don't look forward to hours, or even days, that it can take to play the best of the genre and we weren't wild about all the extermination. Game designer Levi Mote set out to create a friendly 4X experience in an hour-long game and, after years of development and play testing, Horizons has proven itself to be just that game – a Euro-friendly, decision-driven, 4X-style game that 2 to 5 players can enjoy in about an hour. 
Horizons has multiple paths to victory. Will you explore and ally your way to knowledge-win, or expand and exploit the worlds for a build-win? Perhaps allies and covert missions will bring you a missions-win, or you'll balance all three paths to create a well-rounded dominion. The choice is yours and the stars await. 
One of the many Mission Cards.
  We turned over one of our preview prototypes to Jon Gets Games and he delivered an amazing 1-hour video that takes you step-by-step through a three-person game of Horizons.
                        Rahdo runs through the prototype! (Note: we will be adding player count numbers on Mission cards to tell you which Mission cards to play with according to player count.)

After we reach our projects $20,000 funding goal, we've got a long list of stretch goals planned that will, hopefully, entice you and your friends to support Horizons. Spread the word, share our project with your friends, and let’s see if we can unlock things like asymmetrical player powers, more ally species, new suns for your star cluster, and lovely component upgrades.
                                           We're looking at alternatives for the punched player board that fit within the budget. For now, it will not be punched through in the final version until we can provide you with something we can all appreciate. 
Horizons will come in a box similar in size to Stone Age and will come with all of the components shown below, plus whatever you unlock through stretch goals.
Unlocked Stretch Goals added to the game:
6 New Star Classes, O, B, A, F, K and M
Blackcore and Linen Finish Cards
5 Optional Species Ally Cards with Exterminate Gameplay
5 New Asymmetrical Starter Ally Cards
Unique Faction Art for each Player Board
5 Asymmetrical Player Boards
10 New Mission Cards
5 New Ally Cards
As with our other recent projects, Sailing Toward Osiris, Food Truck Champion, and Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames & Frost, we'll be working with our European partners to produce Horizons in multiple languages. You'll be able to select the German, French, Spanish, or English version when we send out the backer surveys after the project is successfully funded.
    Rahdo's final thoughts! (Note: we will be adding player count numbers on Mission cards to tell you which Mission cards to play with according to player count.)
                                                                                                                                                             This is a full PNP file for Horizons. It included the rules, 35 double-sided hex tiles, 60 cards, and 5 player boards.  It is 113MB. There are bound to be a few adjustments as we close in on the final rules and graphic design, but this will give you a good look into the components and concepts of Horizons.
                                                It's always great to try before you buy, so why not give Horizon's a try on Tabletop Simulator. This build was created by Alexander, a frequent backer of our project, a fan of our games, and a skilled modder.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       We do everything we can to keep shipping costs low and we subsidize a substantial portion of the actual shipping fees we are charged when we fulfill your rewards.
  This project is EU Friendly, Canada Friendly, and Australia Friendly. Rewards to backers in those countries will be shipped from fulfillment hubs within their regional borders. We pay VAT when we import the games and utilizing the shipping hubs means you do not have to pay customs fees.

Gamers in Brazil, Mexico, and Russia, have a much higher risk of package "loss" once it reaches the local post offices. For this reason, we need to ship your packages by a registered delivery service like FedEx, UPS, DHL, or Global Priority. The higher costs we incur are reflected in the shipping fees added automatically when you make your pledge.
We like to support game stores around the world by offering the Kickstarter versions of our games to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release the regular retail versions into distribution, giving you a head start on your competition. You can see the Retailer 6-Pack pledge level in the right-side column of this project page.
Every game we create is a discrete project with its own development schedule and its own budget for production and marketing expenses. We bring each project to Kickstarter to give you, our fans and supporters, the opportunity to help us put the final touches on the game and to reserve your copies at the time when it will do the game the most good, both financially and creatively.

Some say that a creator should not launch a new project until their previous project is completed and delivered. That system might work for a designer who is self-publishing a game, but for an up-and-coming company like Daily Magic Games, that system is not viable. At any point in time we are working on a dozen projects in various stages of completion. Right now, for example...

10 Minute Heist: The Wizard's Tower delivered to most backers 2 months early and will hit retail stores on September 20th.
Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames & Frost shipped to 80% of backers for on-time delivery in August. The remaining 20% will begin shipping in September. Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames & Frost will hit retail stores in October.
Food Truck Champion is at the printer and we expect to deliver to backers in October. We will debut Food Truck Champion in English and German editions at EssenSpiel 2017 and release it to retail stores in November.
Sailing Toward Osiris is at the printer and we expect to deliver it to backers in February 2018. Sailing Toward Osiris will be produced in English, German, French, and Spanish and will debut at PAX East in March 2018. Sailing Toward Osiris will be released to retailers in March 2018.
Crabs! completed its Kickstarter campaign successfully on August 11th and the files have just been transferred to the printer. We expect to deliver Crabs! to backers in March 2018 and to be on retail store shelves by May 2018.
Horizons, by Levi Mote and Illustrated by The Mico, is live on Kickstarter right now, obviously. If the funding campaign is successful, our plans are to deliver Horizons to backers in July 2018, debut Horizons at GenCon 2018, then have it on store shelves in late August 2018.
Sarah’s Singularity, a time travel game with comic book appeal by Thomas Gutschmidt and illustrated by Carey Pietsch, is going out to game reviewers in early September with a Kickstarter launch planned for October 10th. If the funding campaign is successful, we plan to deliver Sarah's Singularity to backers in July 2018.
Alchemea, by Ian Stedman and illustrated by Claire Donaldson, is a reimagining of his game Magnum Opus. It is in beta testing.
Corsairs: A Valeria Adventure, by Wouter van Strien, was inspired by his game Wacky Pirates and will be illustrated by The Mico. It is in beta testing.
Spaceways, by Philip duBarry, is a sci-fi pick-up and deliver / area control game and is in beta testing. It is a standalone sequel to Horizons and will be illustrated by The Mico. 
Chocolatiers, by Isaias Vallejo, is a gateway game where players take on the role of chocolatiers boxing chocolates and is in alpha testing.
Peddlers, by Alice Davis, is a unique blend of card drafting and worker placement and is in alpha testing.
We're hoping that our track record for successfully completing and delivering previous projects will give you the confidence to support Horizons, and that the forthright communications we present when projects do hit snags will assuage any fears that we're going to screw it all up.
By the way, if you'd like to help us with any of our alpha or beta testing, please send us an email at contact[at]dailymagicgames[dot]com.
Daily Magic Games is a designer-friendly and customer-focused publisher specializing in casual tabletop games that are easy to learn and play, yet layered with strategy and depth.
Isaias Vallejo, Wizard-in-Chief, Game Designer, and Developer
David MacKenzie, Conjurer and Game Developer

We are focused on listening to what our customers have to say and making sure that we are producing the type of games you want at the high quality you demand. We are actively involved in the Comments section of each Kickstarter and keep backers up to date with plenty of updates post-Kickstarter. We like to make casual and gateway games in an effort to get more people to the table. Our games are easy to learn to help new players get in to the game faster, but they're also layered with strategy for the more seasoned players. We're based out of Seattle, Washington and like to focus on the growth and promotion of game design in the Pacific Northwest. We've even started a playtesting event network called PlaytestNW to help local designers meet each other and engage with playtesters on a regular basis. Our hope is that we're helping designers build better games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Daily Magic Games is committed to delivering quality products on time. We realize that the publication of a tabletop game can be complicated and, no matter how experienced the project creators and mangers are, some problems may occur. In an effort to reduce the likelihood of delays and mistakes, we have taken several steps to prepare for success:

1. This game project, as well as the Kickstarter campaign itself, are in the hands of two well-seasoned professionals. David MacKenzie has been running successful Kickstarter projects since 2010 (Alien Frontiers started the gaming frenzy on Kickstarter), and Isaias Vallejo comes from a digital games background as Executive Producer at Big Fish Games and has designed several successful tabletop games (Sunrise City and the "Valeria" series of games).

2. We are dedicated to backer communication and feedback. Throughout every campaign, we are as transparent about the process and as open to feedback as possible without jeopardizing production and delivery timelines. Whether the news is good or bad, you can expect us to report it honestly and openly.

3. We have done significant pre-production. All the art and graphic design for Horizons are completed with the exception of the stretch goals content. The art and design for the stretch goals content has been sketched out and is ready to push forward as soon as each goal is achieved.

4. We are working with publishing partners in Germany, France, and Spain, to bring Horizons to a wide audience, expanding our economies of scale in production and logistics.

5. We have our manufacturer lined up and ready to begin the pre-press process as soon as the files are delivered. We hope that everything goes as planned, but if something falls through the cracks, we are ready and willing to employ every tool at our disposal to get the project back on track and running smoothly.

Thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
Masters of Elements is a new expansion of the critically acclaimed Vikings Gone Wild, a game mixing with great harmony Resource Management and Deck Building.
      In this expansion, players are getting back to building their villages and fighting to impress the gods. But this time, Masters of Elements have joined their ranks!
 In Masters of Elements, each player gets to pick a Master of Elements. This Master will produce an Element Token every round that will be allocated to a Building.  
  Each player gets to draft 3 permanent Artefacts at the beginning of the game. They sit on an extra player board provided with this expansion.
Each of these Artefacts will provide powerful and asymmetric abilities to all players around the table.
  In this expansion, we wanted to move the type of decision you make from "attack vs defense" strategy to a more elaborate combo-oriented thinking.
Most Units now carry an extra function that can be activated using the Elements on your buildings!
  At the beginning of the game, everyone is given a God randomly. If we manage to unlock more than the 4 base Gods, each player is actually given 2 Gods to choose from. The special effect of this God is immediately available as soon as you reach level 3!
                                                                       Congratulation for unlocking Borr, father of Odin!
Lucky Duck Games Facebook Fan Page is here. 
Lucky Duck Games Twitter Profile is here.
Vikings Gone Wild Official Facebook Forum is here.
                             This pledge contains:
   - Masters of Elements Expansion
   - All Masters of Elements Stretch Goals Unlocked
   - Money-back Guarantee
This pledge is ideal for someone who already bought the base game on Kickstarter or in retail and is looking for a deeper and more strategic experience of the game.
  This pledge contains:   
  - Vikings Gone Wild (Base Game - Retail Version)
  - Masters of Elements Expansion
  - All Masters of Elements Stretch Goals Unlocked
  - Money-back Guarantee
This pledge is ideal for someone who has not bought the base game yet and wants to experience the most strategic experience this game has to offer.
The Base Game included in this pledge is the Retail Version, without any Kickstarter content from the first campaign.
  This pledge contains:
  - Vikings Gone Wild (Base Game - Retail Version)
  - Masters of Elements Expansion
  - It's a Kind of Magic Expansion
  - Guild Wars Expansion
  - Ragnarok Expansion (Solo/Coop experience)
  - All Masters of Elements Stretch Goals Unlocked
  - Money-back Guarantee
Get yourself the full range of experiences this game system has to offer. From the spell oriented strategy of It's a Kind of Magic to the 2 vs 2 mode of the Guild Wars expansion, or as a cooperative/solo experience to survive the flow of the Undead Army in Ragnarok, you will get it all in its beautiful Viking Glory!
The Base Game included in this pledge is the Retail Version, without any Kickstarter content from the first campaign.
     We are very excited to announce the release of 3 unique Booster Packs. Each pack is unique (no random cards) and always composed this way:  
1x Divine Favor 
1x Artefact 
10x Unit Cards 
We have built one pack per Element. We are leaving you the surprise to open them. Want to bet what is inside? :)
PS: $12 gives you 3 Packs. That is all you need.
PS2: These cards are unique and totally different from any cards we will offer you in Stretch Goal or in the expansion.
   We heard it during the entire campaign: "Give us the big box" :D  
We wanted to make sure we would provide a box big enough to cover this expansion and any future ones (yes there could be more!). So we are producing a custom-sized box almost 2 times higher than the original box in order to contain everything:  
All cards.
All boards. 
All tokens. 
All rulebooks. 
All neoprene boards (yes, you read right!).
We provide dividers by expansions and by type of cards, depending on the way you prefer to sort your cards!  
  In Vikings Gone Wild, players take the role of heads of clans fighting against each other to prove to the gods who is the best.    
During each turn, you play the cards in your hand to buy Units or Defense cards, erect Buildings and attack other players. You will have to find the right balance between investing in your economy (buildings, specials cards) and growing your army! 
     It's a Kind of Magic expansion introduces original core concepts through new Buildings, Units and a new type of card: Spells!    
  It focuses on deck manipulation and will transform your experience of Vikings Gone Wild in a very interesting, magical, way!
     Guild Wars expansion introduces new core concepts through new Buildings, Units and Defenses!    
  A brand new 2 vs 2 mode is at the heart of this expansion, but most cards can be used in a regular game.
    The Ragnarok expansion is a solo or cooperative expansion for Vikings Gone Wild.        
  In order to win, you have to defeat the Undead Army before your time runs out! Will you be able to save us all? 
   This 1st Season Pack contains the 110 Kickstarter Exclusive cards of the previous Kickstarter! We saved you the price of the box (who needs boxes anyway) to put this pack at a very affordable price! 
     We have selected the perfect fit sleeves for you - BCW 58x89 Sleeves.

Adding sleeves to a Kickstarter adds a fair layer of logistic complexity, but many struggled to find the right fit for this game before so we decided to do this for you. 
 This add-ons won't add any shipping cost, no matter the quantity you pick or the pledge you select. 
 $5 per pack of 100 Sleeves (2x50). 
 $20 per pack of 500 Sleeves (10x50).
Cards quantities per game:
Base Game: 220 cards
It's a Kind of Magic: 110 cards
Guild Wars: 110 cards
Ragnarok: 55 cards
KS 1st Season: 110 cards
5th Viking: 55 cards
3x Boosters: 36 cards
Masters of Elements: 219 as of Stretch Goal #27, can we get the last one?
  Many of you have asked for ways to upgrade their gears, and more specifically their player board! We love neoprene mats ourselves, so it did not take too much convincing to put us at work on the idea.  
Bringing these playmats to life, we wanted to bring something different enough that the upgrade would feel truly special. Mateusz spent some time redesigning our standard player pad and came up with 4 unique ones!
This add-on contains:
x1 Thor Neoprene Playmat
x1 Grendel Neoprene Playmat
x1 Ragnar Neoprene Playmat
x1 Valkyrie Neoprene Playmat
  We first wanted to have both mats joined into one large play-mat. But looking at every single play-tests we ran, tables were never big enough to put the Artefact board on top or at the bottom of the base game player mat. So we decided to separate them to give the freedom of arranging your table the way you want!
This add-on contain:
4x Masters of Elements Artefacts Neoprene Playmats
  Many of you have asked for that 5th player expansion! It took us a while to find a proper way to include only a cardboard mat. Since we will include for free a 5th Artefact cardboard pad in the Master of Elements, you only need the base game player mat.
This add-ons contain:
1x Base Game cardboard player mat.
55 cards (including 1 Starting Deck, more Missions, Units, Defenses, Odin's Path, etc).
  If you simply want to upgrade your 5th player to the full neoprene experience, this add-on is for you!
1x Hel's Neoprene Playmat.
1x Masters of Elements Artefact Neoprene Playmat.
  How to add an Add-On to my pledge?
It depends if you already pledged or not.
If you didn't already pledged, then when you do, simply change the pledge amount. You just need to add to that amount the total cost of all the add-ons you want. For instance, if you want to pledge for the Masters of Elements Expansion alone at $35, but you also want to add one pack of 500 sleeves at $20, then you'll select the $35 pledge, and change the automatically filled up "$35" by 35 + 20 = "$55".
 If you want to add something to your pledge, then go to this page which lets you manage your pledge, and change the amount. You can do so by adding the total cost of all the add-ons you want. If you chose the $35 pledge for the Masters of Elements Expansion alone and decide to add one pack of 500 sleeves at $20, then change "$35" by 35 + 20 = "$55".

Risks and challenges
Cards being the main component of Vikings Gone Wild - Masters of Elements means that this project has a lower level of risk than others, particularly those with lots of miniatures. 

That being said, outside of making sure that the game is properly prepared and choosing our partners wisely (printers, logistics, etc.), it is not impossible that we face delays from uncontrollable sources. This may cause some delay in the delivery date but rest assured that, if this were to happen, we will keep you informed about the situation.

Refund Policy

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked. 
If the refund is asked more than 60 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 10% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded of them at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Stripe.

Terms and Conditions

Any costs shown in EUR are based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign, and may change during the campaign. The price reference to consider is the price in USD. 
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

Thank you!

What this Kickstarter Core Set does is start with Gauth (a huge 275mm tall dragon) plus an additional 43 more models: character models, new sculpts, monsters and goblins. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

PRODUCTION AND FULFILLMENT

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories: 
1) Overall Non-completion 
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates 
3) We do not produce a specific model or change a specific model

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed several massive Kickstarters and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of this Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment, no matter the size, against loss and damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We have learned a lot from our Kickstarters. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that would help us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays, like ones we have control or exercise input over, are easy to solve. Other delays are out of our control, such as US Customs and Border Protection and Consumer Product Safety Commission inspections and delays. In the end we do everything possible to avoid any delay and will always update you as soon as possible.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in a specific model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for to buy it verses the cost to produce it. This event has never occurred in any of our previous Kickstarters, but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops you will have plenty of time to adjust your Pledge Manager.

We reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.

REFUND POLICY

If it is with within 14 days of the closing of this Kickstarter we will refund your entire pledge amount. After 14 days, but before the closing of this Kickstarter’s Reaper Pledge Manager, we will refund your entire pledge minus the 10% Kickstarter and Processing Fees we incur. Once the Reaper Pledge Manager closes, refund requests are subject to review and not all requests may be honored. 
 
YOUR BACKER RESPONSIBILITY IN THIS KICKSTARTER

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge in the Reaper Pledge Manager by July 31 2018 you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after July 31, 2018. 

Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics. If you confirm your pledge late (after July 31, 2018) some items may not still be available. This means that part, if not all, of your rewards may not be available and/or your pledge may be forfeit. 

You are responsible for all fees associated with the transit and acceptance by you to complete delivery. These include, but are not limited to: import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant and taxing authorities, VAT and GST due and delivery acceptance, brokerage and collection charges. 

You are required to provide correct address information and ensure this address is deliverable by normal methods before your rewards are shipped.

You must have your address correct and up to date in the Reaper Pledge Manager when we announce shipping is beginning. You may change it at any time until then. There may be a shipping surcharge associated with changing countries.

Rewards returned to us as undeliverable will be shipped again postage prepaid by the Backer. 

ALL OFFICIAL COMMUNICATIONS FOR THIS KICKSTARTER WILL BE VIA KICKSTARTER UPDATES ONLY.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

FINALLY! The container that arrived in Australia last week has cleared customs and has arrived at Aetherworks.
The Aetherworks team has started shipping! As of this morning, they are at 66% complete.
Tracking is being emailed out to backers by AusPost once the parcel is scanned in at the depot after collecting from the Aetherworks warehouse.

Update on Shipping:
European Zone Fulfillment: all orders have been shipped via container to our UK warehouse. On May 1, one of the containers  arrived at our Nottingham warehouse and was unloaded. We immediately started shipping. Many of our UK/EU backers have already gotten shipping information, and a few have already received their packages. The second container is expected to arrive on the 13th of May. Shipping will continue until all orders are gone.

Quick update for your Friday night viewing pleasure!
European Zone Fulfillment: all orders have been shipped via container to our UK warehouse. As of tonight, we have not received an update on its arrival. Once it arrives and clears customs, shipments will begin immediately to our European backers. 
Australian Zone Fulfillment: all orders have been shipped via container to our Australian partners at Aetherworks. That container is due to arrive May 17. We know this is disappointing to our backers Down Under, but if something changes with the arrival date we will update that here. Once that container clears customs, shipments will begin immediately to our Australian Zone backers.

Just to clarify a point from yesterday's update: if you would like to see if your order has shipped, please log in to the Pledge Manager and look at your account. Any shipping info will be there, if applicable. You might also want to check your spam folder in your email to see if your shipping notice may have ended up there.
The Reaper Bones 4 Pledge Manager link is https://ks.reapermini.com/bones4 
Please do not contact help@reapermini.com with questions regarding shipping; this email address is for questions  or concerns regarding lost packages, shortages, overages, or damages to your received pledge rewards.

campaign.story:
Cthulhu Wars’ original Kickstarter campaigns launched in 2013 and 2015 to stellar success. If you’re already a fan, now is the time to complete your collection!
If you have been waiting for the opportunity to get in on Cthulhu Wars, this is your best opportunity!
Cthulhu Wars is a competitive strategy game in which 2 to 8 players face-off to determine the fate of the planet. You'll recruit cultists and summon monsters, cast spells, open interdimensional gates, and awaken your colossal unearthly Great Old One!
Every game is different - as you play, you unlock new spellbooks, giving new amazing powers unique to each faction. Play is asymmetric - every faction has a unique set of rules and victory conditions.
The core game offers an asymmetric, two to four player strategy experience (up to eight players with expansions). Each player controls a faction of cosmic evil competing with its rivals for the remains of the defeated, dying Earth. Players push and battle each other to control areas, build gates, gain power, achieve personal goals, and unlock special abilities in the form of spellbooks to render their own faction supreme. The miniatures are conspicuously monstrous, appealing and evocative. 
                                                                                                                                                                                    Arthur said click a link. There's no link, just the playlist.
                “Every part of Cthulhu Wars resonated with me as both a gamer and a fan of the Mythos… A stunning looking miniatures game... great asymmetrical game play...it’s a win all around.” (Tony Mastrangeli, boardgamequest.com)
“With mechanics that make sense and brilliantly-written flavor text that is positively creepy, and you are completely plunged into the Mythos...this game is phenomenal” (Joshua Davis, gamingtrend.com)
“Everything in this game has been polished and practiced and worked on to the point of exhaustion- it's a true labor of love for the designer, Sandy Petersen, and it shows.” (Chris Foster, nerdsbreakgames.com)
"This was my best play, the best game we had…we walked away saying, 'we want to play it again.'" (Ding and Dent Episode 44)
"...this game has been brilliantly thought out on all levels and... jumps into my top 5 games no problems." (Gary Rembo, "Jokerman" on BGG)
“The game really comes alive through the factions... each player plays in a different way, which keeps play fresh and interesting from game to game.” (Shannon Appelcline, rpg.net)
“The gameplay is so intuitive, the placement of your monsters is incredibly satisfying, the combat is so streamlined, you’re not mentally exhausted after playing it … it’s an excellent, excellent game.” (Nate, 'littleturd' on BGG)
“A game that is as rewarding to the mind as it is to the eyes. Simply excellent and a game I highly recommend.” (Cyrus, fathergeek.com)
“It plays beautifully. All of the new factions and creatures slot into the core game seamlessly. And it’s fun as hell.” (Michael Langlois, michael-langlois.net)
"Cthulhu Wars boasts what are among the best plastic minis seen in any board game in the history of the genre… large and beautifully sculpted, and really draw players into the eerie world of the Cthulhu mythos." (Cody K. Carlson, deseretnews.com)
“If you're tired of the normal Lovecraft game where you're another investigator trying to lure another Old One back to sleep, than I highly suggest you try out "Cthulhu Wars" and, for once, actually mean to bring about the apocalypse.” (Andrew Dodson, playertheory.com)
“You’re getting a fun game that for all its size is reasonably easy to learn and should provide you with plenty of replay potential.” (Paul Fricker, blasphemoustomes.com)
“The twisted shapes of each faction are beautifully grotesque, rendered in surprising detail.” (Henry Glasheen, slugmag.com)
“The immediacy of this game- coupled with its easy play and approachability- makes this one of my favorite designs in this genre space… Setup and commitment are minimized. Impact and engagement are maximized.” (Michael Barnes, nohighscores.com / miniaturemarket.com)
"In three words: simple, tactical, deep…Sandy Petersen shows once again his mastery" (JEUX DE ROLE MAGAZINE)
        Below is a table for estimated shipping costs, which will be charged separately from this Kickstarter. After the campaign we will send you a survey from our pledge manager so you can provide your address, specific rewards and add-ons you want. You will also pay for shipping via the pledge manager. Cthulhu Wars is a large, heavy, board game (about 5kg or 11lbs). The shipping prices reflect this.
  For most regions, including Europe, the VAT and any import taxes are included in the shipping cost. There are some countries in which we cannot include import taxes. These include Central and South America, Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Turkey, UAE, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, and Taiwan. If this changes and we are able to pay for your import taxes on your behalf, we will update you, but we cannot do so at this time.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not our first Kickstarter. We've successfully funded nine projects in the past. Currently, the Gods War project is in manufacturing. The models for Sandy Petersen's Cthulhu Mythos for Pathfinder have shipped; the book is in layout, slated for delivery this Fall. All told, we've delivered more than 300,000 products to Kickstarter backers in the past.

The biggest risk on this project is timing. It took Onslaught 2 a month to clear US and European Customs. We've padded our delivery schedule to account for possible delays on Onslaught 3. However, this is one element of fulfillment that is 100% outside our control.

There are no other real risks. Cthulhu Wars Onslaught 3 is completely ready to start manufacturing. As soon as we receive the funds from Kickstarter, our factories will begin printing and tooling models.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

"For me, it was never about the win." I said.
The thing is...I actually mean it.
Sure from time to time it's nice to be victorious. But the experience. Being with family and friends as you share some laughs and enjoy your time together. That is what gaming is for me.
Through our reviews at  www.beardedmeeple.com, we hope to share our passion by introducing you to a wide range of options. Our board game reviews are designed to be short and informative. Give you an overview and help you find the right game for your table. Bringing people together. Building friendships. Creating memories.
Thousands of games each year = miss opportunities.
WE NEED YOUR HELP...and certainly appreciate it too!
The premise of this campaign is very simple. We are attempting to raise funds for technical upgrades, travel to conventions and just continue to help spread the love of gaming.
Any support is appreciated.

campaign.story:
Ninjitsu! is a quick and simple card game suitable for ninjas as young as 8. A sequel to last year's hit game Scuttle!, the two games can be played separately or shuffled together for pirate-ninja mayhem!
Ninjitsu! takes 5-10 minutes to play, and each game is totally different.
All stretch goals unlocked, including:
10 additional promo cards, which won't be available in the retail copy of the game!
A free additional expansion for anyone backing at the NINJA MASTER level or higher!
Linen-finish cards, tuck boxes for the expansions, and a larger, sturdier box!
8 unique arts added to the base game + expansions!
All pledges at the NINJA MASTER level or higher will get a free copy of Heavy Weather, a new 14-card expansion that adds fun weather effects to the game!
"Simultaneously simple, devious, and rich in strategy...a great game for anyone of any age." - GeekDad
"Ninjitsu! is simple, to the point, fast, and fun...expect this game to surprise you with its stealthy entertainment." - Father Geek
"It’s a great game. Definitely check this one out - if you own Scuttle!, this is a must-buy.” - Brian's Got Game
"Suitable and interesting for all ages...Ninjitsu! excels." - Plumpy Thimble
"I was impressed with the level of complexity in such a simple package." - Peace Love & Games
"The kids can enjoy it, the parents can enjoy it - it's just all round fun and cute!" - The Kwaranteen
"An aggressive, fun, and addictive punk rock experience. The Ramones would love this game." - Nonstop Tabletop
“I really enjoyed the game - looking forward to playing some more!” - Stephane
“It’s a twist on some of the old, classic card games…it makes it new and fun and adds some new mechanics.” - Tracy
-To Die For Games
Each turn in Ninjitsu! is simple - you either play a card, draw 2 cards, or swipe a treasure from an opponent. That’s it! Cards can be played as treasure or as an action. Every card has a different ability, and the first player to reach 21 treasure is the winner.
Ninjitsu! is fully compatible with Scuttle! - just shuffle the two games together and you're ready to go! Itintroduces hidden treasures, which are played face-down in front of you. These can be stolen by your opponents, but watch out! Some hidden treasures are trapped; swipe the wrong card, and pay the consequences!
Check out the free print-and-play!
Everyone who gets the game through Kickstarter will also be sent a special promo card: Jellybean Ninja. 
This colorful character lets you guess what treasure you’re stealing. If you’re correct, you are rewarded with a great bounty!
Our stretch goals will unlock other promo cards as well - check out the stretch goal chart below! 
Like all Jellybean Games, Ninjitsu! is simple enough for young gamers to enjoy, but with enough strategy to engage grown-ups as well. The hidden treasures add a unique bluffing element to the game and keep everyone engaged at all times. 
Is that treasure going to guarantee your opponent victory...or is it a carefully laid trap? There’s only one way to find out! 
The Traps! expansion offers 14 new cards, including a whole new type of trap: cards with long-lasting effects! Stealing treasure has never been so risky, with new traps which prevent you from drawing, swiping, or even playing hidden treasures of your own!
With more treasure, more ninjas (the fiendish Master of Tricks, the devious Master Thief, and the dastardly Master of Escape) and more ways to bamboozle your opponents, this Ninjitsu! expansion will totally change the way you play the game. 
An ancient grimoire has been uncovered, unleashing the secrets of elemental magic! These 15 cards add a unique twist to the game, and can be shuffled into any game of Ninjitsu! OR Scuttle! to add a little magic touch.
Give yourself the power of Flight, Alchemy, Healing, and more! The magical tome’s abilities will leave your opponents stunned as you duplicate your cards, transmute treasures, and invisibly steal their cards…
Combining either Traps! or the Supernatural expansion with Ninjitsu! adds the fourth suit to the game, which means the game can be used as a standard deck of playing cards.
Seize the powers of the elements with these unique player abilities! Master the forces of nature to crush your opponents.
At the start of each game, each player is dealt an element - they choose which of the two elemental powers to use and play the rest of the game with that ability.
Will you use the powers of Fire to protect your treasure, or to steal cards from your opponents? Will your Earthly abilities give you a boost at the start of the game, or grow your treasures? Will the power of Heart be enough to overcome your opponents? There’s only one way to find out!

I love Kickstarter. I've backed many of my favorite games through the platform, and thanks to the community we built with our previous projects, Jellybean Games is able to continue its mission: to make family-friendly games for everyone.
Ninjitsu! is our fourth game, and we’re so excited to share it with everyone. But without your support, we can’t make it! As you can see from the review copies, the game is fully designed, the rules rule, and the art is all complete; all we want now is your help to print the game and distribute it around the world.
Ninjitsu! is the fifth project from Jellybean Games. The company was formed to bring you awesome experiences for gamer kids (and their parents) which can also be enjoyed by the wider gaming community.
Our aim is to make games for kids that grown-ups love.
All the money we raise will go towards making Ninjitsu! even better, and furthering development on all our future games.
If you like the game, please support the project (every dollar helps!) and tell your friends...especially if they have kids, know kids, love kids, or love great games and gorgeous art!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our first game, Scuttle!, delivered on-time to most backers (and only slightly late to the rest). 
Our second game, Dracula’s Feast, is now shipping.
Our third game, The Lady and the Tiger, is about to hit the printer.

We have learned a lot of valuable lessons from our first few campaigns, and we are confident that this game will arrive by the anticipated delivery date at the very latest. The game has been going through playtesting for months now, and the vast majority of the art is complete.

Once the campaign wraps up, all we need to do is put the finishing touches on everything, and send it to the printer!

That’s it!

We are renowned for keeping our backers in the loop through our comprehensive updates. When you back a Jellybean Games campaign, you know you’re in good hands!

As well as that, we are offering a money-back guarantee. If you decide that Ninjitsu! isn’t for you within a month of receiving it, you can return it for a full refund, no questions asked.

If you have any questions about any part of the campaign, you can message us through Kickstarter or email contact@jellybean-games.com for a prompt response.

updates.update_userinfo: Meow! has 3 days left on Kickstarter!

Hey Ninja-fans!
It's been a while since I updated - you'll be glad to know that Ninjitsu! continues to do well. I play it a lot (particularly at cons) and it's just one of my favourite games I've designed. Is that okay to say? Hopefully, cos I'm saying it!
That's right: I, Peter C. Hayward, designer of Ninjitsu!, quite like the game. You heard it here first.
SPEAKING OF GAMES (i'm real good at segues) - since Ninjitsu!, we haven't done a $9 Kickstarter, and we figured it was time!

Hey!
As I mentioned in our last update, Brains! is now live on Kickstarter. Some people were a little confused by how it worked, so I thought I’d dive in and give some more details:
The Treasure Hunters series (named by Night1505 in the comments of this very campaign) wasn’t always intended to be a series! The first game, Scuttle!, was based on a game I used to play as a kid, Cuttle (which, obviously, was not a series).

Hey! 
Games have started landing at people’s houses! That’s right - games are here, and they are beautiful.
We've been getting some questions, so I thought I'd go through and answer all of them in a single place:
Where is my game?

We just received confirmation from Quartermaster Logistics that fulfillment has begun for our U.S. backers! They expect all U.S. packages to be shipped out by Friday, August 17th.
Shipments from our EU, Australia, Asia and Canada depots shouldn’t be far behind -- we’re just waiting for the official confirmation from each depot (and we’ll let you know as soon as we receive it!).
Over the last weekend, most of the Jellybean team attended Gen Con, which is the largest tabletop gaming convention in North America! campaign.story:
Tired of having to choose what game to play? Why not play more than one at the same time? Sure, those other games are great. That's why Gameception wants you to continue playing those while you play it. It's the meta-game that plays all day.
Card Examples
From "The Singer", which says "If someone else sings a song" to "The Power Gamer", which says "If someone else tells a player what to do on their turn." Get someone to slip up and score your card! 
Gameception: We have to go Deeper Expansion
The expansion to Gameception focuses on more games! This 15 card expansion pack is 5 new Gameception cards that are about games that can be played inside Gameception, and 10 new “Ninja!” cards. At the start of game day, deal each player one of these Ninjas along with your Gameception cards. You may reveal it casually, you may hide it in the bathroom for someone to find, you may hide it in a book and pass it on! Doesn’t matter how you get them to look at it, if they look at the card, steal their Ninja and score it! What’s best? You get to keep your own, and use it all over again! Let the sneakiness continue with Gameception: We have to go Deeper! 
                Backerkit

updates.update_userinfo: It is on it's way to you!
updates.update_content:
The time has come to sound the trumpets! I have received news from the fulfillment center that all orders have been sent out. Whew! So glad to finally hear that, and judging by the emails you all are, too!
If you added any optional games, those will be in a separate package going out hopefully this week. Please don't be alarmed if you don't see your whole order.
A tinge of bad news, though.... At the start of negotiations with the fulfillment center said tracking emails to every order would be sent out. Awesome, right? Apparently, miscommunication didn't turn that option on. So that explains why emails haven't gone out. I'm trying to see if I can get a list of tracking emails to help facilitate ease, but no word yet. Hopefully all get it right away and there are no issues.
Today I got confirmation that the product left the warehouse to the fulfillment center.

updates.update_userinfo: Back from New Year's and ready to move forward
updates.update_content: So I approved the layout proof before the new year and now they are running a full print run proof. Once I look it over for any last minute changes, I hit print. I know I said that last update, but I actually thought the layout proof was the final proof. :( Miscommunication on my part, so I apologize for 'speeding it up' a bit. Good news is that the final layout on real card stock and what you'll see when you open up your copy is almost in my hands. I just want to tell them print and rush it so I have it, but then I don't get to catch all the minor mistakes. Keep with me just a wee bit longer!

Hope everyone had a great holiday season and a great start to the new year! We have our manufacturer set in place, files out to them and a deposit given. Waiting on a sample to go gung ho. We'll see! :)
Hope this year is a great year for games across your table!

updates.update_userinfo: Looks like Manufacturing contracts will be finalized soon
updates.update_content: After all the back and forth between factories and a sluggish response sometimes because of all the conventions in November, looks like things are progressing and I should have an answer in a week or two! :) Slow and steady. I know you all are excited! I am, too. Your excitement and enthusiasm only bolsters mine! :P As we start getting to the "out of my hands" step, I'll try my best to keep you all in the loop!

I know it's been lacking updates! I've been hoping to overcome this wall and then happily update! However, this is taking longer than I would have liked
I don't know if you all know this, but there was a Chinese government crackdown recently and manufacturers were hit hard. As days turns to weeks to months without responses, I feared the worst. I tried to wait til things were more locked in place before updating, but as time ticked on, you deserve to know. I don't like making excuses but control is something I don't have here.  This is why I set it a year out! I know things aren't smooth and wanted to make sure I didn't miss deadlines! The good news is, I'm in a great place in talks with a new manufacturer, and it's looking solid!

So power came back on late last night and while I'm still not settled from the evacuation, we're trying to pick up the pieces bit by bit. To those emails asking about damage and safety, we all are alright! Wife, kids, and pets are all aces! The house is a different story, but all the damage is mostly cosmetic except for one outside wall. Could have been much worse if it had been a direct hit as forecasted. Nothing we can't rebuild and replace. So thank you for the warm wishes!

I still have a ton of work getting this back to normal, I just wanted to let you all know the current status. Give me a few days and it's all back to work on you know what!

campaign.story:
Thank you for all the support, find out more on our website "bitemecutie.com" 
Follow us on Social Media: Facebook - Twitter - Instagram -Youtube
 What is bite me cutie?
"bite me cutie" is a brand and company which delivers a fun card game containing chibi and kawaii creature-infused food. This game was inspired by my love of animals and food. I created "bite me cutie" as a way to bring awareness to endangered animal species. Each character aka CUTIE has a story that comes from the heart... My heart.
  Every design from "bite me cutie" is created and designed by, Thien Vuong. They all have a cute lore.
  Every game package comes with 3 decks: "CUTIE DECK", "FLAVOR DECK", & "EFFECT DECK". The goal of the game is to collect the most cuties by the end of the game, the player with the highest tallied cutie class points wins!
   OFFICIAL HOUSE RULES:
* At the beginning of your turn draw one card out of the FLAVOR DECK & EFFECT DECK.
* When your turn ends say "Done" to let the other players know that your turn is over.
* Players can have a maximum of 10 cards in hand, every card after that must be discarded until you have only 10 cards in hand.
* When it's your turn you can use as many EFFECT CARDS & COLLECT as many cuties as you can afford. STRATEGIZE!
* When you COLLECT a CUTIE it is replaced by another CUTIE CARD from the CUTIE DECK. Rinse & repeat until all CUTIES are COLLECTED.
* When a cutie's bite point is reduced to zero its' class points will not count until healed by a buff card.
* Each deck has a discard pile next to them, once you run out of cards from the respected decks shuffle the discard pile to have a new deck to draw from.
* The player with the highest class points wins! They become titled the "Cutie Chef" for this battle.
* If any players have the same amount of class points the player with the most cuties & and matching flavors win!
* When the last cutie card is collected no more cards can be drawn from the deck and everyone has one last turn to deal out their trap and buff cards to knockout and heal their cuties. Trap cards that bring cuties back to field are negated.
 STORY LORE.
In the not so distant future, a world where many animals have faced extinction, over poaching, and harsh environment, exists "bite me cutie". Cuties are creatures made from the SPIRAL DNA of animals long gone by imprinting the DNA traits of that animal into what ever object the spiral DNA is placed on. The first CUTIE was created when our mascot "CUTIE" aka a slice of cheese pizza was infused with a happy trait. After that humans went over and beyond experimenting with infinite combinations to make all kinds of cuties in order to cope with the loss of real animals in their current age. Though a few animals have survived throughout the ages, things have only gotten harder for these animals fighting near extinction. That's why we have to fight to preserve these animal and cuties to alter history. Learn what you need in order to collect cuties and help them grow and live. 
That's right, this game is about animal preservation, BAM! Didn't see that coming.... right?
Be the first to have access to our exclusive merch! All pledges above $10 unlocks the ADD-ON SHOP! Shirts, posters, & more to add a lil'extra CUTE to your collections. :)
       INTRODUCING "THE CHEFS" YOUTUBE COLLABS YOUTUBERS: 
RealTDragon - D-Piddy - Caleb Hyles - BeatDownBoogie
Starting from a sketch pad > to Illustrator > to After Effects > back to Illustrator for the final deck. So many steps, right? Overall each card takes about 10 hours to make individually, from early stage sketches to final story & card design. Now just multiply that by 70+ cards and you have "bite me cutie"! Hours of my life devoted to something that I hope won't disappoint you.
THE ORIGIN STORY.  
Hello my name is Thien Vuong and I'm an artist. I've been making online video content on the "RealTDragon" Youtube Channel for the past 6 years, and through this project I wanted to showcase that anything is possible if you can dedicate your heart and mind to it. Designing and creating illustrated characters was never in my skill set but through creating this passion project, "bite me cutie", I was able to build my skills as an artist. Through persistent grit, I made my dream of becoming a well versed graphic artist a tangible goal. Inspired to create cute animal and food designs inspired by the kawaii/chibi art style and culture of Japan! Before this project, roughly starting December 2016, I could barely sketch out my ideas. However, after spending thousands of hours to make "bite me cutie", I can confidently say that I have achieved something I would never have been capable of otherwise. "bite me cutie" is a reminder to myself and to other creators to never limit yourself, don't make imaginary boundaries... Just do what makes you happy. <3 
HELP US MAKE THIS A REALITY.  
This has been an on-going passion project for me that I feel could really be a great way to spend time with friends, family, and people you've just met. You can play "bite me cutie" anywhere, whether it be at a friend gathering, card game night, Anime & Comic Conventions, or pizza party. I felt that the Kickstarter community and platform would be a great way to gauge interest for "bite me cutie" and allow me to send the package straight to you!
All the cards are custom designed, sized, and each deck will have over 100+ cards. My initial goal for this project is to raise $5,000 in order to fulfill the minimum quantities to start producing the cards at top notch quality. 75% goes to production costs, 15% goes straight back to your rewards, & 10% are to pay the rest of the payments and fees.
Get a shout out on our Social Media! Be featured on our website! Be a cutie!
Not mandatory, but some fun goals to reach. When all are achieved a special gift will be placed in all $20+ pledges. :)
Special Thanks:
❤ Much love in appreciation to everyone that helped inspire me and help get this project going! Trung Vuong, Tin Vuong, Matthew Feinberg, Katy Johnson, Steven Ngyuen, Alex Lena, Gwen George, Minh Bui, Akyra Ingalls.
Kickstarter Video Music: OmniBoy - DownTown Drizzle (https://soundcloud.com/omniboi/downtown-drizzle-1)

Business Contact: bitemecutie1@gmail.com
WHAT'S NEXT?
The "bite me cutie" campaign will run for 30 days and will end in June. If we meet our goal, the bite me cutie card game (with the original backer rewards) will be put into production immediately! To get to you as soon as possible. The process takes approximately 2-3 months for production to complete and 1-2 months to ship all items to our warehouse. Approximately being able to be in your hands this summer!  As soon as the card game and reward items are in hand we will make multiple announcements here and on all social media and shipments will begin. Additional Stretch Goals? Any funds that are over our original goal amount will be used to fund our stretch goals. All funds beyond that will be reinvested into future "bite me cutie" projects.

-> version FR <-
  Two parallel campaigns were done for DIG. The total funding goal equals the sum of both campaigns. For more details see March 19th Update.
                                           The Hill hides many treasures and all it takes to collect them is to DIG! However, these are not the only things the Hill hides... Creatures and traps await, the galleries you will create might either mean wealth or despair.  
Delve into the hill and gather ten gems to win the game! Take some risks, push your luck, hire recruits to dig deeper and win favours of companions (Knight, Wizard, Scout, Hunter...) to protect your galleries from the many creatures (Thieves, Skeletons, Orcs..) and traps the Hill hides.  
DIG finds its path between adventure, strategy, luck and resource management. In this card-driven game for 2 to 4 players ages 10 and up, fun meets strategy, luck meets roleplaying and fantasy meets pixel art design within 20 to 45 minutes.  
DIG is easy to learn. It is a great game if you are looking for adventure in an universe filled with eye-catching 8-bit graphics.
DIG was designed with the following principles: keep the mechanics simple, mix strategy and push-your-luck, propose a fantasy RPG atmosphere and give the game a retro look from the NES golden age. The result is a neat game which has received great reviews all around the globe. While easy to learn, DIG will challenge you to take some risks in order to enjoy it to the fullest. Whether you choose to dig carefully alone or gather as many Precious Stones as you can to hire a Companion, the game will always feel different each time you will play it. With your help, I intend to give the game more depth and add a competitive aspect with the addition of new trick cards, creatures and bonuses that will extend the already entertaining gameplay.
        In addition to the core game I also designed a playmat. This mat is absolutely not mandatory to play the game, I created it because I love to play games on a board and I think some of you might like boards and playmats as much as I do. It matches perfectly the pixel-art design of the cards. The mat will be made of thick neoprene rubber and will allow up to 4 players to dig in dedicated cards slots. Companions will fit and sit nicely at the Tavern's tables and, of course, each player will have room to keep the cards and Gems she has collected.
      DISCLAIMER: the following videos were made with prototypes (see "We did it" update fur further details) - cards sizes and components quality are below the final product's.
How to play video ENG by Bearded Meeple
How to play video FR provided by 
   How to play video GER
  1. "Dig" by drawing one card at a time
2. Collect the Precious Stones
3. Hire a Recruit for 5 Crystals 
4. Put your Recruit on a card to start a Gallery
*Whenever you place a Recruit, draw another card right after and add to it the Gallery!
5. When your turn comes choose either to "dig" in your Gallery(ies) - add one card per Gallery you own... or choose to "dig" aside from them an either collect the card drawn or choose to place a Recruit on it to start a new Gallery.
6. For each set of 5 cards a Gallery creates a Gem!
When your turn comes you can choose either to"dig" aside from your Gallery(ies), close one of your Galleries (i.e. retreive everything in it) or push your luck and try to create more Gems and even to draw special cards...
7. Some will make your Gallery(ies) wealthier...
8. ...but other can mean despair.
9. Dig faster and safer by hiring one or several Companions with unique abilities!
 The first player to gather 10 Gems wins the game and becomes THE KING OF THE HILL!
          The core game contains quite some cards - over 140! - but, with your help I'd like to add some more! Not just to acheive a higher Hill, but also to add new mechanics, new trick cards and more Companions - in short: to extend the gameplay!
    The following are honest, unpayed and unbiased reviews. Every reviewer did an awesome job. If you like what they do, please subscribe to their channels, have a look at their blogs/websites and even think of supporting them through Patreon or any other way you prefer.
                   Check out Analog Games' awesome website to learn more on DIG's creation:
     Several months ago I decided to change my way of life drastically, I have always played tabletop games and was constantly creating some but I used to work in the cinema industry. Therefore, I started my micro-enterprise to handle every legal aspect of the creation and the paperwork, playtested my ideas a lot and figured out that the time had come for me to make one step forward. So here I am, submitting my very first game to you. Well, actually I did a first Kickstarter for DIG but I decided to cancel it since there were a few things I did not take in consideration. 
Luckily, I met Daniel from Board Game Circus who offered his help and support to rise a new campaign. He and his teammate Alexander have given me great advice on how to avoid traps and how to build a great project from start to finish.   
So here I am - really excited about your feedback and ready to work my ass off to improve the game with your help! In the end, my biggest wish is to succeed in this project so that I can give you more of them. Thank you if you choose to back my project, thank you if you read so far, thank you for taking the time to wonder what DIG is about!
    Please note that prices other than Euros (€) are estimated according to the exchange rate available at the time the campaign was launched.
    Check out Board Game Circus' website for more details on board game marketing, promotion and other services they provide!
  Stay tuned, subscribe to my social media channels and receive exclusive news on DIG's development and upcoming Mangrove Games projects!

This is the fourth project from Vile Genius Games, producing board games for your domination needs! We’re dedicated to bringing you the best in fast, zany, sci-fi fun. Pledge $100 to get Rocket Cats PLUS all of our other games, all in one sweet package!

  Just Got Played's awesome review of Rocket Cats in Space!
The very entertaining Brian Fiore and Patrick Siebert from Just Got Played did a great review of Rocket Cats in Space! Also check out their webpage.
Twist Gaming on Twitch has an awesome review of Rocket Cats in Space!
The extremely fun and competitive group over at Twist Gaming did a review and play through of Rocket Cats in Space!
  Each turn, you have 5 seconds to flick your Cat Admirals! Connect planets to score routes, or use your cats to knock your enemies off-course. Once your 5 seconds are complete, check to see how many Routes you’ve completed. Each one connected by your cats is yours - claim it for points, and see if you’ve won!
 Your 5 seconds will be tracked by your opponents:
For every cat you have on Planet Zoom, you’ll get an additional two seconds! Do you want to store your fleet there for extra time, or keep them zipping around the galaxy, scoring you some sweet sweet routes?
 During the countdown, flick your Rocket Cats as many times as you can! (But not your opponents’ - you’ll have to send them off-course by ramming them. Cats are bad pilots.) If one of your Rocket Cats flies off the board, you only have a few seconds to flick him back into play!
  If you’ve managed to complete any Routes, claim those cards, and add them to your collection. Do you now have ten points worth of cards? If so, you win!  
This is the fourth project from Vile Genius Games, producing board games for your domination needs! We’re dedicated to bringing you the best in fast, zany, sci-fi fun. Pledge $100 to get Rocket Cats PLUS all of our other games, all in one sweet package!
Evil Genius Deathray enables you to design and craft a devious machine of global domination. Tales from the Tavern has you taking on the role of a bard, sharing the epic tale of a goblin’s death. And in Thwarted!, players assume the roles of villains attempting to take down the superheroes of a city.
Rocket Cats in Space! is the newest addition to our line-up, and we’re excited to bring it to your shelf. But we can’t make it without you! Tell your friends, and consider pledging - with your help, we can bring hours of feline fun to the world!
 How to Play Rocket Cats in Space!
 Twist Gaming's excellent play through of Rocket Cats in Space!
          Let introduce the team that has brought you Rocket Cats in Space!
  Jasmine Butler-Davis Co-Game Designer Rocket Cats in Space!

Jasmine Butler-Davis is a game designer and marketing professional in Pittsburgh, PA. When she's not convincing strangers to playtest spacecat-themed board games, you can find her knitting, sewing, or spinning yarn. Her games have been featured on the League of Gamemakers and on both seasons of Tabletop Deathmatch.
 Pete Butler-Davis Co-Game Designer Rocket Cats in Space!
  MARK SIERENS Big Bossman
Mark's gaming background starts way back in 1983 when his mother brought home his first game system the Atari 2600. He has been gaming ever since. Mark has owned every console system released since then - even a Turbografx 16. He started MMOs with Dark Sun Online on the TEN network. He beta tested Ever Quest. He has played almost every MMO released since then. Mark started with tabletop gaming in 1994 with an excursion into Magic: The Gathering and Dungeons & Dragons. This started a love affair with tabletop gaming that has lasted until this day.  
Each Saturday he host game day in his home where his game group play games from a variety of genres. His love of gaming is one reason why Vile Genius Games was formed to bring fun, interesting, and exciting games to the world. Corrupting a few minds in the process doesn’t hurt either.
   MANNY AGUILERA ART DIRECTOR  
Manny has illustrated for many high end clients including Disney, and Carnival Cruise Lines. His illustrations have been used on everything from vehicle wraps, t-shirts, and promo items as well as advertising and packaging. When he's not drawing for clients, he's lending his artistic talents to causes like St. Jude's and the American Cancer Society for all different kinds of fundraising efforts. Manny earned his BFA in Graphic Design from Miami International University of Art & Design in 2003.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We strive to do our best to keep our backers up-to-date with all the latest news on the project. We use Kickstarter updates and social media to keep you as informed as possible as to the status of your items. However, in this business, some uncertain and ever-changing factors are beyond our control, such as holiday work schedules, customs, quality control, inspection delays, inclement weather and dock strikes and few other issues. Try as we might, we have little to no control over these issues. However, we assure you that you will be the first to know if any delays are going to happen, as we learn them.

We ship your item or items to you through various fulfillment partners located around the world. We do this to keep expenses as low as possible and we pass those savings on to you. That is why we offer great shipping rates on our projects. 

We reserve the right to combine the shipping of any and all products for multiple projects if the shipping runs close to the same time and we feel we can ship them within a reasonable time frame (30 days) of our fulfillment center receiving them. If there is going to be a delay shipping for this reason we will notify you as soon as possible. You will always have the right to pay additional fees to get expedited delivery on orders once they have been received by the fulfillment warehouse.

Even though we work with excellent fulfillment partners, shipping issues, while uncommon, can sometimes occur. Our quality control team double-checks each product for damage before sending them out. However, there is a small chance that your items may get damaged during shipping. If your package is damaged, please contact us so we can assist you.

There are some areas we’re unable to ship to without making special arrangements. If you’re based in Brazil, Russia, (other relevant countries), please get in contact so we can work out how to get the game to you safely.

Relaunch date planned
We are excited to tell you that Rocket Cats in Space will relaunch towards the end of the year. Right now we are aiming for November 6th as the new launch date for Rocket Cats in Space! 

We are currently showing off the game in several events over the next few months.

BGG Spring

Hello backers,

For the better part of 3 years now this Kickstarter profile has used my personal name Mark Sierens. However since I will be running for Mayor of the Town of Davie, the Florida Elections Commission has given me an opinion that I cannot continue to use Kickstarter to raise funds for any projects that use my personal name. Since this profile is using my personal name the ruling for the FEC is that it could appear that people pledging could be attempting to pledge to my campaign over the legal limits allowed.

After talking with the FEC, my lawyer, and Kickstarter, it was decided that the profile name will be changed to Vile Genius Games. Since this is the Kickstarter we use for the company to get our games funded, this was a great compromise and easy to transition to. Nothing will change in regards to your pledges, rewards, or how we service our backers. The only thing that will change is instead of backing Mark Sierens, the name will be Vile Genius Games.

It is tough to make an update like this stating we have not reached our goal. At this time we are going to take a step back and take all the feed back we received on the project and relaunch later this year. We are not giving up on Rocket Cats in Space and we will bring this game back to Kickstarter. We want to thank all of you who have backed the game since the beginning. Thank you for being supporters of us and we will be posting updates as we move forward with this and other projects.
