*✧ UPDATES ✧*
Reveal #1: Game Grumps DLC!
Reveal #2: The Cast of BSP!
Reveal #3: BANJO-KAZOOIE & MINECRAFT JAMS?!
Reveal #4: YOUR DOG IN BSP?!
Butt Sniffin Pugs is a city-life exploration game for 1-2 players about pugs, butt sniffin', and friendship!
In other words...it’s a game about using “pug powers” to explore daily, creative, and goal-oriented tasks in the unique world of "Central Bark"!
Inspired by games like Animal Crossing, Banjo-Kazooie, and Neko Atsume: Kitty Collector, we want to create an interactive virtual world that all ages can enjoy.
Projected Release: Q1 2018 on Mac, Windows, and PS4
If you don't know what Kickstarter is: you can buy different editions of the game by clicking the tiers on the right side of this page and if we reach our goal, the game will be developed and you will receive everything you ordered at the release of the game! 
In case we don't reach our goal, don't worry: you don't have to pay anything!
    Local Cooperative City-Sim Game: Butt Sniffin Pugs is a 1-2 player game like Animal Crossing with local multiplayer only right now but with online multiplayer as a future stretch goal!
Every Central Bark is Unique: Central Bark is a dense, procedurally-generated world unique to your game. With it's day / night cycle, dynamic music, and various worlds you can be sure that every time you play you'll experience something new!
Define Your Own Fun: Want to unlock all of Central Bark by solving all the Day, Noon, and Night quests? Want to just mosey around catching bugs and fish to upgrade your treehouse? Want to just talk with the local dogfolk? BSP allows you to progress the way you want to play!
Pug Fashion - PUG. FASHION. Need we say more? Deck out your pug with the latest and greatest threads with everything from a mustache to a tutu, ugly sweater, or even unicorn onesie. Or maybe deck out your treehouse or park with the latest furniture in stock! With new items available everyday, the possibilities are endless!
AN ACCESSIBLE DOG CITY-SIM GAME!
  DISCOVER NEW WAYS TO PLAY EVERY DAY, MONTH, AND SEASON!
As Central Bark flows from day to night, different quests, characters, and events will appear. The interweaving morning, noon, and night quests combined with the other park activities make it so that no matter the hour, Central Bark is always alive with new ways to play!
CUSTOMIZE & UPGRADE A PUGGY TREEHOUSE!
  MAKE YOUR OWN DOG IN GAME!
  What's the recipe for Butt Sniffin Pugs? Well, it kinda looks like a nice stack of pancakes...
Having customization rewards emphasize the “just about having fun” philosophy that BSP is all about. This can be unlocked by either:
Solving Morning, Noon or Night Quests
Or attaining “Bones” through daily, creative or goal oriented tasks to buy items + upgrades
DON'T BE LIMITED BY YOUR POWERS...UNLOCK CENTRAL BARK THROUGH EXPLORATION!
    To purchase an add on, all you have to do is:
Click “Manage Your Pledge” (or click here). 
Click "Change your pledge"
Add the costs of the add-ons to your pledge amount without changing your tier...That’s it! 
(We'll ask for all the details in the backer survey after the campaign.)
We're honored to have Luke Silas from Anamanaguchi aka KNIFE CITY as our composer and Dave Shumway from Magic Leap as our Sound Designer! Butt Sniffin Pugs will have a dynamic soundtrack that ebbs and flows depending on what time of day it is, where you are in the park, how much progress you've made in an area and more! Listen below for an example of what Central Bark will sound like!
    Butt Sniffin Pugs takes place in Central Bark, a giant dog park deep in the heart of New Yorkie City. From to the gorgeous Corgivatory Garden, to the luscious lakeside near Beaglesda Fountain, Central Bark is home to many areas for pugs to explore!
But the park just isn't the same anymore now that the humans are trying to advance their construction into the dog's domain. It's up to the pugs to save Central Bark and help Mayor Griffey out!
THE TEAM
Gabe & Michelle Telepak together work as the independent collaborative game studio that is SpaceBeagles. With Gabe serving as Butt Sniffin Pugs' Director he's always running around (no literally he's always running) contributing everything from game design, to art, animation, marketing, while at the same time preparing to be a future dad!
Thankfully he has Michelle. Michelle handles all the icky planning stuff as BSP's Producer handling everything from project management, to finances, partner relationships, event planning...you know, the business stuff. (Somebody's gotta do it!)
Theory Georgiou is the man responsible for making all the pug butts sniffable and everything else as BSP's Lead Developer. He also programmed the entire prototype himself, HOLY BUTTS! Theory will be contributing to BSP's gameplay design and feature planning, as well as developing Central Bark's puzzles, randomly generated layout and animal AI. What if we reach our online stretch goal?...he'll handle that too! GEEZ, is this guy human?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Okay, time for some real talk. Making games is hard...and making a game that doesn’t fall short of your expectations or our claims is even harder.

That’s why we waited a year to launch this Kickstarter. We thought about launching this campaign in 2015, but we thought it’d be a better idea to go on a press tour for a year and show you all what we made in person!

We also wanted the opportunity to all work together as a team for a year so that we could have more clarity on what BSP would be. Once 2016 began, we quietly began working on our Kickstarter and developing our game beyond the prototype. In the time we’ve spent building our vertical slice build of BSP, we’ve become very confident in our ability to deliver on this goal.

Thankfully, we have lots of assistance! The AbleGamers Charity has years of research and experience in game accessibility design and on a case-by case basis they've designed countless controllers so that people with disabilities could experience the joy of videogames. They’ll be helping us meet our accessibility goals for both our game and our controller.

And we have our friends at IndieBox and Fangamer! Our friends at IndieBox are professionals at producing all kinds of merch for indie games and will be taking the controller production off of our plate. And thanks to Fangamer, we won’t have to worry about reward fulfillment and can focus on the game instead.

Overall, we believe that with our passion to make an accessible game that's just about just having fun, the support from our fans, and the help from our many friends, we'll be able to give you all the Butt Sniffin Pugs you've dreamed of. ❤
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
DID YOU MISS OUT ON THE CAMPAIGN?
PRE ORDER PATHOGENESIS HERE!!
WIBAI Website
Facebook
Twitter:  @wibaigames
Email:  wibaigames@gmail.com
RETAILERS & EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS:   If you are with a school or retailer please email us:  wibaigames@gmail.com 
PROJECT VIDEO BY CLUB FANTASCI & THE LOWRY AGENCY
                                Designed by Jamie & Loren Cunningham (Transylvania: Curses & Traitors) in partnership with scientific illustrator somersault18:24, Pathogenesis is a deck building game in which players are bacterial pathogens attacking a human host. The pathogens must survive the body's powerful immune response, adapt in an ever changing environment, and evolve to take on virulence factors to increase their attack, defense, and other abilities so that they may do enough damage to defeat the body before the human host becomes immune and all the players lose the game.
The game is highly scalable, allowing players to choose their level of difficulty and the length of game they wish to play.
Pathogenesis blends the feel of center-row style deck builders such as Star Realms and Ascension with mechanics based 100% on real science, simulating the roles of pathogens and the immune system at each phase of the game.
Modes of play include solo, competitive, cooperative, team play, and classroom.
Who might like this game?  Avid gamers, fans of deck builders, medicine & science enthusiasts, teachers and students from high school to college level and beyond.
1-4 players.  Ages 14+   30-60 minutes
                    RULE BOOK, click HERE to access:
HATE RULE BOOKS? - CHECK OUT THESE HOW TO PLAY VIDEOS! 
Below is a link to 7 short videos that will show you how to play the game from set up, how to play your turn, and the various aspects of game play followed by a complete solo game example. You can skip through the videos using the arrows on either side.
Pathogenesis is all about building pathogens to withstand the punishing immune response and defeat the body.  The pathogens put in play stay in play (until destroyed by the immune system) allowing you to continue to build them and attack the body each turn, unlike most deck building games where all cards are discarded at the end of your turn. 
You begin the game with your own personal deck of 10 cards:
These cards allow you to gain and use genetic value to acquire stronger pathogens, trait cards, toxin cards, and environment cards. The upgraded cards acquired on previous turns will cycle back into your hand on future turns allowing you to play them on existing pathogens increasing their attack, defense, and other abilities.
The pathogens' first task is to attack the body and breach the body's defense barriers:
Once the body's defensive barriers are breached, the immune system activates and your pathogens must survive the body's powerful immune response each turn before you are able to damage the body and take victory points. 
The initial immune response is dealt from deck 1.  When this deck runs out the discard pile is shuffled into immune deck 2 to form the final immune response.  If players do not meet the game end damage condition before the final immune deck runs out then the body declares immunity and all of the players lose the game.
Want to play a demo of the game now?  The "Play Now" link below will take you to a virtual demo on Tabletopia.com.  A membership to Tabletopia is not required but you must have a compatible web browser (Firefox, Safari, or Explorer).  
It is easiest to open our Kickstarter page in Firefox, Safari, or Explorer and then click on the link.  In order to invite friends you will then share the specific in-game URL generated link (not the link below) with your friends.
This demo will give you a chance to get a digital look at all of the game's components and play the game.  (The game art is 100% complete, however, the demo contains cards with blank art as the digital versions have not all been updated).
CLICK HERE TO PLAY NOW
                                REVIEW VIDEO BY DANNY C.:  A nerd through and through, Danny is a cell and molecular biologist who's all about science, gaming and nerdom in general. Going through many jobs ranging from lab work to video game motion capture, he's brought his passions together making videos about board and video games, science, and more.
"A mechanistically solid and highly versatile deckbuilder in its own right, Pathogenesis has great potential as a wonderful educational tool - taking the incredibly complex science of immunology and making it more digestible and understandable for anyone wanting to learn. Highly recommend giving it a go!" - Danny C.
REVIEW VIDEO BY UNDEAD VIKING:
 "I don't usually enjoy Deck Builders, but when I do, they are fantastic games like this one!" - Undead Viking
PREVIEW VIDEO BY BOARD GAME BRAWL:
 WHAT ARE PEOPLE SAYING ABOUT THE GAME?
"By taking the genre's strengths of customization and marketplace competition, giving it a wonderful theme, and removing the hassle of troublesome trash cards, Pathogenesis bridges the gap between new and experienced players, and even to those who typically don't reach for a deck-builder on game night like me." -Matt Ochs (Kansas City Game Designers)
"This is one game I've been looking forward to seeing become a reality. I had the pleasure of playtesting, and enjoyed it thoroughly. One of the big features I like are the options for co-op and team play." - Troy Pichelman (Kansas City Game Designers)
"I like that it is educational, but still FUN. As a college instructor, I see a lot of games that are educational. None of these games are fun to play outside of the classroom. I do not understand microbiology, but still have a great time playing Pathogenesis". - Kelly C Hughes, Instructor at Alexandria Technical and Community College.
"Pathogenesis attacks a deck builder from an angle I have not seen playing as a bacterial pathogen attacking a body! The AI they have developed is very cleverly done and seems to think and guess what you as a pathogen are doing to it reacting and hitting back. This game is also VERY educational and great effort has been put not only into the artwork but the realism of the science as well. It strikes a great balance of learning but extremely fun at the same time!". - Rodger Moore, Board Games & Beer Podcast & High School Biology Teacher.
  We use the “Stegmaier” method of shipping games in bulk to fulfillment centers around the world to reduce customs fees and VAT and to keep shipping prices low. Jamey Stegmaier’s shipping method is explained HERE; country codes are HERE.

          Jamie Cunningham, PhD is the brains behind Pathogenesis and together with her husband Loren, they are the designers of the game. Jamie is full time professor of biology. When teaching the immune system, textbooks cover the subject in pieces and her students never get to see the whole picture. Her goal for this game was to help her students see how the immune system works as a whole.   
Loren Cunningham is Jamie’s husband and partner in crime. Together they created Transylvania: Curses & Traitors that was successful on Kickstarter in 2014.   Loren’s background is in business rather than science, so his job was to make sure that the game and its mechanics worked well for EVERYONE regardless of their background in biology. He also makes sure that the games get manufactured and shipped to your door on time.
Scientific illustrator somersault18:24 is the artist and have partnered with WIBAI Games to bring art to the game that is scientifically accurate, yet re-imagined to achieve beautiful, eye-popping, images. somersault18:24 is run by the artists/scientists Luk Cox and Idoya Lahortiga. Both of them have a PhD in Biomedical Sciences and have set out on an ambitious journey to bridge the gap between the artistic visual arts and science. They excel in helping scientists and teachers to prepare easy-to-follow yet professional scientific illustrations.
Thomas Deeny is the graphic designer for Pathogenesis. He specializes in game design and book layout and has worked on several deck builders including Cthulhu Realms and Nightfall. You can check out his portfolio HERE.

Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo! (OK, so this is just our second rodeo.)

Our first Kickstarter for Transylvania: Curses & Traitors really taught us a lot. We plan on applying everything we learned from that campaign to make the campaign for Pathogenesis even better.

The process of creating a game and getting it to backers on time is highly complicated and involved. Delays are possible at each step from art, to production, to shipping.

To mitigate these risks we have established a fantastic help-line of people who have the expertise that we do not. We have sought out industry professionals and people who have had successful Kickstarter campaigns to provide us with guidance, expertise, and a sounding board. We feel very confident that the people in our corner have and will provide us with the information necessary to provide a smooth and successful campaign.

We have established relationships with several manufacturing companies who have a proven track record of creating great games with high quality components and who have experience working with Kickstarter campaigns.

It's a perfect day for a picnic! The park fills with families, spreading their blankets, and setting out colourful plates loaded with delicious treats.
But there has never been a picnic without uninvited guests ... ANTS!!
In Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants, players are competing ant colonies trying to steal the best plates of food from the picnic blankets. In this 2-4 player, dice-rolling dexterity game, the dice are your ants. Roll them onto the picnic cards, trying to get the most ants onto the foods and plate colours you want. Different custom dice at your disposal represent your industrious Workers, speedy Scouts, and sturdy Soldiers. At the end of the day, the colony that has arranged their stolen plates to best satisfy the whims of the Queen will earn the most points and win the game!

THANK YOU FOR A RESOUNDING SUCCESS FOR SWEET SPOT! We did so much better than we had hoped for!! This was a really tough theme in the board game world to fly, but apparently many of you have still managed to see it for the superb game play it presents!
If you have missed this campaign, you can visit us at www.MedievaLords.com to follow us!
FINAL STRETCH GOAL AT $7,500!
Take it to the courts with your trusty racket as you battle it out in an intense tennis game. Sweet Spot is a tactical card game that sees players take on the role of a tennis pro battling it out in singles or doubles matches. Through all our reviews and feedback from public sessions, Sweet Spot has blown the minds of many, creating that exciting rush and sense of adrenaline which real pros feel on the court! Tennis fans love it, NON-TENNIS FANS LOVE IT! Check out our GenCon public feedback video in the Review section below.
Try it to believe it! Our trial PnP is FREE for you to download. Support us for just about 20 USD, and you can own what we will be hoping is going to be the top Sports Tabletop game of the year 2017!
DOWNLOAD THE FREE PnP HERE: CLICK HERE
Download the game manual here: CLICK HERE
This game has great depth, but can still be taught in under 5 minutes. Don't believe us? Here is a tutorial video teaching the game, in exactly 2 minutes and 30 seconds:
Our Pink Meeple team dedicated an episode to show an actual game of Sweet Spot. No worries, the humor is there as always:
Our friends over at Board To Death also made a really clear tutorial video for us just in case you prefer real life tutorial videos instead of animated one! Shouting it out here: THANKS GUYS!
Highly Strategic
Players have to play the right card at the right situation as they rally it out on the court. But beware — stamina management is a critical part of the game! If you are not careful enough, you might end up breathless too quickly. Sweet Spot uses a uniquely designed 'numbers system' to simulate the tennis ball's position and allows players to feel a realistic strength control of their swings where they can literally hit the ball lightly or drive it down hard. 
During games, you also need to decide your playing style! In between rallies, players are allowed to do a 'blind draft' of their hand using any combination of the 3 deck types available (Service, Tactic, Return) Many will want to lean towards the Tactic cards, which is really where the most powerful moves in the game are. However, they are risky because many of them rely on modifying Return cards, which are staple and a player without Return cards simply cannot react to even the simplest of balls! The trick is to manage that fine balance between having a lot of Tactic cards, and then enough Return cards to tide you through.
Powerful Tactic cards can tilt the balance and are at the same time highly thematic - Bench allows one to regain more stamina in between rallies, Crowd Cheering allows one to perform better at critical moments and Egg Shot hits the ball so high in the sky that the opponent cannot take an accurate read on its position when it comes down.
DOUBLES MODE
Yes, this game is fully compatible for a game of 2-on-2! It brings a different level of excitement. While it is highly tactical in Singles mode, it becomes very much more teamwork and communication in Doubles mode. The game plays exactly the same, except that players have a smaller hand size of 8 instead of the usual 10. Also they have to alternate hitting the ball on their teams. However, this restriction can be ignored if a player pays 2 extra stamina on top of his move requirement. This simulates the player going out of position and rushing over to assist. While players cannot share what cards they have with their teammate, they can talk and discuss on whether a player is able to 'handle' the current incoming shot better. In this manner, players of Sweet Spot can expect a realistic and highly exciting experience where a player can shout 'Let go!' or 'Mine!', only to find out that his partner was actually better equipped to handle it afterall - just like in real life! The better team is the one with better communication and teamwork!
SOLO MODE
Yes and yes, we have revealed the SOLO mode! You can expect exciting battles against an AI player! This AI is no pushover, and will be sure to entertain you with intense matches whenever you are home by yourself!
Download the SOLO rules here: CLICK HERE
A video sample of what a Solo mode session feels and plays like:
   There are more than 100 cards and components in the game, including cubes and jumbo sized player cards - featuring more than 30 real Tennis moves and skills!

Howdy racket kings & queens,
In a month, it will be one year soon when this game first gets produced from Kickstarter! We sure hope you guys enjoy Sweet Spot as much as we did ourselves! If you do have a minute to spare, we would deeply appreciate you rating the game on Boardgamegeek's website at this link: CLICK HERE!
There is ONE big rule that we would like to bring to everyone's attention, since quite a bit of emails have been coming our way asking about it. They are just hidden from the opposing team, that's all. (some misunderstand that the hidden cards only activate after they get revealed) What this means is that in the event you do bring the ball into 0-3 zone (IN) using the aid of a HIDDEN card, you do not hide it anymore. You immediately reveal that HIDDEN card along with any other cards you accompany it with - because you have already won. Similarly, if your HIDDEN card brings you into the 4-6(NET) zone, you also reveal it because you have already lost (so don't do that!) However, you still only pay for the stamina of the HIDDEN card after revealing it. This is where some players might find it confusing. What if you cannot pay for the stamina of the HIDDEN card when it gets revealed? Then that card does not happen at all. Simply discard it. Do write in the comments below if you need to clarify anything else and we will be more than happy to help!

campaign.story:
Thank you so much to everyone who helped make the Metal Minds Kickstarter a success! To stay up to date on the progress of Metal Minds, including how to purchase it in the future, visit and Like the Metal Minds Facebook Page.
 You are a psychic agent indentured to the government of the colonial planet, Kal-Purnika. While on a mission to harvest energy spheres called rift orbs in the Outer Stretch mountains, your team discovers abandoned power plants.
A fierce competition ignites among you and the other agents for who can be first to restore the ruins to life. Construct intricate machines, perform telepathic feats and thwart the efforts of rivals in a race to create rift orbs. Become the greatest Metal Mind and forge a path to victory!
    Metal Minds is easy to learn but takes time and skill to master. Players take turns drawing and playing cards to use agent and device powers. Your goal: Get the most rift orbs the fastest! 
    Each player gets a tracker mat with pawns to track resources and red gems to track rift orbs.
Agents are also dealt randomly to each player at the start of a game. Agents have a power that can be used once a turn and assign limits to your hand size and devices in play.
All players draw from one deck called the inventory. It is made up of device and maneuver cards. The junkyard is the discard pile for inventory cards.
Cards you draw from the inventory are kept secret in your hand. You can only play cards from your hand. To discard a card means to place it from your hand into the junkyard.
Devices you build are kept face-up in front of you in your line. You can only use the powers of devices in your line. To scrap a device means to place it from your line into the junkyard.
  Maneuvers are blue cards that have an immediate but one-time effect. To play a maneuver, first pay its resource cost if it has one, perform its effect then place it in the junkyard.
Devices come in two types: engines and gadgets. To play a device, first pay its cost if it has one then place it into your line. You can't use its powers until your next turn.
Gadgets are the green device cards that have scrap powers. A scrap power can only be used once then you must scrap the device.
Engines are the red device cards that have circuit powers. A circuit power can be used once per turn. When you do, turn the card sideways to show it has been used that turn.
There are three types of resources used to play cards and use powers. They are mostly acquired from free inventory cards. You can carry up to six of each.
Tetracyte crystal is for playing gadgets and maneuvers.
Bilbadon lava fuel is used to make or destroy rift orbs.
Exorillium ore is for playing engines.
  Each player gets one turn per round. A turn has three stages:
1. Action stage
Skip this stage to draw an extra card or get any two resources.
* Play any number of cards from hand.
* Use the powers of your agent and devices in your line.
2. Limit Stage
* Discard down to the hand limit of your agent.
* Scrap devices down to your agent's line limit.
3. Draw Stage
* Turn all used cards upright.
* Draw two cards from the inventory.
  To win the game, you must end a round with at least eight rift orbs and have more than any of your rivals. If there is a tie among players for the most orbs, those players continue playing while the rest are eliminated.
  Metal Minds has the dynamic game play of a collectible card game without the cost. Enough strategy is required to appeal to older and serious gamers, while enough luck is involved for younger and casual players.
The game has been tested rigorously for years and seen many iterations. The result is a fun experience with every card having a balanced power level.
Metal Minds features an intriguing story and characters, with quality art from professional artists, including J.J. Sturgeon, Wayne Miller, Alan Vadell, Lin Norris and Toma Feizo Gas.
  Please make the publication of Metal Minds a reality and pledge for your copy today! Here are five of the eight different pledge options available.
  If you purchase the Kal-Purnika Citizen pledge level or higher, you may also pledge for any of the following add-on items. Simply add the correct amounts to your pledge. Specify which items you want later when you take the survey.
  Help Metal Minds achieve funding beyond its project goal and these bonuses will be unlocked!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest task for bringing Metal Minds to the world will be ensuring a high-quality but cost-effective production run on schedule. Nifty Games already has an estimate and deal in place with MeiJia Manufacturing to make this happen.

Once production of the games and add-on items are complete and delivered, fulfillment will be the next undertaking. Nifty Games will store the product and coordinate a team to sort and package orders, which will then be shipped via the United States Postal Service and an outside fulfillment company for international orders.

Any additional art required for unlocked stretch goals will need to be completed quickly to meet the production timeline. This should not be a problem since Nifty Games has an excellent relationship with its artists.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings Backers!
This has been quite a ride. A lot has happened with Metal Minds in the last two months. If you would like more frequent updates about the game, please Like the Facebook page:
https://www.facebook.com/MetalMindsGame/

The manufacturer sent a small shipment to my fulfillment partner in the UK, and I mailed them the add-on items for those orders. All international backers should have their games!

Happy Holidays Backers!
It took a bit, but shipping for Metal Minds has been straightened out. The balance for the games has been paid. The games for international backers have already arrived. For the United States, I had to fill out some legal paperwork for customs. That should be processed soon and the games arrive here after.
All of the add-on items--promo cards, expansion, magnets and playmats--have been ordered and received. My plan is to begin fulfillment in January. Barring any issues, everyone should receive their rewards by the end of February.

Hey Backers,
I just wanted to give you a heads-up on the world of Metal Minds. First off, here is another completed Coppermind illustration: Branch Chaise. I have to say this is some of Wayne Miller's best work. He is working sketches for the next two Copperminds.

Hello Metal Minds Backers!
I've been waiting to post because I wanted to share the first finished art from the Coppermind Bundle pledges. Behold: Doctor Destroyer!

Hi Backers!
The end of the campaign approaches and Metal Minds is fully funded thanks to all of you! Yeay!
We still have a couple days left to go after the Outer Stretch goals. I have lowered the second and third goals yet again to make them easier to attain! Let your friends and family know.

updates.update_userinfo: Fully Funded and Even Lower Stretch Goals!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
Metal Minds is at 76% funding and we have 6 days to go. I am confident we will achieve our goal. Thank you all for your generous pledges!
I will be on the Greg and Dan show of WMBD, a Peoria, IL radio station to talk about the Kickstarter for Metal Minds. It is Thursday morning 8:30am Central. You will probably be able to hear to the recording later. Listen in if you can! I am nervous, but excited.

Hello Backers,
We are currently at 45% funding--not bad. This weekend should provide a boost. I will be running two demo events at game shops near St. Louis. If you are in the area or have gamer friends who are, let them know. You can find more information on the Facebook fan page. Also, I posted a new playthrough video for the campaign this week. There will also be a 360-degree version available soon.

Greetings Backers!
I wanted to remind you guys, especially Kal-Purnika Tourists, that you can download the rules using the link at the end of the How to Play section on the campaign page. Here is said link for your convenience:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/xnufws82l28qmt8/MetalMindsRuleBook.pdf?dl=0
I have decided to lower all of the stretch goals because I really want to implement all of these sweet upgrades! Visit the bottom of the campaign page to see the new goals.

GenCon 2016 was an exhausting but educational experience. Metal Minds acquired several new fans. I will be running more demos at two local game shops this week. The campaign is currently over 35% funded; we are well on our way!

Stay tuned,
J.J. Sturgeon

campaign.story:
UPDATE: This 200 card deluxe set and the expansions are only going to be available from this Kickstarter campaign. If this game becomes available to stores, it will be a 140 card version without the player mats/EZ star tracker cards. And no expansions will be available in stores. Now is the time. The time is now. 
Don't be fooled by imitations. This is THE Battle of the Bands card game. We did it first, we do it best. 
Battle of the Bands is, an all ages, fun, "screw you" type card/dice game for 2-6 players. (with expansions, up to 12 players!) Start your band and destroy your opponents onstage! (And win, if you need to do that sort of thing.)
One box to rock them all!
                  The play mats, that come with the game, help new players get into the swing of things. Not needed to actually play the game.
All of the 7 mini expansions we attain will be added to the Basic Set, making it possible for it to be 200 cards in the box. (42 cards in the mini expansions, we'll add 18 to make it an even 60 to the basic set of 140!) A DELUXE BASIC SET! (MSRP $39.95) And along the way we'll have up to 10 unique Kickstarter funder cards added to your box.
It's a card/dice game (Very soda and pretzels.) where everyone starts their own rock band. Players recruit BAND MEMBERS and INSTRUMENTS. They attempt to give them REPUTATIONS. 
Players play CONTRACTS, HIT SINGLES (win points) that might help them during GIGS, (win points) where they attempt to screw up the opposing bands with MONKEY WRENCHES. 
The MUSIC BIZ will either make or break you when you are not touring, WEBSITES give a little extra when you have hit singles and the audience DIE ROLL has the last say in pushing you over the top! ( Very simple mechanics with lots of strategy in the card play.) 
Also included are EZ Star Tracker cards that allow each player to know instantly where their opponent's Superstar point totals are in relation to winning the game! 
 For a basic idea of how the game is played, click the link below and get the demo version!
At the top right hand of the page is a button with 3 dots, drop that down, the download button is there.
  I am the game designer and artist on this game. It has been a labor of love, ink and sweat. If you ever wanted to be in a band, you will love this game. This was my first game and will always be my favorite. (I have made other games, FYI.)  
 Here's what some folks have said about Battle of the Bands...
                            This game is supposed to be personal, when you play, it's YOUR band!  Creative role playing always makes any game more fun, especially this game!
EXAMPLE:
When someone steals your MOM from your band into their band, it's YOUR MOM! (And that reputation of ANDROGYNY they put on her... NOT COOL! ) When your opponent feels it's a good thing to expose you on TV, making your reputation NEGATIVE, you need to feel it. Role play it. It's a FUNNY game!!!
This game has been produced twice, the first time in 2000, the ENCORE edition, in 2002, where the basic set AND the expansion BACKSTAGE PASS were nominated for best traditional card game and expansion by ORIGINS! Now we've remastered it, this version is the best yet!

The EVENTS (blue) deck are all the other cards, MUSIC BIZ, HIT SINGLES, CONTRACTS, GIGS and MONKEY WRENCHES. You want ammo for the tour, you draw from this deck.

      Game of Energy is a highly thematic eurogame of medium-light complexity. The primary mechanics are tile placement and resource management. It plays 1-4 players, and usually lasts around 30-60 minutes.
  In a few years, the modern world will plunge into turmoil. Countries around the world will panic, widespread chaos will ensue, and civilized society will change virtually overnight as citizens cope with the loss of a modern-day vital resource. A resource needed for commerce. A resource needed for communication. A resource needed for life-sustaining technology. The resource… is energy.
But that time is not here yet! The United Nations cannot fix this problem themselves, but they know who can: the Captains of Industry. These people are experienced with building energy industries, and they are just the ones to solve this problem before time runs out! They are more than willing to do their best to save the world from this crisis. Of course, the resulting United Nations contract worth billions of dollars awarded to the Captain that accomplishes this task does not hurt, either...
Compete with other players to win the contract and ensure that your company will become the #1 global energy power for many years to come! Obtain government industry permits by using energy credits allotted by the United Nations Council for aligning yourself to their environmental objectives. Industries you own will constantly increase the energy credits you are allotted, but they also increase the terawatt-hours, TWh (energy) generated by your company! And it is ultimately out-performing your opponents and hitting the optimal level of terawatt-hours that will win you the U.N. contract, and win you the game!
Become one of the Captains of Industry
    Be careful which cards you play! Not all cards only affect your opponents.
                                                                        Simple rules, but in-depth strategy.
Overview
You are a captain of industry, and your job is to thwart the fast-approaching energy crisis. Regardless which captain of industry you become, you will have a unique ability that can be used on every turn of the game. Some abilities net you a better return on certain industries, others allow you to manipulate cards and other game components.
As a captain of industry, you have access to all modern day technologies: biofuel, fossil fuel, hydroelectric, nuclear, solar, and wind--all of which have different sizes, costs, and benefits. Each player must make optimum use of their resources and the available hexagonal areas on the board to not only achieve a victory with generating enough energy in terawatt-hours (TWh), which are your victory points in the game, but to do so before time runs out and world goes dark.
In every round of play, each player will take a single turn. During this turn, you will take a series of 3 actions: draw a Grid card (to be played strategically now or later), be “paid” in the amount of energy credits shown on your environmental score track (this is a separate track from the TWh score track), and finally roll the territory die.
Upon rolling the territory die, you can choose which combinations of industries you would like to build ("permit") in that zone of the board. Each zone presents a variety of different permitting costs for the available industries, but keeps all the environmental and TWh score track gains the same between zones--this makes it easier, but still realistic, to compare industries across zones, and also allows you the ability to quickly ascertain which industries have advantages/disadvantages depending on where you choose to build them. Your choices in what you build and when you build them determine your odds of victory in Game of Energy!
Text and Pictures only. Graphic Design and further refinement will come after the campaign.
  Not yet updated with the newest components, but will certainly give you a positive gaming preview!
  Not yet updated with the newest components, but will certainly give you a positive gaming preview!
  End Game
The game ends when you reach the amount of TWh needed to assure your energy portfolio is a good model for what will rid the world of an impending energy crisis. Once you hit this limit, the remaining current round of play is played out. Assuming another player does not put you into energy credit debt OR surpasses you in TWh, you win!
And be ever-watchful of the turn counter: once this hits 0, if nobody has reached the necessary amount of TWh generation, it means that there will be no more time left to build up the world's energy infrastructure! This is game over for everybody. Civil unrest is on your shoulders...
Alternate Rules (including Solo Play)
There exist alternate rules in the game that allow for any (or all) of the following:
+ Changing "take that" effects in the game (for a pure euro experience)
+ Different goals for 2, 3, or 4 players
+ Locking down industries where they are placed on the board (for advanced/heavier euro players)
+ Filling in players with "dummy players" that play against you on the board
+ Solo Variant that still gives the full game experience
The solo variant and dummy players can only be done through the use of the "Dummy Corp." Expansion, which is included for FREE with the game when pledging here on Kickstarter!

updates.update_content:
Last time I wrote that we were getting all the paperwork figured out. Now, I think all the paperwork is done! Of course, I'm sure more forms will materialize at some point, but I think we can begin moving forward with getting the games MOVING. At this point, we are mostly waiting on a final mold inspection so that we only ship out non-moldy games. 

Since I am only shipping over what needs to be fulfilled for you backers, and having the rest disposed of, we can pick through any damaged games and only send out the pristine ones! Years of storage can be harsh, but I am hopeful! It is my hope that the quality of the game you get was at least worth the wait, but I don't have control over that at this point. All I can do is get the factory to pick out the ones showing mold which should mean all is well once they get to us!

We are finally at the point where we are getting customs paperwork lined out and final preparations for shipment! Things are moving slowly, but they are MOVING! I asked about how long the whole process would take, and I was told to expect the games to begin arriving to all of you no earlier than sometime in May. But hey, we have an approximate delivery date! Sorry it has taken so long. As I've said, this has always been something I wanted to finish to deliver what I said I would deliver, but life can throw you a curve ball... and that was BEFORE the-year-that-must-not-be-named... I'll post again once there has been any other major updates.

campaign.story:
Objective:
The goal of the game is to collect the most valuable farm animals for Farmer Brown to sell on Market Day. You do this by playing cards face-down from your hand and declaring what they are, then giving one other player a choice to decide if you are bluffing or telling the truth. If they choose correctly, THEY get the Farm Animal card(s) you played, but if they guess wrong, YOU get the card instead. Whoever wins Farm Animal cards adds them to their collection. But you may also get Crows, pests that irritate Farmer Brown and count against you in the scoring. If you are a terrible fibber, then we have the solution for you! You are allowed to make the animal noise of the animal you are "claiming," we have found that gets everyone laughing.
   Setup:
 1.) Place the 5 Animal Bonus cards in order of value (Cow, Pig, Sheep, Goat, Chicken).
2.) Place the Set Bonus cards in a stack on the table.
3.) Place 1 Robber and 1 Excuse Me Token in the middle of the table, face-down, for each player in the game and mix them up. (A 3 player game would have 3 Robber and 3 Excuse Me Tokens in the middle)
4.) Everyone draws a Token, looks at it, and then keeps it secret.
5.) Now add the Scarecrow Token, face-down, to the tokens in the middle and mix them up.
6.) Shuffle the Farm Animal deck and deal out cards according to the number of players: 6 cards to each player for a 2-4 player game, 5 cards to each player for a 5-6 player game.
7.) Remove 8 random cards from the deck and return them to the box.
8.) Select the First Player (the last person to have visited a farm) and begin!
       Actions to take during your turn:
Pick a player, pass them a card(s), and claim an animal. (This could be a bluff or not)
Current player may play action tokens if they have them.
End your turn by drawing your hand back up to the hand limit.
(You may play your Action Tokens before or after your bluff, that is up to you.)
 Example of Bluffing:
             Rule Book:
                                                                                                                                                                    75 Animal Cards
15 Crow Cards
13 Action Tokens
5 Animal Bonus Cards
10 Set Bonus Cards
                
                                      Limited Edition Playmat "add-on" - $20
This 2mm neoprene playmat is 12"x20" and is bright and gorgeous. Our art team Mr. Cuddington, really made a fantastic piece for the game. This playmat will set the atmosphere for your games and keep all the cards organized on the table. We are really proud of this piece and it unlocks as the $12,500 stretch goal to be purchased. You only need to add $20 to your pledge for the playmat, this will include the cost of shipping it as well. 
   Help spread the word so we get all the Stretch Goal goodies!
             
          We are using Funagain Games to handle our fulfillment. As a company that has successfully done this a million times, we have all the confidence in Nick Medinger and his crew as humanly possible. We have a plan in place to offer affordable shipping around the world and to avoid ALL VATs. You can back with confidence!
Shipping to the US will be $6. Anywhere else in the world will be $10. Simple and straightforward!
  A good board game, in good company, having a time out from our electronics, is what this world needs. We need to laugh with people. We need to be silly. We need to think critically. We need to work together to conquer a foe. We need good board games! 
At Druid City Games, this is what we hope to be. We hope that you agree with us and come along for this ride. It is so much more fun when you do things with your friends and family. Gather round the table and play one of our games, it will help you connect with others like never before!
Our games have a 100% money back guarantee. If you don't like the game, send it back to us within 30 days, and we will refund your full pledge. We believe in what we put our name on, and we know you will love it!
   We want to thank the board gaming community for their support. There is a ridiculously long list of people that have played a huge part in getting this game to where it is today. HUGE shout out to Mr. Cuddington, our art team, they crushed it. They are so insanely talented; we were so lucky to lock them down for this project. Big shout out to the Dice Tower Network peeps that are featuring our game on their segments, they are such great supporters! The community at Kickstarter Boardgame Spotlight, what a great group of gamers. The Boardgaming Group on Facebook, such supportive people! The dynamic duo, Jamey Stegmaier and James Mathe, good cop, and bad cop, without their resources; there is no way this campaign would be where it is. Lastly, my wife; who has put up with my long nights of work for the past year getting this game ready for the launch. I promise you a vacation when this is over :) 
We are indebted to so many for the good fortune and kindness we have been shown. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
- James, Ian, and Doug.

campaign.story:
As the Jotunn destroys all in his reach, Viking armies fight a bloody war of dominance in his shadow.
Rampaging Jotunn is a two-player strategy game that pits players in a competitive contest of tactics and supremacy.

Each player controls three villages and two Viking armies. Both use their armies for defense as well as to destroy their opponents villages.  Players are always keeping a watchful eye for the ancient threat looming above them all, the Jotunn rampaging across the island destroying everything in sight.

Players use cards to move their armies or to influence the Jotunn and direct him toward their opponents armies and villages. The player with the last villages on the board wins!
Can you survive the Jotunn’s Rampage and conquer your opponent? 
            PLAY

        Father Geek 
I am very pleased with Rampaging Jotunn. It’s fast, fun, and exasperating in a very satisfying way. Controlling a giant has never been more fun or dangerous. The key to success might be patience, but a player needs to have the guts to charge into the fray, too. For those who enjoy games that challenge the players to take risks, which might mean not taking any at all, Rampaging Jotunn is a game to be enjoyed. Do play Rampaging Jotunn and see if it stands up to your lofty standards.

Full write up HERE.
     Matthias Bonnici (Left), The Founder of Lost Cog, is an award-winning Graphic Designer, Author & Publisher based in Newark, New Jersey.
Matthias developed and re-designed Rampaging Jotunn.  He is also the Creative Director, Art Director, Graphic Designer, Product and Packaging Designer on Rampaging Jotunn and Dragon Chess. 

Over the past 6 years, he has worked with many different clients in the gaming industry, Matthias has been the primary Graphic Designer on: Anointed: Mantle of the Gods, Looting Atlantis, Conspiracy! and Metalfest.

David Simpson (Right), The Original Concept Creator of Rampaging Jotunn and Lead Designer on Dragon Chess: Arcane Battles, Promoter, Founder of the Gamers on Games YouTube channel. 
Dave is a long time participant of the tabletop gaming industry, having done work for and with Guardians of Order, R. Talsorian Games, Plaid Hat Games, and Bucephalus Games.
Dave’s channel, Gamers on Games covers a wide range of tabletop gaming topics, from board game reviews, wargaming battle reports, and even prize giveaways! Be sure to check it out at www.youtube.com/gamersongames He resides in New Jersey with his wife, daughter, and cats.

In Vikings Gone Wild, players take the role of heads of clans fighting against each other to prove to the gods who is the best.

You will gain Victory Points mainly by attacking other players, defending successfully, upgrading your Town Hall or completing missions. The game ends once a player reaches 40 or 30 Victory Points, depending on the number of players. But the final winner will be determined once the 24 bonus points have been attributed.

During each turn, you play the cards in your hand to buy units or defense towers, erect buildings and attack other players. You will have to find the right balance between investing in your economy (buildings, specials cards) and growing your army!

With over 10 months of conception and 100 blind play-tests, the game has gone through an intense level of proof-reading, testing and printing preparation.

Cards and wood pieces being the main components of Vikings Gone Wild means that this project has a lower level of risk than others, particularly those with lots of miniatures.
That being said, outside of making sure that the game is properly prepared and choosing our partners wisely (printers, logistics, etc.), it is not impossible that we face delays from uncontrollable sources. This may cause some delay in the delivery date but rest assured that, if this were to happen, we will keep you informed about the situation.

Refund Policy

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked.
If the refund is asked more than 60 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 10% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded of them at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Stripe.

Terms and Condition

Any costs shown in EUR are based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign.
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. campaign.story:
No matter race, creed, gender, or empire – each child of Gamedor is born with an affinity to one of The Four Suits: Card, Meeple, Die, or Token. In love and war these suits are absolutely meaningless, but in game, well, they mean everything. A true Lord of Gamedor uses their cards, and any means necessary, to gain the favor of Heroes of the land. Can you best the other Lords of Gamedor and build the biggest party of Heroes?
Jon Gilmour infuses H&T with Skill, Deduction, and a little Luck!
The objective of Heroes and Tricks is to be the Player to win the most tricks (thereby having the most Heroes) in the game. Each Trick is lead by a Hero card that defines the target suit and color, dramatically changing the play dynamic of typical trick taking games. Players then play into the trick, but only see the last played card and need to use deduction, item play, and hand management to win the most tricks.
Always with you, on-the-go!
We have developed a unique, custom, magnetic box so Heroes and Tricks can be played anywhere at anytime. The game is designed to minimize the need to memorize the state of the game, letting players play their cards as the box comes to them.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                     *French Translation (from an awesome backer - Etienne!)

Risks and challenges
Heroes and Tricks is Pencil First Game's fourth Kickstarter. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet!, The Siblings Trouble, and GemPacked Cards all funded and were successfully shipped to backers (TST and GPC both shipped early). I strive to run excellent Kickstarters and delivery fantastic products.

Heroes and Tricks is well tested and balanced. The graphic design is complete and 75% of the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but I have been making complex projects with countless moving parts and large budgets most of my career. I've gone out of my way to surround myself with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and I'm sure will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, I will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.

campaign.story:
Meeple Maker is a 2-4 player light strategy game that plays in about 30-60 minutes.
Your goal is to get the most fans. To get fans, you'll utilize (spend) content to produce games tailored to their demands. To meet those demands, you'll develop content with help from the internet.

When you meet the demands of the market, you get fans and a new recruit for your company. They join your media, design, production and/or graphics team where they help develop immersive worlds, deep mechanics, valuable components, and wondrous artwork - all the things you need to achieve success.

To succeed, not only will you need to get the best people, but you'll have to recruit them before anyone else.
Meeple Maker is for those times when you want:
To play a 90 minute game in 45 minutes.
Choices to matter, but not overwhelm.
Goals to be clear, but strategies flexible.
A big box game in a small box space.
A competitive worker placement game, without the grunt work.
The game provides many decisions to make and many paths to take. Your goal is to make sure the path you choose provides you with the most fans. Players take turns either:
Moving their tokens on the board and gaining the content shown at the websites they move to,
OR they spend content to gain cards. The cards each have a listed cost, and give you skills (which help generate more content) and fans (score).
But what if you don't like your options? Then change them! Collect special Favor cards to turn the game in your favor. You can play these multi-function cards at the start of your turns to change:
The market
Websites (the game board)
Your content
The right combination at the right time can be a game-changer.
Need to develop content for your games? Then visit a website that offers the content you want.
You'll always have three websites to choose from - each with a unique and changing combination of content.. Players skip over other players, simultaneously blocking websites and opening up new ones.
Want more fans and a bigger company? Then utilize your content to get yourself into a new market! Produce the type of game they want, and they'll bring fans and a skillful new employee. Those skills help with developing content and achieving the end-game bonuses.
Thus, you'll have several factors to consider:
The type and amount of content they demand,
How many fans and skills they give you,
How much those skills are worth at the end of the game,
Where to recruit from.
Every time your company grows, the market changes, so choose carefully!
As companies grow, it gets tougher to develop content without a strong team. In the game, players mimic this by choosing one token to flip at a time, gradually turning up the pressure. When the last has been turned, time's up! l hope your company has what it takes to grab the last few fans and lead you to victory!
Great price point! Why wait for the retail price of $39, when you can back now for $29?
Limited distribution This is a small print-run game (1,000 copies) which will be sold directly online and at conventions after Kick Starter. Be one of the rare few to own it.
Keep in touch with the scheduled online games and try it before you buy it.
If you enjoy games like Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, and Stone Age, and want something quicker and smaller, then Meeple Maker will fit right into your collection. 
The game is designed to be engaging and speedy with little waiting and downtime. There is no round to round management since:
You don't need to take my word for how great a game this is. Here are the links to previews. And if you won't trust those, you can always try it out online.
PLEASE NOTE: The name, theme and artwork has been updated. Meeple Maker was previously named Suit Up.

I've spent years perfecting Meeple Maker - pouring all my efforts into creating the best possible game. To keep the manufacturing costs low, I had to keep two sets of characters out. These two player mats (with their own powers) are ready and waiting for when we reach our funding and push towards stretch goals.
When you bring out this game, you'll be proud in the knowledge that you made this game a reality.
I am the driving force behind Meeple Maker. But there have been dozens that helped. Many are friends from the Dallas Games Marathon, the Dallas Designer Group, or numerous conventions I've attended. Thank you for being a part of my journey - this game is for you.
Meeple Maker at Dallas Games Marathon
For Meeple Maker, I'm self-publishing because I want to experience publishing a game. My long term goal is to use this experience to help others.
The art and graphic design, the audio and video, the game design and development, the prototypes - from cards, to chits, to boxes, the folding boards- I've created them all on a shoe-string budget. Every challenge has strengthened my resolve to make this the best game it can be.
Meeple Maker at the Dallas Designer Group
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've faced and overcome many risks and challenges. Meeple Maker has been playtested (and blind playtested) rigorously. The majority of the files are ready to be sent to the manufacturer for final proofing, although some final artwork will be created and adjusted. Even the most seasoned publishers deal with manufacturers, distributors, shipping companies, postal services, government regulations etc. – all of which can create unexpected changes. I have alternative plans for each step and I’ve built in a little breathing room in the funding to deal with any problem that may arise.

I support and follow many similar projects, and have since early 2013. I've paid attention to their problems and how they've resolved them. I'm also a long-standing member of the Dallas Designer Group - which has helped produce games like Dragon Valley, Mage Wars, Lanterns, World's Fair 1893, The Great Debate, Mahola and others. I've helped many in conventions and through their KS projects. I'm confident that should any issues arise I have the right team to advise me on the best solutions.

Shipping is always a concern - especially since it will be months before shipping occurs and price, policy and tax issues may change. Should any such issues occur, I will inform those that it affects and discuss how best to proceed. I've alternate plans prepared for this.

Communication is vitally important. Throughout this project I will share my journey, not only the successes, but also the challenges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: There is one day left of the campaign and I want to thank the dozens of you that have shown faith in my project. When I first ran the project I had little idea how successful it would be and although we did not achieve the level of funding we were hoping for, it is great to know that there are so many people out there who have pledged their support. Pledging will also help keep you informed of the future progress of Meeple Maker and of my journey into the board-gaming industry.

One of the things I've learned is that success is a series of small steps. I may have tried to leap over too many too quickly.

As I stated in my last update - I am working on a plan that utilizes Print-on-Demand services. This will affect the project in several ways:

1) To make this work and still be cost-effective, I am making small changes to the game to fully utilize standardized pieces and sizes. The effect on gameplay should be minimal, but the changes need to be tested. We may even end up with a better game as the constraints spur creativity.
2) I will not be able to offer cost-effective shipping for international backers for a Print-on-Demand print-run, but the long-term plan is to have a larger print-run which will be friendlier to international backers.
3) The print-run size will be closer to 100 than 1,000. As a result, it will have a significantly lower funding goal.

My hope is to create enough copies to send out to my backers and have several more remaining to send to reviewers as well. This will, in turn, get those outside of my circle to learn about Meeple Maker.

Over the last week, I've been working hard on the initial changes and so far it has shown tremendous promise.
I'm going to level with you.

A group of monsters gather around the table to play their favorite game: “Voodoo Madness”. They set up a table with six voodoo dolls, each linked to a different monster.
Each player plays as a voodoo doll. Your goal is to reveal the identities of your opponents, or destroy them before they reveal yours.
Voodoo dolls target each other with object cards. Each object in the game is linked to a particular monster’s weakness. The last unidentified voodoo doll standing wins the game!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fulfillment: 
Kickstarter fulfillment can be a frightening prospect for a first-timer. That’s why we asked for help from experienced and successful developers on Kickstarter. This is what turned us on to the “China method” (Shipping directly from china to fulfillment centers around the world)

Our method is not new and has been used successfully by other developers. Our fulfillment company has the experience to deliver your games, and just to be sure, we will have some backups to ensure 100% fulfillment!

Finally, we are keeping the rewards simple. We do not want to take more time than necessary to complete the shipping. We want you to get the game as soon as possible!

Manufacturing: 
Our manufacturer, WinGo Games, has extensive experience in game manufacturing as well as kickstarter projects. They are also close in proximity and friendly with our fulfillment company, which will ensure a smooth and fast fulfillment once our games leave the factory.

Game design & Art: 
Design and art are 100% complete for the basic game. For the stretch goals we will start working as soon as we reach them!. This means we are saving as much time as we can and you won’t have to wait long for your game!
We are working with the templates from the manufacturing company already, so we'll be ready to print as soon as we get the funds!.

Dark Souls™ - The Board Game is much more than a classic dungeon crawler. Just like the Dark Souls™ video games, this is a game that requires strategic thinking, clever planning, and exemplary execution to succeed.
Dragon Slayer Ornstein & Executioner Smough
To triumph, players must explore dangerous locations, discover and defeat enemies, and collect equipment and treasures before ultimately facing the boss in an epic fight to the death.
The Player Characters - Knight, Warrior, Herald & Assassin
Playable in either Solo or Co-op modes, players choose their role from a number of core Dark Souls™ character classes. Each class has a distinct role to play in the game, with a unique set of strengths and abilities.
With multiple difficulty modes and a high-level of replayability, this is a game designed to be deep enough to satisfy hard-core tabletop gamers whilst remaining accessible to newer players.
Dark Souls™ - The Board Game features an exciting "fast setup, long reveal" mechanic that gets you into the game faster and builds the location and encounters as you explore.
With no fixed scenario layouts, it’s as simple as choosing the direction to explore, placing a new tile down and flipping a card from the Encounter deck.
Each time you decide where to go, you will experience a new danger as you explore, with each new location a real risk to your hard-won progress. If you die, then you drop everything you have collected and reappear at the nearest bonfire. So do you return to the bonfire to rest and spend Souls to strengthen up, but in doing so fully reset the locations? Or do you press on and pray that the next encounter isn’t beyond your capabilities? After all, the next location may contain a clue to the Boss and how to defeat them…
Combat is both fast and deadly. Dark Souls™ - The Board Game rewards clever players and punishes ‘button mashing’. Players must learn enemy behaviors in order to fight more effectively, with classic fighting game style combat windows. 
The Titanite Demon mini-boss

Equipment, armour, and weapons are discovered or earned during play, but with limited slots players must think carefully about what is best to keep and use. campaign.story:
In Succession!, you are a proud member of a noble house vying for courtly influence to win the crown of Dayrm. To sway the royal court, you must ensure that the Vassals you send to the castle arrive safely while stopping your opponent’s Vassals from doing the same.
Players only have access the same nine Vassals, each of which hails from one of the three regions (Mountains, Forest, and City). During a turn, players send two Vassals in an attempt to reach the throne room. Each of these Vassals must come from a different region and can only interact with other vassals from their region.
Envoys (crowns) hold the real sway over the court and are worth valuable influence should they make it to the throne room. To stop an opponent's Envoys, you have secretly hired dastardly Enemies (crossed swords) to prevent them from succeeding. But be careful, word has it that the other Nobles have hired their own unsavory agents, so you will need to summon Escorts (shields) to try and keep the roads clear of threats to your Envoys.
As the turns progress, players must remember what Vassals have already been sent to court and predict which ones will be sent out next. It will take savvy planning, keen deduction, and a good memory to win the day. Once all the Vassals are sent, captured, or collected, the noble with the most influence is the new ruler of the Kingdom of Dayrm!
                      Every card in Succession! is vibrant & colorful with amazing illustrations drawn specifically for the game by the fantastic artist Brian Patterson of D20Monkey.com.
.

Risks and challenges
Where are the stretch goals? 

We deliberated on the topic of stretch goals for many weeks in the run up to Kickstarter. We've seen them be a lot of fun and we've seen them completely ruin production schedules and entire Kickstarter campaigns. For Succession!, we decided to forgo stretch goals and make the game, and it's components, of the highest quality from the start. The cards will be made with a 320 gsm black core stock and with a wonderful linen finish. These are cards we are proud to produce and play with; we know you will love them.

This is my third project and we have delivered on time to each of our backers who submitted their information on time. We do not expect any delay in getting this to the printer or too much additional time to be added for upgrading components as per our manufacturer. All the art is done, the files are ready to go to the printer when we are funded.

In light of this, the primary risk we would like to emphasize is the possibility of delays to our manufacturing and shipping schedules. We have taken careful steps to minimize this risk, including overestimating all of our timings and solidifying professional relationships far in advance of this campaign, but there is always the possibility of the unexpected.

The one promise we make regarding all of this is that we will be in constant contact with our backers and easy to reach should any questions arise. Each and every backer will be taking this journey with us, and the last thing we would do is leave anyone in the dark.

Thank you very much for taking the time to read through our entire page; we truly hope you will consider joining us.

Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest is both a new game that con. It is a sequel game to the original Ophidian – as it contains the same core gameplay but adds all-new Gladiators, Minions, Pumps and more! We're featuring all-new artists as well as some of the original game artists bringing this game to life in spectacular fashion.
Ophidian is a Gladiator Combat Game where two to four players bring teams of Gladiators to the table and fight in the arena. Players can win by defeating their opponents, or by winning the favor of the crowd!
This game features some fantastic art, engaging and unique gameplay, and is easy to learn. Ophidian is a game that rewards a player's skill more than nearly any other game on the market. This game is an Expandable Card Game, where you can customize your decks, but the distribution of cards is NOT randomized. The game will be available in pre-constructed decks. There are currently 4 varieties of decks, with more potentially unlocking via stretch goals.
Click Here for preliminary deck lists
Materials for One Player
 Card Layout
Do you like:
►Strategic Gameplay offering multiple choices at nearly every stage of the game
►Gritty combat theme
►Top-quality cards with Beautiful and Compelling Artwork
►Non-Collectible games with customizable decks that play like boardgames

This is probably the perfect 2-4-player strategy game for you!
Why back us?
● Improved Quality: We're printing at Cartamundi with some of the best quality card stock and materials! 
● Incredible Gameplay: Ophidian features some of the most original and engaging gameplay on the market!
● Player Skill: Do you like competition, where the player's skill is a major determining factor in your odds of winning?
 ● Unique Stretch Goals: Your contributions will make the game better for everyone... more cards and... more!
Click here to download the latest rules summary
 How can you help?
                   Start by backing us! Continue by adding additional cards to your pledge for a friend. 
Tell your friends about the game via the Facebook and Twitter buttons below, or via by just telling people!
Send us your thoughts and feedback in the project's comments section. We want to make Ophidian the best game it can be, and you can help us achieve that. 
Or simply show your interest in the game by following Hack and Slash Games on Twitter, liking it on Facebook, and becoming a fan on BoardGameGeek.
       Stretch Goals are additional goals that can unlock extra bonus materials and content. They come in two categories, Social and Funding.

Social Goals are things that unlock based on the number of backers and social media activity, in this case Facebook and Twitter.
+1 Card: Each pre-constructed deck will have its card count increased by 1.
+1 Gladiator: Each pre-constructed deck will include an additional Gladiator card beyond the starting team.
Funding Goals are funding targets set by the project creator beyond the original Kickstarter goal. Stretch goals as a term and a practice emerged from the Kickstarter community as a way for creators to "stretch" beyond the initial, official goal of the Kickstarter project and raise more money (and often make cooler stuff!). Funds are collected whether stretch goals are met or not, as long as the project has met its Kickstarter funding goal.
Supplement Pack: This gives every non-retail backer level of $25 and above a 9-card supplemental pack of cards.  (9 different cards)  This pack is also available as an Add-On.  *Pack images and contents are not final.

Deck Design 6: What the what? A sixth deck?  Can we get there?
Ophidian is a gladiator combat card game with a unique creation story. Originally released in 2003 by Fleer as Ophidian 2350, a company best known for its sports cards and bubble gum, the game found itself treading water in a market flooded with other new card games. Since its release Ophidian has stood apart by offering players an unusually high number of strategic options during gameplay. Unfortunately, its publisher went out of business shortly after the game's release, and all of Fleer's assets were either sold off or destroyed. Most people assumed the game was finished.
Robert Shofkom, Hack and Slash Games President
US Army Veteran Robert Shofkom tracked down the inventory over 10 years after its release, where it had been passed around from warehouses to storage units. All 22,000 pounds of product was packed up and shipped from Rhode Island to Texas, and Hack and Slash Games was born!
The rediscovered inventory is now being sold through Alliance Game Distributors and others. After over a decade, the game continues, with a new look, new features, all-new art, and more!
Read more about us in the February issue of Game Trade Magazine!
Hack and Slash Games has declared the following: 
We will make every effort to produce our games here in the United States. We have partnerships with US (domestic) production companies to make that happen. This allows us greater control over the quality of our products and gives us faster turnaround times. 
We will always endeavor to keep our games as affordable as possible, while still delivering high-quality products. 
Every product we produce will try to portray men and women in a realistic fashion; no accentuated features and unrealistic body proportions. Even in the world of high fantasy or science fiction, we want our humans to look HUMAN... Like someone that you could meet and interact with. • No microscopic waists • No hyper-sexualized figures. That doesn't mean that we won't have great art... it just means that we acknowledge that it can be difficult to navigate the waters of gaming and entertainment without being bombarded by what some people might consider the ideal body image. We prefer to keep that image healthy and realistic.
Here is an HD version of our current introduction video:
