campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Rahdo!
Four years ago, on a whim, I grabbed my iPhone one afternoon and started recording gameplay runthroughs of my favorite board and card games, and uploading them to YouTube. And now I'm about to start my 5th year of filming! WOOHOO!!! 
You can check out my series at
YOUTUBE.COM/RAHDO
As a sampler, here's a playlist of some recent runthroughs I've done (click "playlist" in the top left to see a long list of video choices):
I make these videos primarily for fun, as a way of sharing my enthusiasm and passion for the boardgaming hobby, and helping like-minded board game geeks choose which of the myriad games on the market are right for them. 
But as it happens, as of 2013, I've retired from full-time employment, and now, to be able to continue to produce runthrough videos, I need to raise funds to cover my operating expenses (game purchases, travel expenses to game conventions, and a salary to be able to stay devoted 100% to the show).
Fan Support Makes it all Possible
That's where you come in, because I receive no direct income for Rahdo Runs Through except for fan support in these yearly fund raising drives. I accept no payments from game developers for any game (retail or Kickstarter prototype) that I run through, and I don't turn on YouTube ads (because they're awful), so you folks are truly what keeps Rahdo running through! :)
Just a few of the many games that could be coming soon, with your help...
By backing this, my fourth RAHDO RUNS THROUGH Kickstarter campaign, you're funding my ability to continue to produce videos of all the latest, hottest games, ranging from the big games of the moment like Runebound 3rd Edition and Steam Time, to the soon to be released hits like Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu and Star Trek Frontiers.
In return for your donation, you have access to a variety of rewards. What are they, you might be wondering?  I'm glad you asked...
THE BACKER REWARDS
Rahdo Runs Through VOTING! Exclusive microbadges!
Custom signed stickers & game bags crocheted with love!
Waterjet meeples and lucky dips galore!
Ogre dice and ogre earrings!
T-shirts!! Represent in sizes S-XXXL with one of the three options shown!
Co-host or direct the show!
Get your game tested! Join a secret society!
MEGA GLASS!!!!
As you can see from these pictures, there's a lot of options for backer rewards in this campaign, and I'm using an a'la carte WILDCARD system to let people choose what combination of them they'd like. 
For more details, here's a quick video where I show/talk about the various rewards and explain how the WILDCARD reward system works:

THE STRETCH GOALS 
Okay, so the target goal for this year basically covers all the new games I'll be acquiring to film, another trip to Essen for more convention coverage and a basic salary for me and Paulo Renato (the fine fellow who fact checks and annotates all my vids... Paulo is l'awesome and keeps me honest!). But, if we go above and beyond the target, below is some additional content that can be provided over the next 12 months!
Stretch Goal #1: Jen Runs Through ($35,000)
Rahdo Runs Through is mostly a one-man show, but people do love it when my lovely wife Jen makes appearances to help me play and demonstrate the games (rather than my normal "virtual" Jen gaming partner!) 
Of course, it's time consuming to film runthroughs, and that takes her away from her actual career of making beautiful glass art. But, if we hit this first stretch goal, Jen will commit to appearing in 12 runthroughs over the course of the year (roughly once each month), and I can tell you right now, the shows she's in are always the most fun to watch! 
To give you an idea of what a Jen-enhanced video is like, here's a playlist of all the videos she's been in to date: http://jen.rahdo.com
Stretch Goal #2: Rahdo Talks Through, the Podcast ($40,000)  
Hitting this stretch goal means I'll continue my monthly Golden Geek Award-nominated podcast series which started last year (no kidding, I almost won an award!!!) where I talk about exciting upcoming games, revisit top10 topics to delve further, and answer plenty of questions (joined each month by Jen).
You can subscribe to the series here: http://podcast.rahdo.com
Stretch Goal #3: Rahdo Runs Through LIVE! ($45,000)
So, last year marked my first foray into the world of YouTube live-casting runthroughs and Q&A sessions, and they seemed to go over very well, with 6 events being aired bi-monthly. There's a fair bit of work in setting these up, but if we hit this stretch goal, I'm up for filming 6 more this year!  
Here's a playlist of last year's live events to see what they're like!
Stretch Goal #4: LeiriaCon! ($50,000)
LeiriaCon is a very popular convention held in Portugal every January, and it just so happens that my fact check/annotations guy Paulo always attends. So if we hit this, I will attend also, cover the convention, and film some video with Paulo, which I think will be a lot of fun. We'll see if he makes as much fun of me in real life! And Jen's schedule permitting, she'll come along as well and get in the team-up videos also!
Stretch Goal #5: Periscope School ($55,000)
A live monthly broadcast via Periscope where I teach Jen (and anyone watching) how to play a new game (see latest update for more details)
"Thanks for watching, talk to you later, so long, buh bye!"

Both versions of the game and add-on content is available for pre-order on our website, for a limited time.
Thank You!
Cetizens, we are forever grateful for the amazing support you have shown us during this campaign! We are so excited for the journey ahead, and can't wait to get TAU CETI: Planetary Crisis in your hands!
All Stretch Goals Unlocked!!!
"I really dug Tau Ceti for so many reasons, it's not like any other 4X game I've played. If you're a fan of the genre you're really going to like it as well." - Lance Myxter (Undead Viking)
"For anyone who is a fan of sandbox games with a space opera setting, offering multiple paths to explore and strategies to tackle, this is one to definitely back!" - Maurice Fitzgerald (Club Fantasci)
8 custom engraved 16mm Alien Dice are inluded with every game!
TAU CETI: Planetary Crisis is a 1-5 player competitive game centered on an economic engine, asymmetric powers, and strategic manipulation. TAU CETI tells a story of a newly formed alliance between several alien factions in a time of galactic declension, who compete for influence as they lead their civilization through a crisis-ridden star system.
With multiple paths to victory, you are free to: explore the mysterious outer reaches of the star system for knowledge, recruit specialists to help you resolve crises, exploit opportunities through trade, buy/sell commodities as the market fluctuates across planets, complete missions for money, build orbitals and defend them against enemies, acquire exotic technologies, and upgrade your starship's systems for greater advantages as you navigate the cosmic environment. 
TAU CETI has all the elements of a 4X game, but allows you to advance at your own pace with à la carte advanced rules, and can be played in less than 2 hours.
You may download the rules below.

Solo Variant Rules

Want to try out the game? Feel free to download the free Print & Play and Solo Variant.

Everything you need to play the game is already included in both versions, though some backers like to have extra components for various reasons. So we have made the following add-ons available.
To add-on items to your pledge, manually add the $ amount to your pledge. We will be using a pledge manager, so you can conveniently verify your add-ons after the campaign.
If you want to order an add-on without the game, you can do so via the $1 pledge, but you will need to add an additional $6 for shipping (for anywhere in the world). If you order more than one add-on (combinations are fine) without the game, you only need to pay the $6 shipping charge once.
Custom designed starship minatures (included with the Premium version), which reflect the background and level of technology of each alien faction. Each starship miniature base is 35mm, with a height of 28 - 32mm.
Player Board (Interface) example, where each player manages their resources, actions and starship's systems
TAU CETI can be arranged in many different ways. The modular hex system adds to the strategy of the game, and creates a high level of replayability. All hex tiles and cardboard tokens are double sided, and 2mm thick!
All stretch goals have been play tested, planned and budgeted for.
Facebook | Twitter | BoardGameGeek
Objective Cards!
Avatars
Show your support for TAU CETI by changing your social media profile picture to one of our avatars!
"I like how all the different aspects work together in this game. All in all, this was a really fun experience, and I think this is a fantastic venture and awesome game." - Michael Forder (NVS Gameplays)
"I really dug Tau Ceti for so many reasons, it's not like any other 4X game I've played. If you're a fan of the genre you're really going to like it as well." - Lance Myxter (Undead Viking)
"I like the options, I like how the game can fluctuate and turn on you each Cetian Cycle" - Joshua Thomas (Failroad Express)
"It feels like I was playing a game that had 3 or 4 expansions added on to it. It's going to be a long time before anyone can actually say, I'm done with that game. This game comes with so many things, you could probably cut it in half and it would still be a great value." - Christopher Lachey (Failroad Express)
Benjamin Törck - (Brettspielblog) German review below
"For anyone who is a fan of sandbox games with a space opera setting, offering multiple paths to explore and strategies to tackle, this is one to definitely back!" - Maurice Fitzgerald (Club Fantasci)
"If you're into sci-fi at all, this game will hit your hot buttons. This game has a lot of different ways to play it, including solo play, so I'm going to say there's lots of replay value." - Mac Senour (Game Rustlers)
"I think it's really exciting! I like the color scheme, I love the hexagon based maps, I like how you build the map together.. the dice are beautiful." - Brawling Brothers Podcast
"It’s an advanced take on the 4x genre, but allowing you to play the game at your own pace." - Maero Effendi (The Final Roll Podcast)
"The 4X genre is a bit of a niche. All of the usual trappings are present here, with the standout elements being custom starship miniatures — because who doesn't like toys — and the addition of rules for solo play."- Dustin Schwartz (BGG News)
"Enter the science fiction world of TAU CETI. Interact with aliens and strange environments. Make the decisions that will save the human race from extinction!" - Ben Bova (award winning sci-fi author)
"I have been in the gaming industry for decades, from retail to playing, collecting, play testing and developing other titles.. I recommend this game, as it will improve your collection! With great design, graphics and reasonable game time it is sure to be enjoyable to all that love space themed games." - Frank Muscarella (former game store owner, collector, developer)
TAU CETI was voted as one of the "Top 10 Most Anticipated Game of 2016" on Board Game Geek, in multiple categories.
The "Living Starship" NPC, included with the Premium version (designed by Charles Oines)
You can download the complete Multiplayer Rules, Solo Rules, and NPC Rules if you'd like to learn all the details about the game. 
Game Play Video
Solo Variant Video
TAU CETI has been in development for 2 1/2 years, and play tested over 200 times by 50+ individual play testers from around the world.
To everyone who play tested TAU CETI, thank you!
Our play testers found the following aspects of TAU CETI to be the most fulfilling:
Asymmetry with pairing factions, alien character abilities, specialists, and unique starships create a high level of variability and replayability.
Manipulation in TAU CETI is ever-present, with freedom in decision making, which allows you to plan secret agendas and strategies.
Fun Scientific flavor text and unique backstory painted over a solid Economic engine, creates realistic experiences in a sci-fi world.
Solo Variant designed to mimic the multiplayer game, the solo variant includes multiple AI's which react to your decisions, creating a unique and unpredictable experience with each game.
Unique Battle Mechanics between starships, which utilize 3 different systems (weapons, shields, computers), combined with a bit of luck, and calculated decisions involving placement of shields and utilization of Specialists. Battle is quick, engaging and satisfying!
Alien dice!
Advanced Specialist Promo Pack (36 unique cards) will be included with every Kickstarter copy of the game, for free. These Advanced Specialists feature a variety of abilities focused on Trade, Military, and Science. You may utilize their abilities when they become a part of your crew, via the Recruit action.
These are not Kickstarter Exclusive, and will be available for an additional cost to those who discover TAU CETI after the Kickstarter campaign.
A few examples of the Advanced Specialists cards
Each Advanced Specialist is unique! A Signal's Analyst, Biochemical Engineer, Commodities Broker, Counterplot Expert, Cryptologist, Customs Officer, and Accelerator Physicist are among the variety of Advanced Specialists included.
A special thanks to Joe Pilkus for coming up with, and developing all of the Advanced Specialists.

24 Orbital Miniatures (4 of each color) in Premium Edition
We will be using the Stonemaier method to ship games in bulk to fulfillment centers around the world, so backers in the U.S., Canada, European Union, and Australia can avoid customs fees & VAT.  Shipping is FREE to the US, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan & TAU CETI. 
Backers are limited to 2 games per pledge (a mix of both editions of the game is fine; only pay the shipping fee once per pledge, not once per game). To add a second game (or add-ons), manually enter the $ total when making your pledge or click the blue "Manage" button next to a previously made pledge.  If you'd like more than 2 copies of Tau Ceti, or more than 3 copies of Premium Tau Ceti, please email us.
Are you a backer from a country where shipping is more expensive?  If so, you can save on shipping by connecting with a local group of backers and ordering a bundle of 3 games (bundle of 3 is only available for the Premium Edition), but only pay shipping for one game. Since we save money when shipping multiple games in a carton, we wanted to pass those savings on to you. We have set up a forum on BoardGameGeek here, where you can find other backers in your area to form groups of 3.
US fulfillment via Fulfillrite, Canadian fulfillment via Snakes & Lattes, European fulfillment via Happyshops, Tau Cetian fulfillment via Wormhole
Prototype
We love to support games stores around the world!  If you're a retailer, please contact Stan at info@outerlimitgames.com during the campaign for pricing information.
A few of the Interplanetary Mission cards!
We Need You: My dad and I have invested thousands of hours of our time, and thousands of dollars on art and development for TAU CETI over the past 2 1/2 years. The game has been fully play tested and the art is over 95% complete. But now is when we need your help, we cannot manufacture and ship TAU CETI to you without your pledge.
We Communicate: As a backer, you are extremely important to us, and we will always respond promptly to any questions or feedback you may have. That is our promise.
Free Promo Content: 18 "Advanced" Specialist Promo cards (with up to 18 more added as we unlock social goals) will be included for free to those who pledge during the campaign, but will be sold at a cost after the campaign.

Money Back Guarantee: If you don’t like TAU CETI for any reason, you may return it within 30 days of receiving it for a full refund of the version you pledged for. You will just need to provide the return postage.
Stan Strickland is the co-designer of TAU CETI, and co-founder of Outer Limit Games.  Stan's background is in Meteorology and business, and he was a Science & Math teacher for 25 years. He designed, self published and marketed his first board game in 1988.
Mike Strickland is the co-designer and graphic artist for TAU CETI, and co-founder of Outer Limit Games. Mike's background is in Business and Computer Information Systems. He is a graphic/web designer, electronic music producer and a regular contributor to the Designer's Corner Vodcast.
Custom designed wood starships, included in both versions of the game
A Special Thanks To Our Creative Team!
Joe Pilkus is the developer, editor, and lead Ambassador for TAU CETI. Joe is responsible for the Advanced Specialist promo cards, and an array of other cool ideas we have implemented over the past 6 months. With his Masters Degree in International Relations, over 20 years in the U.S. Air Force, and having developed nearly four dozen war games, Joe brings a wealth of experience and knowledge to the table!
Santiago Reinoso Muñoz is our lead illustrator and artist, and also contributed to some of the graphic design and 3D modeling for TAU CETI. Santiago is a graphic designer and professional illustrator with more than 25 years experience. He is also a realistic digital and traditional painter, video game artist, comic creator, and 3D modeler/sculptor. Santiago does it all, and we are proud to have had the opportunity to work with him on this project, as his technical and artistic expertise has been an integral part of the development of TAU CETI.
Mechanoid is a 3D modeler for TAU CETI. She designed the starships for the Xunons, Zorhkonians, Azars, Qyarians, and Terrans. Her unique vision enabled her to conceptualize every detail in her designs with passion and meaning. She interpreted the design of each star ship precisely in a way that encompasses the essence of each alien race, their technology, and planetary environment.
Charles Oines is a 3D modeler for TAU CETI. Charles designed the starship for the Triolors, as well as the NPC starship. Richard Gardner, Ed.D., Ben Bova, Jamey Stegmaier, Maurice Fitzgerald, Lance Myxter, Michael Forder, Joey Vigour, Paul Barrett, Tom McGreevy, Frank Muscarella, Dirk Mushenko, Justin Egan, Peter Blackwell, Josh Willhite, Josh & Amy (Dungeon Games), Zachery Tracy (2 Drop Game Shop), Andrew Brown (Budget Friendly Games), Chris Peach, Jason Meyers.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First and foremost, we recognize that there is always risk in choosing to back a new publisher, and so we appreciate you having faith in our ability to deliver on our promise, and allowing us the opportunity to earn your trust. 

In order to prepare for the task ahead of us, we have spent the past 2 1/2 years studying Jamey Stegmaier's, James Mathe's, and many other successful Kickstarter project creator's blogs on how to successfully launch, execute, and deliver using Kickstarter. 

Together, my dad and I have successfully started and managed service and retail oriented businesses. We understand the responsibilities and dedication that is required to run a business, and are ready to tackle any unforeseen challenges that could occur along the way. Our primary risks at this point lie in manufacturing and shipping. 

We have established a solid relationship with WinGo Games, a reputable manufacturer that is trusted within the industry. We have ensured that all of our questions have been answered ahead of time, so we know exactly what to expect from WinGo, and WinGo knows what to expect from us as well. 

We will work diligently on our end to ensure the final art and graphic files are completed and delivered on time, and according to WinGo's specifications as to avoid potential delays and other issues. There are some things that will be out of our hands during the manufacturing process, such as labor force fluctuations, Chinese holidays, etc. We have taken those things into consideration, and have given ourselves an extra cushion of time for things that could occur beyond our control. 

We have carefully planned our logistics, and have established correspondence with fulfillment companies around the world, which we feel confident in handling our shipments from the factory to your doorstep when that time comes. 

Getting this game in your hands and in perfect condition, within the stated delivery time is our primary focus and concern. We will work swiftly to resolve any issues in manufacturing and shipping, should they occur. We will be transparent with you at all times, and let you know right away when an issue occurs, what that issue is, and how we intend to resolve it. That is our promise to you.

updates.update_content: I just wanted to give everyone a quick update.  I have very sad news.  Mike, my son and co-partner on this project passed away December 2, 2019 due to heart failure.  As most of you know, Mike was an large part of Outer Limit Games.  He was the brain behind most of the projects.  We will miss him more than words could ever say.  Mike was a Christian and loved Jesus and we know he is in Heather celebrating Christmas with our Lord and Savior.  My wife, daughter and I know we will see him again.  We have that blessed assurance as Christians.

updates.update_userinfo: Hope You're Enjoying The Game + Replacements!
updates.update_content:
I just wanted to check in as it has been a while - I hope everyone is enjoying the game and doing well!
Work continues on my end - there are a small handful of non-US backers who moved and didn’t update their address with us, or got lost in transit so I have been working with individual shippers within their countries to try and locate and hopefully, have their game forwarded ASAP.  Otherwise, the only other option for those small handful of backers will be for me to ship their game individually from the US, which is very expensive, but I’ll do what I have to do to ensure they are taken care of.
On another note, I haven’t forgotten about those of you who need . The list is relatively small for those who reported damages and missing parts, but it’s still a complicated undertaking, as many of those who need replacement parts are in other parts of the world. If I could incorporate Jamey Stegmaier’s approach to handling this part of the operation it would be ideal, but I don’t have the scale or resources (people who can readily ship out replacements in different parts of the World) being such a small company. So I am going to work with each backer who has requested replacement parts, individually, as I will be discussing the options with them to ensure everyone gets taken care of - soon!

Hi! While this won't be our final update, it does serve as a celebratory one as almost all games have been fulfilled!
Fulfillment 99% complete!
Yes, we've FINALLY just about made it to the end, as we have only just a small handful of backers waiting on their copy of the game. We're showing about 10 or so backers, according to our records, who have yet to receive their game, and that is mostly due to games being sent to the wrong address, as many backers moved and we never received an updated address on our end. It has been a challenge for us the past couple months trying to locate games, and get them redirected to the appropriate addresses (there were a lot of them!), but we're making progress on getting the few that are left resolved and rectified, so we felt it was a good time to share this update!

To the few of you still waiting on fulfillment, this update is for you! First and foremost, we cannot express how much we appreciate your continued and unwavering patience while we work for you to ensure you have your game. If you're one of those who have yet to receive your game, DO NOT WORRY, as we've already expressed, you WILL receive it. 
As it was expected shippers were delayed over the holidays, and our fulfillment companies closed for a number of days as well during that time. That's something that was out of our hands but expected. Now, the few of you remaining should have your games en-route to you this month. There are no foreseeable delays, so our expectation is for EVERYONE to have their games by the end of this month.

It's time for our scheduled monthly update for the remaining few still patiently waiting for your copy of Tau Ceti. Based on the funds we were able to put into fulfillment this month, I believe we will be able to have approximately 22 - 25 games sent out this week. That may not sound like a lot, but please keep in mind we're having to also pay a large chunk of money toward warehousing fees. As you can imagine, our warehousing fees have been accumulating heavily over the months, though we've tried our best to stay on top of them in addition to fulfilling games out of our own pocket. It has been an incredibly challenging financial task for us, but we've persevered through it and are almost there!  Based on what our records indicate, that leaves us with about 27-30 games left.

We wanted to send out our scheduled monthly update to those of you still patiently waiting for your copy of Tau Ceti. We are able to ship 26 games this month (October), in addition to 6 more that were likely already shipped or marked shipped from September that were sent to wrong addresses. We had hoped to ship more but we were stuck paying warehousing fees. We are now down to 52 games left to fulfill. Like last month, we had a few backers send us an email to update their shipping addresses. Thank you so much.
Based on our progress, we predict that everyone will have their copy by December. And to recap what we said last month; when we get down to the last batch, we will post a “Final Fulfillment Update” so that we can allow anyone who might have slipped through the cracks the opportunity to reach out to us. We will be checking and rechecking our fulfillment records to make sure everyone has received their game. We will also begin replacing any damaged or missing parts at that time.

As promised, we want to keep the handful of backers who are still waiting on fulfillment in the loop with a monthly update on our progress.
We're down to 192 games games left to fulfill, and again, we extend our sincerest thanks to each of you who have had to wait and have remained positive as we know it's been a long process.
As a friendly reminder, damaged and missing parts will be addressed as soon as everyone has received their games. We are keeping a detailed list of replacements that need to be sent out, which can be uploaded via the following form.

campaign.story:
Hello everyone and welcome! In this 3 part video series, I will be showing you exactly how to setup and play Dungeon Crusade. From the very start, and into gameplay. I think it is paramount to show you for one, Dungeon Crusade is not a complex game, and second what I mean by  "open world dungeon crawl board game". Part 2 will be on shortly. But for now, enjoy learning about Dungeon Crusade! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gce8d4N-h0c
 Hello all!  We are preparing the "How to setup and play Dungeon Crusade" video right now. In the meantime, sit back, relax, pop some popcorn and enjoy the world debut showcase video. This was shot about a month ago, and the game is in a ever changing state of refinement and fine tuning to make it top notch. We hope you enjoy the Dungeon Crusade showcase video! :)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1VEQ85-VqZs
 Here is a great demo of the Avalon Adventure board game for you guys to check out. Enjoy!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xytSQ5G55sw&feature=youtu.be
     In forming Groovus Games Unlimited, I wanted this company to stand for 3 things that are paramount to me. Honesty, quality and quantity.  
     Honesty in the form of showing backers as much of the game as I can, being straightforward with what content is being presented.
      If you notice to the side, there are "create a hero" packages. There is NO up-charge for this. This will never happen at Groovus Games Unlimited. Instead, I'm honored and thrilled to have backers use their creativity and imagination to give these heroes names and backstories, and have the backer's name on the hero card for their contribution to the game. You simply can't put a price tag on that. Well, some people do, but at Groovus Games Unlimited, we want you to keep your money and just worry about creating with us, helping to make an awesome game that is truly "ours." 
      Quality and Quantity. Very rarely do you see these two things together, but with our first launch title, that is what we are striving to give our fellow gamers. The quantity you can clearly see below. The quality will come from the fairly huge development team that has been assembled for the Dungeon Crusade project. People from all around the world are committed, determined and focused on bringing this game to fruition for everyone to enjoy. 
     Lastly, with Groovus Games Unlimited, we don't believe in producing "exclusive" content with high price tags and in limited quantity. It's our belief that everyone should have a right to enjoy ALL of the content that is offered across the board equally at a great price point. So in closing, enjoy the Dungeon Crusade campaign, and I hope the game meets or exceeds your expectations. Have a great time all! Rodger "Groovus" Deering 
 The world's first open world dungeon crawl board game, Dungeon Crusade is a hybrid game inspired by two of the golden ages of gaming, which are board games and computer RPG's of years past. Built from the ground up for solo or co-op play.  
      Take control of 6 legendary heroes and their trusty fetch-hound, Albus, as they set out in a massive, open world dungeon to complete quests for villagers, find ancient treasure chests that may be empty, trapped or full of loot, pick locks on secret rooms, gain lifeforce, mine for minerals to craft powerful gems for their gear, find crates to smash open, plus new encounters every turn for the heroes to experience. Enjoy gifts from the villagers on celebration day, shop in the village, and gamble at the house of chance. Experience a "living dungeon" with the exclusive game mechanic the "patrol route system", where monsters move through the dungeon with unpredictable and random movement patterns. Battle minions who are attempting to raid the village, fight the champions who lurk in the chambers of the dungeon, and come face to face with the guardians of the dungeon, all while trying to clear the quest tables to achieve victory and save the village! So prepare thyself, hero, for a game of epic proportions where strategy, tactics and planning are a must. I personally welcome each and every one of you to Avalon, to enjoy a creative evolution in game design. This is Dungeon Crusade!
Our rogue hero is about to ambush a pesky minion!
Enjoy open world dungeon crawling in Dungeon Crusade! Experience the concept of a "living dungeon" with monsters who roam through out the dungeon, while the heroes are questing within it's depths.
To win, pick a scenario from the scenario booklet or create your own scenario. After setting up the game as the scenario describes, the heroes goal is to clear the 3 quest tables, which will turn the elder globes upon the tables from red to a green status, indicating there is purity within the dungeon. When all 3 elder globes have a green status, the heroes have won that scenario, and saved the village!
Close the books on the quest table by completing quests. When the books on the table have been closed, flip the elder globe to the reverse side.
Welcome to Dungeon Crusade! 1 of 4 gameworlds being shown
 *Reaper Miniatures miniatures are being used without permission and are only examples of the type of models that will be included. The miniatures shown will not be the final product.
* Groovus Games Unlimited: Our 3D sculptor, Krisztian Hartmann will be in charge of producing fresh, original miniatures exclusive to Dungeon Crusade. We encourage everyone to view Krisztian's work. It is simply stunning. https://www.artstation.com/artist/krisztianhartmann
We would like to say a big thank you to Matt Clark and all of the awesome associates of Reaper Miniatures. 
Game contents for base edition of Dungeon Crusade.
Game contents for base edition of Dungeon Crusade.
Game contents for base edition of Dungeon Crusade.
Travel across Avalon to recover the 3 magical runes to shatter the curse on the dungeon doors.
Over 245 pieces creative of writing to experience with your heroes. No two games are ever the same!
The Avalon Adventure Board Game is played before you play Dungeon Crusade. The heroes must recover the 3 magical runes that are randomly placed around Avalon at the start of the game. Once they are recovered, proceed to the dungeon and shatter the curse on the dungeon doors. Complete mini quests and attribute tests, acquire gear and loot, fight monsters, get into trouble in the villages and much more. No two games are ever the same. So get ready heroes, to embark on a grand adventure across Avalon!
   Shop at the village on celebration day, or send the hero’s fetch-hound, Albus, to the village to fetch items for the heroes while they are in the dungeon. Heal at the temple, recover essence at the inn, craft gems and buy gear at the blacksmith, visit the academy to level up or acquire new abilities, visit the bazaar to restock on potions and torches, and finally, gamble at the House of Chance. Yes...Dungeon Crusade has it's own gambling hall for the heroes! ;)
   Now enjoy some screenshots of the features and exclusive content that Dungeon Crusade will provide players with.  
Each hero is proficient in 2 of the 6 warfare types. Notice the sliders for keeping track of health and essence.
At the start of a game, random crates are placed within certain chambers of the dungeon. Smash open crates to see what they hold!
On celebration day, a hero can receive a blessing from the village's temple. Sometimes your prayers will go unheard, other times angels will come to a hero's aid in his time of need.
When the heroes clear a quest table, it's time for celebration day in the village! The villagers will bestow a gift upon the heroes for their help.
Welcome to the monster deck section of Dungeon Crusade. There is a total of 87 monsters right now in the game, 45 being unique. And yes, this total WILL grow.
Here we see the heroes combating a champion monster within a chamber. A hero can "rally" up to 2 other heroes to fight alongside him. Build a party of heroes to take on the evils of the dungeon!
The colored dice represent the 6 different types of warfare in Avalon. Building a party of heroes that complement each other, is essential to slaying the creatures & monsters that reside within the dungeon.
An innovative and fresh quest system will provide players with a sense of uncertainty and randomness in every game. Players will never be sure of what kind of monsters lurk behind the chamber doors, guarding the valuable quest items.
Open world dungeon crawling. Go where you want, do what you want!
Our warrior hero decides to go off to a remote part of the dungeon without his companions. Watch out hero! Dreadthorn, one of the guardians is heading down the hallway straight for you!
A group of minions are gathered in the southwestern part of the dungeon. Possibly one or more of them could convert from being a vagrant minion into a raiding minion, and will head off to the village to raid it!
Dungeon Crusade also offers mining & crafting. Buy a pickaxe from the village and mine for minerals. But be warned, every game the mining sites change. Albus or the heroes must scout out where they are located in order to mine.
Here we see the archer and rogue planning an attack on one of the 2 minions shown. They want to combine their warfare types to do as much damage as possible in hopes of slaying one of the minions.
Discover secret rooms in the dungeons of Dungeon Crusade. But hold on, little adventurer! These doors don't simply open, a hero must pick the lock to gain entrance to see what the chamber holds within.
At the top of the hierarchy of monsters, sit the guardians of Dungeon Crusade. These boss-like creatures can sense a hero when he gets within a certain radius. The creature will track him and attempt to end his life.
Every turn, every game, the encounter deck offers events, challenges and environment changes to keep players always guessing on what is going to come next at their heroes.
It would have been easy to just add text, and no art on the cards. But at Groovus Games Unlimited, we want our players immersed in the game, and make it a highly thematic experience for them.
     As of right now, there are 112 encounter cards and more are on the way. At the start of every game, you shuffle the encounter deck and deal out 40 cards at random. This forms the encounter deck. Every game, you will have no idea what encounters the heroes will have to deal with. Surprises, randomness and whimsical gameplay is at the heart of Dungeon Crusade.
The Patrol Route System will offer the soloist and co-op gamer a truly new experience, with the notion of a "living dungeon."
      Created and developed exclusively for Dungeon Crusade, the patrol route system is a true break-through game mechanic and system that will give the soloist and co-op gamers the concept of a "living dungeon." Creatures and monsters will have unpredictable movement causing them to roam freely throughout the dungeon, keeping the heroes always guessing where they will move next. Players will be forced to use strategy and tactics and plan their moves accordingly. You as the player, will never have to think for the monsters again.
Welcome heroes! To the House of Chance!
 Another exclusive to Dungeon Crusade is the House of Chance located in the northwest part of the village. On celebration day, heroes can visit the house of chance and gamble on 4 different games in a attempt to win gold to spend in the village, before heading back down into the dungeon. So put your gold on the table, grab a mug of ale, and get playing in the House of Chance!  
Tower Attack. This game will be included in the base and crusader edition of Dungeon Crusade.
 In Tower Attack, the heroes must take the tower back from the evil skeleton army! Tower Attack is a dice pushing game where you have 3 attempts to match or exceed the numbers shown on the particular level the hero may be on. If a hero is unsuccessful, they are stuck on that level until it is beaten.
Heroes vs. Monsters. This game will be a stretch goal that will unlock, and will be part of the crusader edition package.
 In Heroes vs. Monsters, the 3 heroes must defend the chapel of light against the advancing monsters. The heroes have action points that they can spend each turn to move and attack. If at least one monster makes it to the chapel of light, the heroes lose and must replay that level. There are 8 challenge cards with Heroes vs. Monsters, each challenge card becomes more difficult than the previous one.
Skull Jack. This game will be a stretch goal that will unlock, and will be part of the crusader edition package.
Skull Jack is a simple form of Black Jack. Up to 3 heroes can play. Bet 200 gold per hand. On a win, win your bet back, plus an additional 200 gold. One of the artists will be designing an exclusive set of playing cards that has the Dungeon Crusade theme. 
The Adventures of Bravely the Knight. This game will be a stretch goal that will unlock, and will be part of the crusader edition package.
 In the game, The Adventures on Bravely the Knight, join Bravely as he descends into a monster filled, trap riddled dungeon in a attempt to plunder the gold within. Any gold that Bravely recovers, the heroes receive! So pick up your sword and shield and join Bravely on a tiny, yet epic dungeon crawl! 
Jesse Hansen - Besides being the art director for heroes and monsters, Jesse is the founder of Cornerstone Creative Studios. He has a team of artists who will be assisting him in the creation of the final monster and hero design for Dungeon Crusade.  Having Jesse and his team at the helm, will no doubt speed up the process in the completion of Dungeon Crusade. https://www.facebook.com/CornerstoneCreativeStudios/?__mref=message_bubble 
 Krisztian Hartman - Krisztian will be providing the final exclusive miniatures for Dungeon Crusade. He will be provided with the placeholder miniatures, and use these only as a baseline for him to create his vision, with his creativity and imagination for the miniatures for Dungeon Crusade. I highly encourage everyone to view his work, it is simply stunning! https://www.artstation.com/artist/krisztianhartmann
Shaun Ellis - Shaun Ellis is the lead artist for the game world of Dungeon Crusade, and the final loot design. Shaun also has associates under him that will be assisting in the creation of the dungeons and loot for the final release of Dungeon Crusade. https://www.artstation.com/artist/sellis
Joseph Arnold - Joseph will be working along side Jesse in the creation of the final hero and monster design for Dungeon Crusade. The look I am striving for with Dungeon Crusade, was found within Jesse and Joseph. Their imagination, creativity and talent is simply incredible. http://josepharnoldart.wix.com/a#!portfolio and here is another link   https://www.facebook.com/JosephArnoldart/?__mref=message_bubble
Camron Brown - Camron will be doing many different tasks. He will be tasked with creating the small sketches for the encounter cards. Truly another major force to have for the final version of Dungeon Crusade. https://camronbrown.artstation.com/
Tay LeCompte - Tay is a awesome and talented young lady. When I saw Tay's art, I knew she was the one to re-create Albus, the heroes fetchound for the final release of Dungeon Crusade. Tay will also be tasked with a few other jobs for the final release of the game. http://taylilly-arts.tumblr.com/
Leslie Casilli - Leslie was one of the first artists to join me, and someone who really believed in my vision for what I wanted to do for people and fellow gamers. She provided a few pieces of incredible art to get the project going. Leslie has since moved onto to her own exciting projects to pursue her own dreams and goals. I hold Leslie in the highest regard, as she is part of the Dungeon Crusade history. I would invite you to look at some of her art, simply stunning!
 https://www.facebook.com/LeslieCasilliIllustration/?fref=ts
WinGo Games - The awesome folks at WinGo games will be the company that will be producing the game for us. They have went above and beyond with their customer service, and we are delighted to be partnered with them. http://www.wingogames.com/
Fullfilrite - Groovus Games Unlimited as also partnered with Fullfilrite for reward fulfillment within the U.S. Their track record is impeccable, and we are thrilled to have them along with us. http://fulfillrite.com/
Shipwire - Another one of our partners is Shipwire. I am happy to announce that rewards bound for the EU and Canada will carry the "EU" and "Canada" friendly shipping. Shipwire has distribution within these places, and that will help backers out on not occurring VAT, taxes and duty for them. https://www.shipwire.com/pp/fulfillment.php
   Below is something I created for the backers, and will hopefully catch on for other projects. Let me explain.
  When I look at kickstarter projects, I would like a system to learn the game in a quick, easy and fun way. Now Dungeon Crusade may look very complex, and it isn't at all. I designed Dungeon Crusade to have a sense of familiarity to it, and be very accessible to players. I want to get them into the game quick, and have them having fun in no time.
    This system you will see below, I believe will get you acclimated to Dungeon Crusade very quickly and easily, and you'll have a fun time reading it. No tiny text, or anything ambiguous. Just easy to follow "poster panels" that will hopefully excite you, and teach you a majority of the game. 
   So sit back and relax! And enjoy the "poster panel" section. 
The art of Shaun Ellis, lead artist for the game world of Dungeon Crusade. This is a great indication of the final look of the game with Shaun creating all of the different gameworld areas.
By hand, I crafted the land of Avalon with 50 different locations to give fellow gamers a truly immersive experience that is reminiscent of games such as Baldur's Gate, Might & Magic and the Ultima series.
The massive loot deck of Dungeon Crusade. 190 loot cards just in the base edition, plus MUCH more in the form of stretch goals.
A evil force has risen in the land of Avalon, and your heroes will come face to face with The Blackhand Army.
Shaun Ellis. Lead artist for the game world and loot for Dungeon Crusade.
Another evil faction that opposes the heroes...The Faith.
Yet another faction in Dungeon Crusade, The Maidens of Witherbrook Forest
In the massive land of Avalon, there are 5 different races of creatures and monsters.
Concept art from Joseph Arnold
Jesse Hansen and his studio will be behind the creation of the heroes and monsters in Dungeon Crusade, and bring to it a unique, retro, yet modern look to the game.
Dungeon Crusade will have an entire art studio, Cornerstone Creative Studios, devoted to bringing the heroes and monsters to life for fellow gamer's and people to enjoy. (this pic is of course a W.I.P. (work in progress)
The archer hero being worked on by Jesse at Cornerstone Creative Studios.
   Shipping charges will be calculated after the campaign ends. At Groovus Games Unlimited, we want backers to pay EXACT shipping and not a penny more. We will be working with the Pledge Manager for this process. Also, we have no way of telling how many stretch goals will be unlocked, and shipping may change based on this factor.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In pledging to a reward package for Dungeon Crusade, you acknowledge that the final look of the game, materials, game content and rewards are subject to change and will differ substantially from what is being presented within this Kickstarter project. This prototype game within Kickstarter, will be used as a baseline for all of the artists, illustrators and the 3D modeler involved to use their creativity, imagination and talent to create the final retail version of Dungeon Crusade. What you are viewing is the prototype game of Dungeon Crusade. 

 The prototype game looks very strong already, but the final version will be one of the most visually striking games for a fantasy/dungeon/adventure game that has been seen in recent years. 

 Other factors, of course, are production delays, shipping delays and customs delays, which are out of our control. However, the company we have partnered with, WinGo games, and our customs broker are very acclimated at handling things such as this, and the process should be smooth. 

 Lastly, I have put a ship date of Feb 2017, however, I do anticipate a much earlier date for this project to be final and ready to ship. A lot of the hard work has been completed already. Artists do not need to produce concept art. This has been established already within the prototype game. Hardcore playtesting is being conducted to debug the rules, clarify special abilities, line of sight rules, etc. My personal goal is to have this ready for Christmas 2016. Why? Because who wouldn't want Dungeon Crusade under the tree?
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The relaunch of Dungeon Crusade tonight at 10PM (EST)
updates.update_content:
Hello all!! :) I hope everyone is doing great today! Well, the day is upon us....the launch of Dungeon Crusade. Myself, David and a few others have been up all night preparing for it....WE ARE READY!!!!! 

First off...all of the videos thus far are ready for viewing. You can find the Groovus Games Unlimited channel here and start watching! >>>> https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyK0dht51J_ERNNi0KwLeGA

Hello everyone I am very pleased to announce that we have a firm date for the relaunch of Dungeon Crusade; May 22nd!

As project manager for Dungeon Crusade I had a lot of things I wanted to make sure we had in place to make this a very smooth launch. I made Rodger reshoot brand new videos. They give you some quick overviews on parts of the game. Don’t worry there will still be Rodger sized ones to watch if you have a few hours. ;)  
Rodger also took the scattered rules he had and made a first draft of the rules document. He made an impressive effort to explain the game in great detail and included a lot of pictures and examples. This will be available for everyone to look through. We have an editor now going through it and cleaning it up, but I really look forward to community feedback on it and having you guys help us create a rulebook that is easy to read and clear. If there is one thing I hate personally it is playing a game, hitting an unclear rule, searching the booklet for 10 minutes not finding an answer, then searching the internet, ending up on BoardGameGeek on a thread for the rule during a raging argument for 4 different interpretations. I want these rules to be rock solid, that is very important to me and I have a feeling I am not alone in this.

We also have a super team of artists, who you will meet on the relaunch who have been hand picked to bring Dungeon Crusade to life. For me a game has to have great mechanics. But even if it has the most innovative mechanics in the world, if you are pushing different colored cubes around a grid, the game is going to lack life. It is important that the art helps place you in the game and gives you a sense of immersion. Our amazing artists have done a spectacular job so far and I need to point out they have not been paid yet. As we have not funded yet, they have not been paid yet.

I also have been trying to get more presence with the YouTube community. This was more difficult than I thought, most of my emails were ignored. The ones who did get back to me, never got back to me a second time. We do have some more things lined up. If you have a Youtuber who you like and want to see them do a feature on Dungeon Crusade please poke them about it and have them contact us. We are a small (like very small, 2 people) start up company and this is our first (of hopefully many) products. Trying to get anyone to give us the time of day has been an exercise in patience.

  Which leads me to my final point before I turn over the mic to Rodger. We need YOU guys, the backers, to help us spread the word. I do have some advertising in place (with the main campaign happening on BoardGameGeek) but we can always use more. Talk about the game, post links, and get the word out. The drums of war have been sounded! Lead our armies forth!

I am confident we will fund, but over funding will unlock a lot of very cool additional content we have planned for the game. Overfunding enough means we can order enough to do a limited print run at the retail level! We never planned to go retail though so we’ll have to see where this takes us.

 And without further ado I leave you with the Creator of Dungeon Crusade. See you guys in less than a week!  

David Lockwood

Hello everyone! :) I hope everyone is doing great! When I launched on kickstarter, people learned fairly quickly it was only me doing EVERYTHING for this game. During that time on kickstarter, a lot of awesome people joined the project, and encouraged I relaunch with some better management in place, and take care of some glaring issues with the project.

  One of the first people who joined me was David Lockwood from Obsidian software. I almost consider him a brother at this point. :) He is such a awesome person. He brought so much focus, structure and help that I badly needed! What I lack in, he truly excels at.

For the relaunch on kickstarter, he is of course building the page this time around. LOL, I will not be doing a KS page again! Promise! ;) We have worked out many awesome stretch goals, got all of our totals together for the game, and truly helped me seeing things I really didn't see before.

A few more incredible artists have also joined the project. One of the artists in particular had recently worked on a certain game of the year. He saw Dungeon Crusade, and really wanted to be a part of it. Upon relaunch, we are going to reveal who it is. I'm blown away and honored to have him along for the relaunch.

Another young lady who has joined us has some of her work in the Pathfinder card game. Her art is simply stunning. She also is excited to be a part of Dungeon Crusade.

In the past month, I have created the Dungeon Crusade rulebook as David mentioned. It is a rough draft, but it looks, and reads great. Lots of diagrams and pictures for explaining the fundamentals of the game. Another person who has joined is a professional editor. He has the rulebook now, and is going over it and cleaning it up. The rulebook will be available for download for everyone to check out when we relaunch on kickstarter

A lot of the artists have submitted a great deal of preview art, and it looks truly stunning. We are going for a retro look of course, and these guys have nailed it perfectly. Think Heroquest, Warhammer Quest and DungeonQuest and you'll get the idea.

There will be 3 editions of Dungeon Crusade. Base edition, Crusader Edition and Master of the Realm edition. The great news is, all of the editions will be lower priced, and still have all the content that was promised. We are using double sided cardboard miniatures this time around. If you have seen the Legends of Andor's minis, they are on par for what the Dungeon Crusade minis will look like. Plus, it adheres to that retro vibe we are striving for.

So the bottom line is this, I finally got the help I needed from some incredible people, who share the vision I do on delivering a unique and innovative game to fellow gamers for them to enjoy.

To be honest, I was on serious overload a few months before launch, and most certainly during launch. I'm so much more at peace now, and relaxed from the help I have received, and it feels GREAT! :)

But what I would like to share with you tonight is a few of the new videos for the relaunch of Dungeon Crusade. What you will see is the basic setup for Dungeon Crusade, advanced setup (quick version), and advanced setup (long version). Let me explain…

Basic setup is about a 10 minute video. It shows the exact setup procedure you do before every game of Dungeon Crusade.

Advanced setup will show you the many variables to Dungeon Crusade from scenario to scenario, and how you can create very easy scenarios, to brutally hard scenarios and everything in between. I took the time to make a quick version of advanced setup, and a long version if you really want to learn more about Dungeon Crusade. I tried to film them so they would be enjoyable to watch. Some of the forthcoming videos will be:

•Combat explained with examples.  
•The patrol route system for the monsters of the dungeon
 •How to win Dungeon Crusade, celebration day and house of chance explained in one single video.
 •A gameplay video comprised of about 4-6 turns to give you guys an idea of the ebb and flow of Dungeon Crusade.  

  I'm using a new format to record with, a static cam and the videos are now much shorter, focused and to the point. They are very briskly paced. Above all, I want fellow gamers and people to feel at ease & comfortable with their pledge. And ask questions! As you have seen, I love to hear from people. The problem is shutting me up once I start talking. ;)  

Also, we have created our companies You Tube channel "Groovus Games Unlimited". We will be uploading all of the new videos there for the relaunch on kickstarter. All of the older legacy videos will of course be available on my personal channel for people to still take a look at.

I hope everyone has a great night and enjoys videos! Hopefully you gain more insight into the world of Dungeon Crusade. THANK YOU to everyone for your interest, time and patience for the relaunch of Dungeon Crusade! Talk to you soon...Rodger :)

Dirty Cops is a fast-paced game for 2 to 4 players. Players work together to fight teams of criminals, while stabbing each other in the back to get the most loot. The player with the most cash in the end wins.
Just because the last criminal is down, doesn't mean that scores have been settled yet!

Hailed as one of the top intimate theaters in Los Angeles, Antaeus Theatre Company is a cooperative theatre ensemble founded in 1991 to celebrate and reinvigorate the classics. Our Founders believed that Los Angeles actors could form a classical theatre company equal to any in the world. 
Today, our company is comprised of over 180 classically trained and highly accomplished actors - including people you see in film, television, and on Broadway - like these people:
From staging award-winning productions, to housing a Classics Library with 6,500 books, to providing arts education to underserved and incarcerated youth and young adults, to our Academy classes, to developing a tight-knit family of artists and audiences - we offer a lot. Take a look at what we accomplish in just one season:
Our company members range from faces you know to phenomenal actors that you might not recognize. We are extremely proud to say that every single member of our company has given to their capacity for this campaign. Now, we need to turn to a wider community to ask for help to build our New Home. 
 So why should YOU give? 
As you can see, we do a lot - all in a 49-seat theatre with very, very limited space. So in 2012, we embarked on a comprehensive examination of where we were as a company, where we wanted to be, and what we needed to make our dreams a reality. It was apparent that we had reached a tipping point; in order to continue to grow and take risks artistically, we needed to expand our space physically to better meet the needs of our artists and patrons. After a long search, we found our new home at 110 East Broadway in Glendale, CA: (cue the lights of heaven and angelic singing voices)
Artist's rendering of the Entrance and the Main Stage of our new home!
We don’t agree that it is mad, but there is definitely a method to it. 
Up to this point our Play On! Capital Campaign has raised $1.3 million of the $1.8 million we need to build our new home, BUT there is still more to do!
This Kickstarter campaign is a very important portion of what we still need. We have asked Shakespeare (#namedrop) to help explain how it all fits together:
We agree, and good question Shakespeare. 
Two things:
1.) Space 2.) More space 
In all seriousness, we are going to be able to expand our mainstage and add a second black box theatre. 
This is incredibly important for Antaeus. 
In our current space on many performance nights, we are faced with full houses and long wait lists (yes, we do classical theatre that well!). With the ability to house up to 88 seats, our new mainstage space will provide almost twice as many seats as our current North Hollywood location. A second 45-seat black box space will also allow us to explore smaller works, and offer a lower-priced ticket, which will have the added benefit of increasing accessibility for our patrons.
In addition to the added performance space, our new cultural center will provide us with a larger Classics Library - almost double the size of what we currently have now. Our Library is the heart of our company. It has become our gathering place, our classroom, and our core. Members constantly use the space for readings, students find a wealth of texts on our shelves that help them through their studies, and patrons know that they can gather here after any show to meet and share ideas with the actors they have just seen on our stage. 
We will also be building a proper lobby for our patrons, complete with a small art gallery space. The open floor plan will help us create a richer experience for our guests, and encourage them to come early and spend time viewing our gallery and enjoying the atmosphere, building community even before they enter the house. 
BUT WAIT. There is more. 
In addition to all the above, our new home will provide us with many essential areas to help our company perform the best work possible, like: 
An expanded dressing room with enough space to house our regularly large cast productions 
A green room and kitchen area to allow performers a space to prepare and meet 
A prop and construction area that will allow us to better serve the needs of our Production Manager (he is VERY excited about this) and faithful production volunteers
Yes! Antaeus Theatre Company is a registered 501(c)(3) which means that all donations are tax-deductible. How much? At the end of the campaign, we will ask you to specify via a Kickstarter survey what items you want, and any tangible benefits will be deducted from your total donation. We will send you a tax-receipt for the rest of your donation. Antaeus could not build our new home or continue the work we do without the support of individual donations from patrons like you!
To help bring awareness to our campaign, we decided to challenge our company members and friends to come up with the best Shakespeare insults, film themselves, and call out a friend or two. You can join as well! Use this link here to share this Kickstarter page. Help us raise money for our new home by classily insulting your friends!

In partnership with our campaign consultants, we have created a comprehensive fundraising plan to reach our fundraising goal that includes support from our Board of Directors, Company Members, Foundations, Corporations, and Individuals. 

Overall, the funds we hope to raise on Kickstarter are only a portion of the total amount we need to build our new home. There’s always the possibility that something won’t work out the way we’ve planned, but we’ve put together an internal campaign steering committee who is working diligently to review our progress, evaluate benchmarks, and make adjustments as necessary. 

We are confident that we will reach our fundraising goal and have lots of community support for this move from both our old friends and our new friends in Glendale. Additionally, 100% of our company has donated to the Play On! campaign. We signed our lease on the new space in March 2015 and have already received approval from the City for our construction plans. So how’s that for stewed prunes?

ABOUT RUSSIAN FOLK ART DECK:
The original designs of the deck are all inspired by folk designs from Russian heritage and culture. Traditional folk art has always played an intrinsic part of domestic culture across Russia and represents traditions and practices of the citizens.
Russia has a very long, rich and visual cultural past, from its colorful folk costumes to its ornate religious symbols.

The Kremlin is the heart of the Russian political life and the center of it's culture and history. The name Kremlin means "fortress inside a city".
Mythological creatures, such as the Siren—a creature of Russian legend that has the face and chest of a woman and the wings and feathered tail of a bird.
The balalaika is a plucking string instrument that resembles a guitar, but has a triangular shape and only three strings (or two in some cases). Today the balalaika has disappeared from Russians’ everyday life almost completely. There aren’t many people left who can play it – not to mention, only professional musicians in Russian folk music ensembles.
Russian folk dance was and still is an important part of Russian culture. Costumes were beautifully designed with great detail. Typically, the clothing for the dances was based on specific events, such as holidays, and would vary between these events. The color red was incorporated in many of the costumes because it is associated with beauty in the Russian tradition.
"Garmoshka" (or garmon') is a Russian traditional folk button accordion.  Garmoshka is a free-reed wind instrument with bellows and two push-button keyboards. The left keyboard is intended for accompaniment: by pressing a button one makes bass or an entire chord sound. The right keyboard is for playing the melody. Once designed its construction has never been changed.
An "Ushanka" is a traditional, yet stylish, Russian winter hat with ear flaps, which is extremely warm to handle the frigid Russian winters. It has ear flaps, which can be folded up and tied at the top of the hat, or tied at the chin.
The Sun is the most ancient and important symbol of traditional folk art. Russian village people believed the Sun was the reason of life, and of the world as a whole. The very word "sun" (solace in Russian) is derived from Sanskrit word "su" ("to create", "to give birth").
Yes, vodka is the most well-known of Russian alcohol. 
Yes, most Russians prefer their traditional national vodka than other alcohol (like Mexicans like tequila and Germans love their schnapps). 
Yes, a lot of Russians do like vodka BUT not everyone. Many women and some men can’t stand vodka (including myself!) 
Yes, Russians drink vodka BUT not every day – just on occasion (birthday, holiday, wedding, etc.).
 The main motifs of Russian Folk Art are local wild flowers and berries.
Nature has always been a common theme in Russian Folk Art. In Russia people believe that different design elements serve as symbols to protect them from evil forces, to bring wealth, health and love.
Matryoshka or Russian Nesting Doll is one of the most recognizable symbols of Russian culture. It was invented by a Russian artist more than 100 years ago. These dolls are fit inside one another and they often tell a story about the country's history, culture and customs.
Jacks, Queens and Kings are inspired by Matryoshka or Russian Nesting Doll.

campaign.story:
World War 2 has become a memory, and global power is shifting as modernization changes the world. Nations scramble to upgrade their energy production to keep up with the rapid growth. The price of oil is going up, and nuclear energy is the wave of the future.
In Energy Empire, each player takes control of a nation vying for power in the second half of the 20th century. They build up their nation’s industry, commerce, and government by acquiring resources, building structures, and tapping new sources of energy.
The major threat in Energy Empire is not war, but uncertain global impacts that affect all nations. Your actions come with a cost. As nations become more industrious, they also increase the amount of pollution in the environment. Careful use of science can reduce the harmful effects of industry, and help avert a global crisis. 
Manhattan Project: Energy Empire is a stand alone game in our "Manhattan Project" line of games. It shares many of the same mechanics from the original top 150 award winning game, but with less "take that" actions. Designed by established game designers Luke Lurie and Tom Jolly.
1 MAIN GAME BOARD:
5 PLAYER BOARDS:
The MSRP for this game will be $64.99 and it will be released worldwide a month after backers are shipped. We are giving you a $6 discount plus a $13 shipping discount in this campaign. That's roughly a 30% discount overall!
Energy Empire uses worker placement, tableau-building, and resource management game mechanics. On each turn, a player can choose to either WORK or GENERATE. On a work turn, a player places a single worker on the main board, then uses workers and energy to activate cards in their tableau. Players may spend energy to use an occupied space on the main board, so no main board spaces are ever completely blocked. On a Generate turn, players get to renew their supply of energy by rolling “energy dice” that represent nuclear, coal, oil, solar, and other forms of energy.

campaign.story:
Times are tough...
Lately it’s all about the protein and fiber, less about the sugar and carbs. But a baker’s got to survive…one way or another, even if that means taking part in an underground donut fighting circuit. 
Your frying skills will be tested and your fryer will be worked to the max. Will your donuts rise to the challenge or get tossed out with the day-olds that failed to sell? Only time will tell. All I know is...it’s a bad day for donuts.
Each player in the game is a baker.  To win the game, you must gain a baker's dozen (13) points.  Each donut in the game has a point value.  When a donut is eliminated from the game in battle, the baker who eliminated the donut gains its points.
During a player's turn, you draw two (2) donut cards and select one to fry up.  The fried donut is then sent out onto the game board to fight other donuts to the death.  After you've fried the donut, you get a certain number of movements (based off of a dice roll) to maneuver your army of donuts around the game board to setup fights and protect your weaker donuts.
PAX South 2016 demo game
Once all your movements have been made, all donut fights are executed.  After a fight, the losing donut (if it survived) must evacuate the space.  Board positioning and strategy come into play here.  Certain situations can prevent a donut from successfully evacuating after a fight, and they will be forced to fight again!  Today's Special cards can alter the balance in your favor and give you a competitive edge when used at the right time

We plan on enlisting Boda Board Game to manufacture A Bad Day for Donuts. They’ve been in the business for over 13 years and come highly recommended. Their portfolio is endless and includes hit titles like Ticket to Ride, Champions of Midgard, and many others.  
We did our research to verify the quality of their products.  We polled both gaming companies that have used them in the past and gamers that own product manufactured in their factory, and everyone responded back with all positive remarks.  
They've been very responsive to every question we've asked, and have done so quickly at that.  I have the greatest confidence that they will produce an excellent product for us and do so in a timely manner.
Funny board games and card games have always been a big part of my life.  I've been playing them with my friends for years and it was only natural that I start developing them as well.  
Around 8 years ago, I started initial development of two games just as something to do in my spare time.  After a year of playing around with them on index cards, they were shelved.  It wasn't until back in 2013 when I discovered Kickstarter that the idea of actually publishing a game became a reality.  
The first game to come down off the shelf was Monkeys Need Love Too.  After months of solid work on the mechanics and getting the illustrations created, we felt we had something worthy, so in 2014 Topwise Games, LLC was formed and we were off.  Monkeys launched on Kickstarter in September 2014 and successfully funded on October 2nd.
While working on the manufacturing of Monkeys at the end of 2014, A Bad Day for Donuts came down off the shelf and was thrust into development.  Game development was slow and steady during most of 2015.  The day job and family time took priority at certain points of the year, but over the course of 2015 the game was further developed, modified (heavily), modified again, and again, illustrations ordered, more modifications, until finally everything snapped together into what we have today.
Just as in Monkeys, with A Bad Day for Donuts, one of the goals was to have the illustrations bring out the humor of the cards and game board.  I employed Rick Menard once more, and once more he did not disappoint.
So once again our promise to you is that the game is fully ready for manufacturing as soon as the Kickstarter funds.  We will still be play-testing the heck out of the game while the Kickstarter runs to make sure we didn't miss any typos, errors, or faults in the game mechanics or flow, but just as with Monkeys, when Kickstarter releases the funds, the manufacturer will immediately be given the green light to start the process.
None of that however will happen without your help.  The donuts...are waiting.
-Will Stateczny, founder and game developer of Topwise Games, LLC

campaign.story:
CLASH of the CARDS is a high-speed, strategic battle card game in which you battle your opponents to steal cards and win hands. To win each hand of this rummy-style game, you collect armies (sets of 4). The first player to collect 2 armies wins the hand, and all players count points. Keep playing hands until someone reaches 1,000 points.
Each card in the game can be harnessed during battle. Use special cards to defend your armies, walk away from battle, slow down your opponents, or join battles you were not invited to in order to increase your chance at winning cards. This game allows you to set traps for other players and develop attack and defense strategies from your first turn. 
The game has been Approved by the Board Game Designers Guild of Utah [BGDG]! We have the stamp of approval from the BGDG, which assures potential publishers that this is a quality game and worth their time. 
Cheap Shipping! We are subsidizing the shipping for all of you so shipping is extremely affordable or even FREE depending on where you live. 
USA: FREE. 
Rest of the World: $8.00 USD/copy of the game.
Free upgrades! We decided to unlock what would have been the 5th and 6th player expansion and have provided those cards as part of the base game! We have also chosen to provide you with the better card stock (310 GSM) and a nifty two piece box from the start. As you can see We decided to give you the WHOLE game and the BEST game we have made! See more details under the “Stretch Goal” section below. 
We have extensively play tested this game with gamers at the Salt Lake City GamingCon, Salt Lake City ComicCon and with the BGDG. The game is balanced and the rules are clear. You’ll start having fun from the first time you play.  
We need your help to make this game a reality. 
             Just Click the picture to download the (Letter Size) PNP, If you would like the A4 size click (HERE).  Download the rules (HERE).
Watch Nick Meenachan from Board Game Brawl give a more detailed explanation of the game mechanics, the cards, and his final thoughts about Clash of the Cards, including who might like the game! 
 As you already know, we gave away several material upgrades as well as the deluxe expansion as part of our funding goal. We are excited to now introduce some great new stretch goals!
Playing CLASH of the CARDS is easy. The important thing to keep in mind is that higher cards beat lower cards in battles, BUT lower cards are worth more points at the end of the game.
Shuffle the cards and deal 8 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards in the center creating a draw pile.The Player left of the dealer starts and play continues clockwise.
Watch Geeks for Games play a live hand of the game. See below for their final thoughts.

We will be sending out a survey to these creative backers where you can tell us the top two or three characters you'd like to nickname, along with the nickname and some flavor text. Also, we reserve the right to approve the name of the card. Basically be cool, nothing rude or inappropriate or brand names will be allowed as the name or flavor text for one of the characters in the game. 
If you're the kind of person that likes to play games with family and friends and you enjoy a battle with Wizards, Vikings, Archers, Villagers, Thieves, Spies and Dragons, then please back our Kickstarter, and help us make this game a reality. In return we'll send you our game.

Risks and challenges
Clash of the Cards is pretty much ready to print. We plan to send the final files to the printer within a week or two of the campaign close. 

We realize that this is our first KS campaign and as such have done significant research and worked with many previous game publishers to get feedback and gain knowledge about the process. We have also been fortunate to work with the Board Game Designers Guild of Utah to understand the common pitfalls and challenges that await a KS campaign. As such the only real uncertainty we see for the project are the timings for manufacturing and shipping. (ie. external dependencies) As backers we've seen things slip on many a Kickstarter project in this department! So, we're basing our schedule on what others have actually managed to deliver, rather than what they've promised – and have added a little safety factor. We believe we can deliver Clash of the Cards to you by (and perhaps even before) August 2016, and with a quality we can all be very pleased with.

We are very appreciative of all the people who have helped us understand and gain the knowledge needed to ship this game in a quality that we can all be happy with.
