campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Age of Conan - Adventures in Hyboria is our fourth Kickstarter project. We already delivered two Kickstarters successfully - Sails of Glory and Galaxy Defenders - with a very positive feedback from our backers. The production of the rewards of the third Kickstarter (Galaxy Defenders - The Earth Strikes Back) is in progress, with a confirmed delivery schedule at the moment.

Creating a high-quality strategy boardgame is not an easy task. However, Ares Games has an excellent track record of publishing games with high-end components, such as our War of the Ring game and our Wings of Glory miniature line.

Our staff has strong experience in producing games with ready-to-play miniatures and a wide range of different components. We don't envision any specific challenge associated to the production of this project.

The products offered in this Kickstarter already have fully developed gameplay.

The main risk at this stage is the project might be delayed, during the remaining stages of the production pipeline, with respect to its scheduled release date. We prefer a reasonable delay to compromising on the level of quality we are looking for in our games in general, and in this product specifically,

There are also risks of delays, as with any game manufactured in Asia, related to transport and delivery to our warehouse in the United States. These are also routinely handled by our logistic staff, but unexpected delays due to customs clearance, strikes, and exceptional weather are always possible, and may influence the time necessary to deliver the games to our backers.

 The active player draws two objects from the deck, reveals one object, and keeps the other one hidden. That player provides hints to help the other players guess the name of the hidden object. The trick is that all the hints must be true about both of the objects.
For example: If you had an apple card and a skyscraper card, you might reveal the skyscraper and and say "Both objects are associated with New York," "These are both bigger than a strawberry," etc. When someone shouts out APPLE! They get one card and you keep the other. The first player to get to 7 cards wins.
Each card is a one word, physical object. This helps because people always have physical characteristics to work with - you can always compare size. The active players has 2 minutes to get another player to guess the hidden object (although new players get to wave this time limit).
Can you compare an ocean and a computer? How many hints can you give if you have a book and a bed? 
We redesigned the card frames, so these will be the ones in the final product. The old card frames can be seen in the review video below!
Are you good at guessing? Here are some hints to let you play a round. If you figure it out, private message me and once someone gets it, I will post the answer for everyone in an update and post a new challenge:

Both these objects can float on water.
Both these objects are bigger than a clam.
Both these objects can sustain the Japanese population.

Both these objects are bigger than a grape.
Both these objects have an outer layer that is not pleasant to eat.
Challenge 2: I reveal a Truck.

These both are full of air. 
These both have have whole industries surrounding them! 
Solved in Update 3
Challenge 1: I reveal an elephant .

The base game will start with 112 unique object cards, but this number will grow as more stretch goals are unlocked.
After playing Missing Link's free-for-all mode for a while, people might crave new and different objects. The team mode delivers this perfectly. In the team mode, players break into 2 teams and pull 3 cards. They choose one of those three cards and use the adjective on the bottom of that card to craft their own objects. Each object must be a one word physical object that can be described by the adjective on your team's chosen card. Once the objects have been made, teams take turns having an active player. The active player picks one object from each team's pile of objects at random, reveals the object made by their team, keeps the other team's object hidden, and then gives hints to help their team guess the hidden object (the object made by the other team). If the active player's team guesses correctly in 2 minutes, their team gets a point.Once each player on both teams have been the active player, the team with the most points wins.

Don't Panic!  You can Pre-Order your copy of The Great Debate from our website. 
http://www.castleproductions.co/store.html
Ages: 13+   Number of players: 3-10  Time: ~4 minutes per player
We are a Dallas Designer Group endorsed product.
The Great Debate is a card game designed to get people debating quickly over dozens of interesting subjects in a light and casual manner. It plays best from 5-10 players and each round takes mere minutes to play (but you’ll likely find yourself playing it all evening).
We all debate with our friends, family and co-workers over numerous topics every day, and even play Devil’s Advocate once in a while. We debate issues from the trivial, such as “Is bacon the ultimate ingredient?” to the profound, such as “Does charity breed poverty?” This is why we created The Great Debate. It’s a party game that not only provides a highly interactive way for people to voice their opinions about these subjects in a safe and playful environment, but also uses our unique “Icebreaker” system to help you learn more about the people you’re playing with. Who knows, the person you just met might become your new hiking buddy, skydiving mentor, or scrap booking partner! 
The Great Debate is not just fun, but also educational and enlightening. Since it covers a wide array of topics, people often learn about topics they might not know about. They may hear, or even pose, a different opinion that gives them cause to reflect or laugh. Even those who are initially shy about speaking in groups can quickly overcome their fears since they’re only given 30 seconds to talk on a subject – and they don’t even have to believe what they say. The point is not to be right, but to be more convincing than your opponent and to have fun while doing it. The time limit teaches people how to hone their debate skills by thinking on their feet, and delivering their points in a short, concise fashion. Play our game, and you’ll soon find yourself having an engaging, thought provoking, laughing great time with your friends and family.
Here is a limited print and play version prototype to give you idea of the questions in the game.
80 Unique Debate Cards – hand selected and play tested for fun!

EXPOSURE - VOLUME 2
Format:  Graphic Novel (Hardcover and Softcover)
Pages:  192 full color pages + Covers
Writers:  David Campiti & Bill Yu
Artist:  Jinky Coronado (w/Larry Tuazon, Katrina MaeHao, Santosh Rath)
Cover art by Jinky Coronado and Socrates Gukor
The follow-up to Al Rio and David Campiti’s incredible original Kickstartered collection of EXPOSURE is here with Exposure – Volume 2:  Blind Faith!  
EXPOSURE -- Volume 2: Blind Faith is created and co-written by veteran comics writer David Campiti, best known as writer over the years of Lost in Space, Dark Shadows, Beauty and the Beast, and Hero Alliance -- and, more recently, author of STAN LEE'S HOW TO DRAW COMICS and co-author of the text features in THE MARVEL ART OF MIKE DEODATO, JR.  He is joined by Canadian writer Bill Yu in his first comicbook series.  The playful, sexy art is by Jinky Coronado, the FHM lingerie model-turned-writer/artist best known in the comics biz as creator/writer/artist/cover model of BANZAI GIRL and artist of Meg Cabot's best-selling AVALON HIGH graphic novels.  She is joined by her frequent collaborators from the Philippines, Larry Tuazon and Katrina Mae Hao.  (More about them later.  Let's talk about the book!)
This volume follows the continuing adventures of team ParaTech, led by a detective and a doctor with both beauty and brains, Shawna Diaz and Lisa Shannon, assisted by tech guru Alan Wong, and backed up by a guy who can handle any situation, Graham Burroughs!  “Adventures” is an understatement as the team once again encounters life, death, and life after death!  
Discovering an ancient cross in a vampire’s lair sends the team on a reality-bending trip into their past and hurtles them back to the future with a vengeance!  
From Chapter 1's "Altered Lives"
From Chapter 2's "Night of the LIving Dad!"
Creepy splash page scene from Chapter 2!
Back in the present, the team is exposed to a murderous zombie cult and then has to deal with the aftermath of an all-out assault on their bodies, minds, and souls; one that could rip the team apart!  
From Chapter 3's "Double Cross"
From Chapter 4's "Disciples of the Dead"
Follow that up with a visit to a mysterious house that seems bent on killing anyone who enters, and you have a mind-opening thrill ride with all of the intrigue, suspense, humour and sex-appeal that are the hallmarks of EXPOSURE!
From Chapter 5's "Blind Faith"
From Chapter 6's "Dread & Breakfast!"

As mentioned above, EXPOSURE is the brainchild of writer David Campiti and the late, great artist Al Rio (known for his incredibly detailed and gorgeous covers, interior art, and pin-ups for companies such as Image, Marvel and Zenescope, from GEN13 to Spider-Man).  
Now:  In Volume Two, David continues the legacy he started with Al Rio as the torch is passed to FHM lingerie model-turned-comics-creator/ writer/artist Jinky Coronado (of BANZAI GIRL fame) and the industry’s newest rising star writer, Bill Yu! Check this out --
Bill Yu makes a guest appearance, along with certain contributors from the previous Kickstarter!
Conceived in 1997, EXPOSURE originally appeared from Image Comics in 1999 before appearing, most recently, at exposure.keenspot.com where new stories continue right now. This nearly-200-page full-color graphic novel will be coming this winter as both a regular edition hardcover, a limited edition autographed hardcover and a softcover -- and it’s jam-packed with gorgeous interiors, pin-ups, and cover galleries including every nearly new EXPOSURE piece created by Jinky Coronado for this amazing collection!
That's the hard-sell.  (Hope it wasn't too hard.  We LOVE this book!)  So what now?
Over at the top right corner of this page is the GOAL. If that goal is reached, printing will commence immediately because this book is already completed and at the printer, awaiting $$ to get printed and shipped.  However, if the goal is not reached before the end of the 30 days, you will not be charged anything. You only pay if the EXPOSURE – Volume 2 graphic novel project reaches its goal by the deadline!  Printing will be done in Asia, as most graphic novels are done these days, to cut down on printing costs but maintain premium quality. 
We've set the goal pretty low here -- and it only covers the trade paperback.  We actually need to reach about double our goal to cover completely the trade and the hardcover (not to mention all the costs associated with running and fulfilling this campaign).  We can easily reach -- and surpass! -- our real goal if you go for the big incentives.
The incentives are absolutely amazing and there’s something for everyone at every donation level -- regular books, autographed books, signed and numbered books, hard-to-find original editions, bonus packs with Exposure -- Volume One included, original art, custom sketches, full-fledged finished cover-quality custom original pieces drawn specifically for you, and even once-in-a-lifetime travel experiences!
Original art incentives available will include choices from nearly every page from this graphic novel (available on a first-come, first-served basis), as well as special pinup pieces created for the book, such as --
  Jinky's self-portrait, based on the Norman Rockwell painting
What's more, the custom commissions being offered could be very much along those lines with Jinky's EXPOSURE or BANZAI GIRL characters, or even Marvel/DC/other popular/new characters, such as these -- 
Jinky drew this commission for Rocky Mountain Con's program book!
Jinky's commission of Lois Lane!
Jinky drew some of the characters from the TV series CHUCK!
This was a BANZAI GIRL commission!
Jinky Coronado draws a commission of Superman and Supergirl!
JInky's Wonder Woman and Batman!
She's up to the task, don'tcha think?
So please, let's make this happen in a big way.
UPDATE!! We've added some new rewards featuring rare EXPOSURE character watches, mouse pads, and hard-to-find signed comics!
And what's the big, real stretch goal?  With enough money ($30,000 or more), we can afford to create new EXPOSURE adventures for a Volume 3!
Please spread the word. Let's try to get to the $30,000.00 level!
STRETCH BONUS! If we reach the $30,000.00 level that allows us to continue new EXPOSURE adventures, I'll send free .pdfs of the new story to everyone who contributes! PLUS, we'll create a signed BONUS print by Jinky Coronado that we will ship to everyone who ordered a mailable Level. What's more, we'll create a special secret spy THANK YOU page that will list all our Kickstarter people for getting us there -- AND the 13 highest-level contributors will make a cameo appearance in the next EXPOSURE adventure! Let's make the adventures continue!

This Comic Is Finished, Proofed & Ready To Be Printed With Your Help!
CatMan Evolution #1 is…
A very modern and original take on bringing the classic superhero into today’s world. CatMan Evolution introduces us to Darren Merrywether, the grandson of the original 1950’s character from Holyoke Comics. That has fallen into public domain. Darren is the heir to both the Merrywether Foundation, and the legacy of being CatMan.
A cutting edge comic, focused on mainstream quality crime/action stories, with independent creativity, freedom and originality. This character is trying to find his own path, while living in the shadow of his grandfather’s, as well as dealing with the internal clash between his human morality and his feral spirit’s thirst for blood.
The first in a new line of unique creations that are contained in the amazing FireStorm Comics Universe. Acclaimed Paranormal Romance Novelist Veronica Massey, came to my attention when I needed someone to co-plot and script the title with. She has a life-long love for comics and wanted to jump in with a crime/action titles. She writes action comics as well as any other professional scribe currently in the comics industry. Veronica and I have put together a solid storyline and developed CatMan to hold up against anything on the shelves to date.
Here’s what we've got…
 This comic book is completely ready to go to print. We are so set on our mission to make this book make the long haul; we are currently in the end phases of issue # 2 and beginning production on issue # 3.
See, we are creating comics that we want to read, that fill that void for something new, original and exciting. Our mission is to create comics with mainstream quality and indie freedom and creativity, as well as help promote community over competition in the industry. It should be our focus to create and produce amazing comics that we can not only be fans of but, support ourselves and our industry with.
This is the first comic book represents that mission for us.

Did you miss the campaign?
Don't worry! You can pre-order Knee Jerk at knapsackgames.com. We will ship pre-orders after we ship all rewards to our awesome Kickstarter backers. 
 "Fast-paced, exhilarating, and so much fun!" -Strawburry17.com
"I think you have a hit on your hands here." -Board Game Corner
"Stupidly simple but hilarious." -Bower's Game Corner
Knee Jerk is a 10-minute party game for 4 to 8 players.
In Knee Jerk, you'll hear the start of a situation that you have to shout an ending to as fast as possible. For example: "I Feel Panicked At The Beach Because I Saw ______!" You can shout anything, like, "A shark!", "A smoke monster!" or even "My grandmother in a bikini!".
The fastest player to shout a valid answer wins the point, but you have to outwit your friends - if two or more players answer, the host player picks his or her favorite. The games moves rapidly, switching from scene to scene in seconds - from Your First Date to A Haunted Mansion to Outer Space!
The first player to gain 3 points is the winner. Learning and playing the game are quick - just like your knee-jerk reaction!
Want to try playing with the cards? Try out the Knee Jerk Randomizer!
Fast, Simple Gameplay: Because the fastest player to answer wins the point, the game zooms by. Each situation lasts ~10 seconds, and if you didn't win the last one, there's another one coming in just a moment's time. The game is also quick to set up and learn, with just a half-sheet of instructions.
No Downtime: In Knee Jerk, everyone plays at the same time. Only the host handles the cards, so there's no clean up between rounds.
Over 150,000+ Combinations: With Knee Jerk's innovative "arrow-locking" card design, any three cards can be combined. This means you could play the game over 10,000 times and never see the same situation twice!
Open-Ended Answers: Any ending is possible in Knee Jerk - it's all up to your imagination. You could mention your badass grandma, that dinosaur you rode, or the fake superpower no one knows you have. The endings are limitless because you're not trapped within the confines of "answer" cards. Feel free to be as creative, dirty or family-friendly as you like.
Portable: Knee Jerk is one deck of 55 cards, so you can easily slip it in your pocket or purse. And you don't have to sit around a table to play! You can play on the couch, in the car, at the airport - anywhere you can find space for 3 cards.
Click here for a PDF of the rules (4 MB) and here for a Print 'n Play of the game (47 MB).

See the update here for why theme and blank packs are available only to backers in the US and Canada. In lieu of this, we will send out a free digital print 'n play version of all cards to all backers.
Note: The "new ways to play" above don't add additional components to the game - they use the same 55-card deck. These new gameplay modes will require our time to develop the gameplay and rules so they're just right.

Risks and challenges
Our risks lie in manufacturing and shipping. To mitigate these, we are working with a reputable manufacturer (PrintNinja) and using a minimal amount of game components. Using simple components also reinforces the reliability of our domestic self-fulfillment. Our international fulfillment will be handled by a reputable fulfillment company.

Unforeseen circumstances are uncommon but always a possibility, such as manufacturer scheduling changes, shipping delays due to weather, and so on. Should any issues arise, we will address them swiftly and carefully. We will maintain open communication with our backers to assure that everyone is on the same page.

We are being mentored by established game publishers including Matthew Austin (Chaosmos), Peter Vaughan (What the Food?!), and David Chott (Lagoon). In addition, we have experience on many major, schedule-driven projects. We know the importance of shipping high quality projects on time, as well as communicating honestly and openly with our community (i.e. you!).

campaign.story:
Roaches will include a rule book, 72 colored roach cards, 6 everyday danger cards, 6 room cards, 1 white GM die and 6 different colored dice that correspond with the colors of the roaches. The color coordination helps young players to keep track of game play and turns while it helps older players when their dice roll off the table.
What Makes Roaches Unique?
Roaches is a unique gaming experience because it involves several gaming skills:
Game master - will roll their die to determine what room the players roaches are in, as well as to determine what everyday danger the roaches must face. The game master will then lead the players through a little role playing where they must try to defeat the every day danger in order to move on. Players - evade the everyday danger, and then they will have to battle one another for control of the house. The players will roll their die when battling one another for the rooms of the house they are trying to invade. Cards - players get to use their roach cards to keep track of which of their roaches survived to battle on and which roaches have met an early demise. The backs of the cards show the roaches in a deceased pose so players get to flip the card over when the roach dies to show that it is no longer in play. Dice - players will roll their dice when evading everyday dangers and when battling one another.
The prototype of the cards with the original artwork
Learning: Roaches provides young players with the opportunity to practice recognizing which numbers are greater than other numbers, it provides them with the opportunity to work with others, as well as providing them the opportunity to make choices about their own game play and how those choices affect the outcome of the game. As players become more accustomed to game play there are portions of the rulebook that encourage them to add an aspect of role playing to the game, so the game provides a stepping stone for our future gamers. When they grow past this phase then they will use the roaches skills to enhance their game play and finally once they have all of this down they will go to the advanced rules where they can work cooperatively and where they will use new skills and even have hit points. This game also helps introduce new gamers to role playing which can seem intimidating when there is a character sheet, multiple skills and stats. This game introduces players to the aspects of role play while giving them character types that they are familiar with.
The boys are enjoying battling and seeing who the winner is
Playability: Roaches is not simply a game for young players though. We have had great success with families who have played the game and even groups of adult friends who have played the game. Roaches provides a fun dynamic where players can battle one another and use their role playing skills to taunt and tease as they race for total domination of the house. There are several levels of play that allow for playability for many different types of gamers.
Fun for groups of friends
What We've Done
We has been publicly play testing Roaches for several years now. We've have great success with children ranging in age from five – fourteen at numerous gaming and comic conventions in and around the San Antonio area. We have also had great success with the parents of the children who played, with families, and with groups of friends. We have even had a teacher using the game in her fifth grade classroom to assist them with critical thinking skills. Roaches is a great way for players to come together no matter what their level of expertise is and play a fun game with friends or family where skills can be learned and used to increase their level of game expertise or simply to have fun playing a game about roaches. We have tested it, now we simply need to give everyone out there a chance to play it. We have also been working with a comic book artist to update the artwork to a newer more polished style.
New Art
Roaches T-Shirt
Why We Need Help
With your help, we'll be able to print a fun box, a professional set of cards, a rules booklet and dice and we can pay for the new art; then we can begin to ship them to the stores who've asked for them, and hopefully to the ones who haven’t asked for them as well.
We need $8000 to get going, but for every few dollars over $8000, that's another set of games that we can print and another gaming shelf we can stock.
Thank you all for your support.

Thank you to each and every backer for supporting this project and making Lanterns: The Harvest Festival a reality! If you discover this project after it has ended, you can get more information and order the game at the Foxtrot Games website:
- http://lanternsgame.com/
The harvest is in, and now it's time to celebrate! Lanterns: The Harvest Festival is a tile-placement game set in imperial China. Players act as artisans decorating the palace lake with floating lanterns. The artisan who earns the most honor before the festival arrives wins the game.
On your turn, you can take these three actions one time each:
Place a lake tile, which gives every player (even your opponents!) a lantern card based on the orientation of the tile. (It also could give the active player bonus lantern cards or favor tokens, depending on the placement.)
Spend favor tokens to trade one lantern card for another.
Dedicate sets of lantern cards to gain the honor you need to win the game.
For more details, you can download and read a draft version of the full rulebook. (Translation: French.)
If you want to play Lanterns to see if it's a good fit for you, you can use our print-and-play (PnP) files to make a prototype. It requires only 4 sheets of card stock if you have Ticket to Ride, 8 sheets if you do not.

It's been seven months now since we launched the Kickstarter campaign for Lanterns: The Harvest Festival. Thank you so much for joining us on this journey. We are so proud of the product you helped us create, and we could not have accomplished any of this without your pledges, your support, and your enthusiasm.
Now that rewards have been delivered, this will be our final official update here about this Kickstarter project. (We'll still be monitoring comments, private messages, and emails, of course!) Here's what we cover in this update:
Lantern Dedication
Mensa Select Award

SHIPPING UPDATE
We hope you had a great weekend that included playing some good games. We are happy to announce that the last of the rewards were mailed over the weekend. We've seen reports (on Kickstarter and elsewhere around the web) that many of them have already arrived.
If you have not yet received your reward, it should be arriving soon. The exact timeline depends on your location:

As you might know, tomorrow (Saturday, April 11) is International Tabletop Day. We hope you get a chance to play some great games! If you do, let us know what you played (or plan to play) this weekend in the comments.

Shipping Update
We hope you are having a wonderful March! It's been a month since the last update, and Lanterns: The Harvest Festival continues to move forward. The port labor dispute we mentioned last time has been resolved, but the backlog has delayed us by a couple weeks. The games set sail as planned last month, and they are currently working their way to us. We currently expect them to get through customs and land in our warehouse around the beginning of April.

We hope you are having a wonderful winter. Chinese New Year celebrations have begun in China, and we want to wish you a joyous and prosperous new year. To celebrate, we have some great news on production, some details about shipping logistics, and the story behind the Chinese character on the favor tokens.

We hope you had a wonderful new year, filled with lots of gaming. We have been hard at work finishing all the files for Lanterns: The Harvest Festival, and everything has now been submitted to the manufacturer. We have more details about that in our production update below, and we also wanted to share with you a few pieces of news.
VOTING ON BOARDGAMEGEEK

We hope you are having a joyous holiday season! We have been hard at work getting the files for Lanterns: The Harvest Festival ready for production, and we wanted to keep you updated on our progress. We also wanted to share with you a bit of Lanterns news from the BoardGameGeek community and ask for your support over on that site.
VOTING ON BOARDGAMEGEEK

Yesterday, we celebrated Thanksgiving here in the United States. Tyler and I (Randy) are together visiting our family: eating turkey, watching movies, frosting sugar cookies, and playing lots of games. In the few weeks since the campaign ended, we have been continually thankful for you making this campaign such a success. What a strong finish to an amazing campaign. $33,523 and 1,213 backers! Wow! I really don't know what to say. This campaign has exceeded my expectations, and it has been so rewarding to receive such a great response for this project that we have invested so much of ourselves into.
I am so grateful to each and every one of you for backing this project and supporting the campaign. Whether you backed the campaign in the first few minutes or in the last few minutes or anywhere in between, Lanterns: The Harvest Festival is becoming a reality because of you. Thank you!

THE GAME
Click here to download the rulebook!
I created Elf Dance because I love card games. Just the simple act of sitting down with a trusted friend, opening and shuffling a deck of cards, and getting lost in the game is usually my favorite part of any day. As a child I grew up yearning to be old enough to sit at the card table with the adults. When I finally was old enough I learned to  play games like Spades, and Bridge (though you need to be at least 50 to really master Bridge). Later on, I learned to love playing more card games such as Casino, shit head, and Kanasta. So a few years ago, having already created a half dozen board games of all sorts and varieties, I realized that I had not yet made a game that reflected my roots. So Elf Dance is an homage to my favorite qualities in playing card games, but with a lot of new ideas too; trump suits that change throughout the game, a cooperative and competitive edge all at once with the game playing against the players, and, enchantments that give players new randomized special abilities. Plus who doesn't love the world of the fae folk?
HOW TO PLAY VIDEO
PLAY

THE STORY
THE DANCE IS HELD IN THE DUSK OF A SWEET SUMMER'S DAY;
IT IS AS OLD AS FLOWERS OR MEMORIES OR DREAMS.
IT'S HELD ON A HILL, UNDER TREES, IN A MUSHROOM RING,
IN A PLACE THAT SOME HAVE FORGOTTEN, BUT IS ALWAYS THERE.
THE FAERY DANCE, SO THEY SAY, NEVER ENDS: EVEN WHEN
YOU'RE AWAY IT GOES ON, AND AWAITS YOUR RETURN.
THE FIVE FAERY CLANS COMPETE TO IMPRESS THEIR KING
AND GLADDEN HIS HEART (AND BRING GOBLINS T HEEL),
AND YOU MAY DANCE TOO-
AND TAME THE GOBLINS-
TILL DUSK FADES TO NIGHT.
        -Poem by Thomas P Moore.

Dusk is the twisting story of one woman's journey through a supernatural world that doesn't want her. This Kickstarter will fund the completion of the 3rd exciting volume of the Dusk series (post-production and formatting costs).
The Series Plot: 
As a battered wife, Eve’s only concern was keeping her marriage together. But when she is kidnapped into the sordid supernatural world of vampires and foul magic, Eve finds she doesn’t want to leave. Her mysterious benefactor, the Vampire Lord Ash, wishes her to have a normal life, but Eve chooses to stay in his service. Dusk is the story of Eve's challenges living in the darkness, a supernatural action-drama told through a dynamic blend of the sequential art styles of American comics and Japanese manga. Several artists help tell these stark noir tales of vampires and unrequited love. 
About Dusk Volume 3: Ashes: 
Eve: beautifully flawed and horribly broken. You have all read her misadventures as she has struggled to find her place in the dark world of Dusk. But now in Volume 3, we take some quick glances at her reluctant benefactor, the vampire Lord Ash. See how Ash’s tragic origin is wielded against him like a poisoned dagger. Enjoy a story of betrayal and loss as Eve and Ash meet for the first time. Through Eve’s distorted perspective, watch as her Ash comes alive just for her. Of course, spread out amongst the pages are other tales of the supernatural that Eve battles through, like Dusk’s unique take on werewolves.
Won’t you join us and enjoy the trials that await Eve and the others?
From the safety of your chair, join in the macabre horror that is Dusk. 
About the Publisher: 
Dusk Comics is an independent publisher of comics that works with a myriad of different styles, themes, and genres in order to bring our readers the best in graphic entertainment. Our flagship series, Dusk, is a prime example of our philosophy in action. Dusk is a paranormal mystery tale told through separate stories done by a variety of artists, whose unique artistic takes service different moods and themes in each vignette. This gives the reader "snapshots" into the world of Dusk and its characters’ lives from different angles and perspectives to provide a more full view of the overall drama and action. 
What We Need: 
As a comic so defined by collaboration, we want to provide current and new fans the opportunity to be a part of the next stage of Dusk and Dusk Comics. We need your help to pay the creators who will put the finishing touches on the pages of Dusk Volume 3 (which include lettering and preparing each page for print) directly as well as to print the volumes once they are complete. This is a great chance to support a creative and independent endeavor to provide readers of all types with stories that will not only entertain but also engage on several levels. 
We would love to say that we are trying to start a revolution, trying to change the way the industry works, make comics work in new ways, but that’s ultimately not what we are about. We are about the story first, middle, and last. If our stories grow up and do amazing things with their lives we would be very proud parents. But we are happy with whatever our stories become, as long as they're true to their core and that core is something you as a reader find interesting.

We are pleased to announce that TABLE is back! Join us April 17-19, 2015 at the Grapevine Convention Center to learn and play an amazing selection of tabletop games, meet and greet guests, and shop with local vendors from Dallas/Fort Worth and the Southwest area.  
Please back this campaign to guarantee your attendance. Tickets are limited!
TABLE stands for Tabletop And Board Game Learning Expo. The event celebrates tabletop gaming and the amazing people that play tabletop games. Our goal is to introduce our favorite hobby to the Dallas/Fort Worth community by hosting an event where folks are welcome to try new games, meet the people who design them, and learn about the hobby from its biggest fans. 
We’re so excited to improve TABLE that we've invited Collected: Your Pop Culture Headquarters as a partner this year. You’ll have access to comics and collectibles from Collected, and an even bigger selection of local game companies and vendors. Just like last year, Roll2Play is bringing the game library so you'll have a huge selection of games to learn and play!
Roll2Play
Collected: Your Pop Culture Headquarters

Sandy Petersen

Clint Cearly
Clint is a local artist who has contributed beautiful art for Magic: The Gathering cards, Dungeons & Dragons, and other fantasy games. Clint will be at TABLE 2 to deliver workshops on drawing and meet fans! 

Watch closely as we'll update the guest list during the campaign. We've got some big reveals coming as the campaign progresses!

Watch It Played is a YouTube series that teaches you how to play tabletop games. campaign.story:
The night started out as a cooperative mission to save some monkeys from the horrible tests and trials they are put through just so people in the world can smell a little better, but it all takes a turn for the worse when you arrive at the local perfume test facility.  While silently navigating through the lab to get back to the cages, someone “accidentally” knocks over a beaker of cologne entitled Compete.  Due to a current side effect, everyone on your team is now under the impression that it's a competition and whomever frees the most monkeys wins.
 In Monkeys Need Love Too, you and your friends battle it out inside the local lab to see who can free the most monkeys. These poor monkeys have been subjected to multiple perfumes and colognes, so some of the side effects they've picked up can either help or hurt you during the game.
During your turn, you draw to populate your hand, storing much needed bananas off to the side so you can feed your monkeys later. Each turn you are able to lay down one monkey card and play one action card. The action cards are primarily used to slow down your opponents as they try to free monkeys for themselves. 
After the dust has settled, you are tasked with feeding your monkeys. If you don't have enough bananas stocked up to complete the feeding, the monkeys you can't feed are discarded. You then end your turn by discarding any cards you don't wish to hang on to, usually to help you next turn during your draw if you are running low on bananas.
At some point during the game, someone will acquire a specific action card that triggers the alarm in the lab. Of course, they will only use this card if they believe they have enough monkeys to win the game. If the player succeeds in tripping the alarm, the second and final phase of the game kicks in. But hope is not lost for everyone else. All players now draw one card from a secondary deck to determine their end fate. 
You may escape. You may even find a couple extra monkeys on the way out. You could possibly end up losing some of your monkeys as you exit, or even worse, get caught by security and end up in jail. Finally, you could draw the card that resets the alarm so you can continue freeing monkeys. In the end, the player who escapes with the most monkeys is the winner of the game.
Click here to see the complete rule book and to try the PnP
 Back It! Interview with JR Honeycutt and Doug Levandowski
 Board Game Duel (Click here for full review)
Monkeys Need Love Too harkens to the gamer who loves theme, flavor text, and humor; is a party game through and through.  Its high randomness, heavy flavor text, and goofy theme will attract gamers who love light party games. .  We had some major “lol” moments.
- Tessa Van Boxtel, Board Game Reviewer, Board Game Duel
Gaming Bits (Click here for full review)
I really like the artwork and find that there is a lot of great humor and silliness in the design. The game is really easy to play. It’s definitely got a lot of humor with a take that feel to play. The light hearted humor and design of the cards will make you laugh. Fans of games like Munchkin and Fluxx will most likely enjoy this game.
- Jonathan Nelson, Board Game Reviewer, Gaming Bits
Tabletop Gaming News (Click here for full review)
Monkeys Need Love Too is one of those games that lives in your gaming backpack to be taken out when you want a quick, lighthearted game to kill some time at the LGS.  It falls into that classic “screw your neighbor” type of game where you can really kick someone when they’re down and so someone in the lead one turn may be racing to catch up the next (and occasionally you can get “banana screwed,” which is like being “mana screwed” in Magic, but… you know… with bananas, where you just can’t seem to find one to save your life… or the life of your monkeys, really). The game mechanics are really simple, so teaching it to anyone shouldn’t be a problem. The learning curve is small, so going from “I’ve never played this before” to “7th level Zen Master of Monkeys Need Love Too” is a pretty short trip (like, 2-3 turns at most). The art is cute and colorful, and there is a lot of unique artwork in the game.
- Jason "Polar_Bear" Koepp, Editor in Chief, Tabletop Gaming News
GeekedupGaming Review Group (Click here for full review)
Monkeys Need Love Too is an awesome and amazing game for 2-4 players ages 8 and up. Plays in about 15- 60 minutes. Unless its with me and Anna. We'll make it last at least an hour and a half. We had a great run with this title. We really didn't know what to expect. Considering we had not heard of it until the creator had contacted us. But we had a blast and were really happy that we’ve had the chance to play the game and experience saving monkeys. If you've backed this game on kickstarter you won't be dissapointed. Also this is a great game for children. I mean what child doesn't like monkeys. This is a really easy game to play and teach. Reason I know that is because I didn't pass the rules off to Anna. I will be sharing this game with friends and family of mine.
- Timothy Sexton, Board Game Reviewer, GeekedupGaming
 Noobsource (Click here for full review)  
If you're looking to play this with your kids during the family game night and you happen to enjoy games such as Killer Bunnies and Fluxx, then Monkeys Need Love Too is worth checking out.  
- Brandon Ramirez, Board Game Reviewer, Noobsource
Roll To Sit! (Click here for full review)  
The mechanics look crisp. The rules aren’t complicated. Really simple.  The art doesn’t take itself too seriously. And that’s a good thing. Because it shouldn’t take itself too seriously. There are cards where you THROW POO AT OTHER PLAYERS!  
IT. HAS. MONKEYS!!! All games need more monkeys. I yearn for the day when Ticket To Ride or Cosmic Encounter or Settlers of Catan comes out with an expansion with monkeys. Monkeys make everything awesome.
- Anthony Johnson, Poobah of Playtesting, Roll To Sit!

We will be offering a Monkeys Need Love Too t-shirt!! Add $15 to your pledge for each t-shirt you would like to receive.  See the design below.
We plan on enlisting Wingo Games to manufacture Monkeys Need Love Too.  They’ve been in the business for over 20 years and come highly recommended.  Their portfolio is endless and they’ve shown us great respect along with impressive dedication to both the details of the project and responding to our every need.
I have always loved humorous board/card games and have been playing them with my friends for years. Being a tinkerer at heart, I eventually decided to develop a game of my own. I love making people laugh and I wanted to create a game that would be fun to play and full of laughs. I founded Topwise Games and started working on bringing my ideas to life. 
Monkeys Need Love Too has come a long way from a homemade game printed on index cards to a fully realized game ready for your next game night. I spent countless nights ironing out the mechanics and play testing the game with friends and locals. When adding in the illustrations, my hope was to have them bring out the humor of the cards as well as add to the overall theme of the game. I hired Rick Menard who did an awesome job of really bringing the cards to life. I wanted the illustrations to immediately bring a smile to the player’s face, and I think he nailed it.
So now the game is ready to go and all I need is your help so I can get the first edition ordered. Those monkey aren’t going to free themselves!
-Will Stateczny
P.S. I hope that Monkeys Need Love Too is just the beginning for Topwise Games. I am working on several expansion ideas and we’re also already in the middle of play testing our first board game. I can’t reveal much information about it though…other than it involves donuts.
 When Monkeys Need Love Too was first imagined 7 years ago, it was created as a hobby printed up on index cards destined never to leave our gaming table. With the emergence of Kickstarter, we now have the opportunity to turn those index cards into a high quality card game with actual illustrated playing cards that can be shuffled (who here has tried to shuffle index cards? It’s impossible). On top of that, Kickstarter gives us the means to make Monkeys Need Love Too the best game it can possibly be.
 A special thanks goes out to the folks at Indie Game Alliance.  Even though we couldn’t make it to any conventions before launching this Kickstarter, they were there (sometimes without their bumper) to spread the word and give Monkeys Need Love Too some additional traction out in the world. On top of that, they’ve been nothing but open and helpful when we’ve needed to pick their brain for knowledge and opinions. Words can’t express how much we value being a member of IGA.

updates.update_content: I can't tell you how excited I am at this point!  The pics and comments that have been rolling in for the past 7 days have been tremendous!
It's monkey time!!!!!

I'm gonna keep this update short because I'm going bananas over here with excitement!!!  The main shipment of Monkeys Need Love Too has finalllllllllllly arrived at the U.S. Customs warehouse here in San Antonio, TX!!!  I've already paid the inspection fees that were accrued in L.A.  The logistics agent is paying the remaining CFS charges right now as I type and is attempting to arrange transportation for the last leg of the journey (just a 35 mile trip mostly on IH10 to our Boerne, TX warehouse).  She's going to do her best to have it to us by Tuesday!!

OK, so maybe no planes.  That would have been nice...but also expensive. 
So I was holding out on posting the next update until I knew for sure the main shipment was at least in Texas, but I haven't heard back from my customs agent since Monday, so all I can relay is what I know....which is good news!!
The short version of this update

Hey there everyone.  Just a quick update to remind y'all that we have a booth this weekend (#1660) at the PAX South Convention going on in our hometown of San Antonio, TX.  If anyone is attending, make sure to stop by and say hi.  I'll be the one playing with my monkeys (I've got to do something to pass the time).
Will

Wouldn't you know it the Monkeys Need Love Too container was "randomly" selected for a VACIS Exam.  If some of you don't know what a VACIS Exam is, it's basically an X-Ray of the entire container without opening it via a mobile X-Ray unit.  Just another small bump in the road to tossing banana peels.  I knew I shouldn't have given Boris that crowbar!!!

Slowly but surely the monkeys are making their way to everyone.  If you're an international backer, you should have received your copy by now.  I've gotten confirmations from the UK, Australia, and New Zealand.  If you're international and you haven't gotten your copy yet, message me and I'll see what's up.
As for all my North American backers, I got word from my overseas agent Wednesday that the arrival notice has the ship porting in L.A. tonight/tomorrow and an estimated delivery date to the warehouse here in San Antonio on/around January 26th.  But that date is only good under normal conditions, and they still aren't back to that yet at the L.A. port.  So everyone expect to receive your copy in February as initially promised.  I was hoping to impress with an early delivery, but we'll have to settle for just an on-time one instead.

Happy New Year everyone!!!
Just a quick update for you to start off the new year.  I've been told that all international copies have been sent out.  I've even gotten word from some of the international backers (mainly in the UK since that's where the warehouse was) that they've already received their copy.  That makes Monkeys Need Love Too officially global!!

Myth Told Tales #2 Robert Asprin, Jody Lynn Nye
 The Myth Adventures series of humorous fantasy novels began in 1978 with Another Fine Myth. Over the next 24 years, Bob Aspirin wrote eleven more books in the series. You can see the covers in their currently available editions on their cover gallery page.
http://mythadventures.net In 2003, Bob started working with Jody Lynn Nye, with whom he had written one previous novel, License Invoked (Baen Books, 2001). Since then, Bob and Jody have written five more Myth Adventures novels and nine short stories (collected in an anthology, Myth-Told Tales).
In 2007 Silver Phoenix Entertainment Inc. (SPE) licensed Myth Told Tales, . to be transformed into a series of comic books. The response to the first book was amazing; at Dragon Con in 2008, all copies sold out in under 3 hours! It is now time to translate more chapters of this fun series into comic book format, so we decided to do this Kickstarter.com campaign to get it going.
Jody Lynn Nye
 Since 1987 Jody Lynn Nye has published over 40 books and more than 120 short stories. Among the novels Jody has written are her epic fantasy series, The Dreamland, beginning with Waking In Dreamland, five contemporary humorous fantasies, Mythology 101, Mythology Abroad, Higher Mythology (the three collected by Meisha Merlin Publishing as Applied Mythology), Advanced Mythology, The Magic Touch, and three medical science fiction novels, Taylor’s Ark, Medicine Show and The Lady and the Tiger. Strong Arm Tactics, a humorous military science fiction novel, the first of The Wolfe Pack series.
Jody also wrote The Dragonlover’s Guide to Pern, a non-fiction-style guide to the world of internationally best-selling author Anne McCaffrey’s popular world. She also collaborated with Anne McCaffrey onfour science fiction novels, The Death of Sleep, Crisis On Doona, Treaty At Doona and The Ship Who Won, andwrote a solo sequel to The Ship Who Won entitled The Ship Errant. Jody co-authored the Visual Guide to Xanth with best-selling fantasy author Piers Anthony, and edited an anthology of humorous stories about mothers in science fiction, fantasy, myth and legend, entitled Don’t Forget Your Spacesuit, Dear!
Jody wrote eight books with the late Robert Lynn Asprin, License Invoked, a contemporary fantasy set in New Orleans, and seven set in Asprin’s Myth Adventures universe: Myth-Told Tales (anthology), Myth Alliances, Myth-Taken Identity, Class Dis-Mythed, Myth-Gotten Gains, Myth Chief, and Myth-Fortunes. Since Asprin’s passing, she has published Myth-Quoted and Dragons Deal (Ace Books), third in Asprin’s Dragons series. Her latest books are View From the Imperium (Baen Books), a humorous military SF novel, an e-collection of cat stories, Cats Triumphant (Event Horizon), Dragons Run (fourth in the Dragons series) and Launch Pad, an anthology of science fiction stories co-edited with Mike Brotherton.
Michael Gabriel, a research librarian, has adapted three of the 9 short stories specifically for the comic book format. The first one, Myth Congeniality, was the basis of issue one, issue two, the focus of this Kickstarter.com, is going to be called Myth Calculations and we intend to follow up with issue three, Myth-ter Right. Depending on how well this campaign goes we can produce a total of 7 more stories from Myth Told Tales!
“Philip Moy has been the lead artist in this project.  He is a 20 year veteran in the comic book industry, his most notable work being done for DC Comics’ The Powerpuff Girls where Philip drew nearly all the covers for the 5 year run, as well as several stories in the comics.  His comic credentials span many other companies including Marvel, Malibu, Wildstorm, and IDW.

Philip’s interpretation of the style was to show respect to Phil Foglio’s style, who did an earlier adaptation of Myth Adventures: http://www.airshipentertainment.com/mythcomic.php”
Should we exceed our original goals, we are planning on continuing to develop the rest of the chapters into comic books as Stretch Goals. (There are a total of 7 more!)
Page one! of MTT#2 Will be in COLOR!
REWARDS! REWARDS! REWARDS! We have many great rewards for your pledges, including. posters, signed books, original drawings and other great things. We look forward to providing you with an entertaining new look at the Myth series. To learn more about the Myth Adventures series please go to http://mythadventures.net/
Regards Charles D. Moisant, publisher

Thank you to everyone who contributed to this successful campaign! For further updates on digital Boss Monster, visit BrotherwiseGames.com or follow us on Facebook.
Boss Monster is a dungeon-building card game that challenges players to become the ultimate villains: video game bosses. Thousands of players around the world have enjoyed the paper version of the game, but now Brotherwise Games is partnering with video game developer Plain Concepts, creators of Wave Engine, to bring Boss Monster from the tabletop to the digital world!
A little under two years ago, we started Brotherwise Games with the launch of Boss Monster on Kickstarter. That successful campaign ignited a spark and Boss Monster has gone on to continued success in game and hobby stores across North America.
One thing we have heard over and over from fans of the game is, "give us a video game version of Boss Monster!" Maybe you'd like to play the game solo against a computer AI, or maybe you'd like to be able to find opponents at anytime online? Whatever your reason, if you're a Boss Monster fan, old or new, we hope you'll help make this version of the game a reality.
What is Boss Monster?
If you've ever wanted to stomp on an upstart plumber or send your goblins and ghosts out to haunt some heroes, then Boss Monster is the game for you. Sporting beautiful retro-inspired pixel art, and paying homage to classic video games and geeky pop culture, Boss Monster immerses you in the role of the video game boss as you use Room Cards to build a dungeon which must entice worthy heroes, then slay them. 
If you've never played Boss Monster, a good place to start is by watching this video from the magnificent team at Watch it Played!
If you're looking for a quicker overview of the game, check out Boss Monster in 60 Seconds.
What Will the Digital Version Be Like?
This successful campaign allows us to build a digital version of Boss Monster for PC, Kindle, iPad & Android tablets. Digital Boss Monster will mimic all the gameplay available in the tabletop version while also taking advantage of the digital format to enhance your play experience.
What are some of the features you'll see?
Play against up to three AI opponents in solo play.
Challenge other human opponents via pass and play or online through Steam, Apple Game Center or Google Play.
Explore new "digitally-enhanced" cards: four rooms, three new Bosses, and a new spell that all take advantage of the digital platform, allowing stats and treasure values to change as you play.
Top-notch music and retro-inspired sound effects by Power Up Audio.
  Play with ALL of the bosses, rooms, and spells available in the base game, and let the app do the math for you as you take advantage of rapid readout treasure counts in your and your opponents' dungeons.
Here's a closer look at the current interface for the app. This is just a prototype, but already does a great job of showing how the final game will play.
Stretch Goals!
Our campaign is now fully funded, and we've achieved all our stretch goals for this campaign!
ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED! All backers will receive a downloadable pack of DRM-free digital goodies including wallpapers, an MP3 soundtrack, a 50-page PDF Strategy Guide, and a Print-and-Play Card Creation Kit with PDF and Photoshop card templates! Backers at the Extra Life level and above will receive a new digital card, The Princess.
ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED! We will add digital copies of four preview Boss cards from Boss Monster 2 to the Extra Life pledge level. All backers will receive access to a Print-and-Playtest copy of Boss Monster 2! (This is a bare-bones printable Beta of the 160-card expansion, which will allow you to test and submit feedback on our 2015 card set.)
 ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED! Since our campaign hit $120K, we online multiplayer will now allow matching across all available platforms. If you have an iPad and your friend has an Android tablet, you can still play together... effectively doubling the number of potential opponents you'll face!
ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED! This is the big one, guys and gals! You pushed us over the top and we are now officially unlocking the PC version of Boss Monster! It will be available on Steam and will include online multiplayer compatibility with the tablet version. Be sure to spread the world about this awesome last-minute unlock!
ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED! Bonus Stretch Goal! Our awesome backers surprised us by pushing straight through $130K, so we put together one last stretch goal. We will add two physical cards (The Princess and the new Boss created by our $1,000 backer) and Kindle Fire HD compatibility. This is a great last-minute bonus thanks to our dedicated backers!
Choose Your Pledge Level
If you're ready for tactical dungeon-building fun at your fingertips, get ready to choose your pledge level!
With a successful campaign, you'll get your KEY TO THE DUNGEON. Receive one PC, iPad, Kindle Fire or Android tablet app key for the base version of Digital Boss Monster for less than your friends will have to pay after the app launches. This core purchase gives you the full 155-card version of Boss Monster -- everything you need for endless hours of dungeon-building fun on your tablet. (Each device you add requires an additional app key. See "Add-Ons" below for details.)
Ever hear of those Kickstarter Boss Monster Promo cards that are now impossible to get? Well, upgrade to the PLAYER'S CHOICE and you'll get an 11-card digital mini-expansion that includes seven Boss cards, three challenging Epic Heroes, and a game-changing Spell. These cards will never be printed again, so these digital versions are the only way to play with them if you weren't able to get the originals! The Player's Choice level will also get you access to exclusive downloads during the campaign, including print-and-play preview cards from Boss Monster 2!
For less than ten dollars you'll get everything from the Player's Choice pledge level AND early access to the POWER-UP PACK, a second digital mini-expansion of 12 cards. It includes 5 more promo cards, PLUS a set of 7 never-before-seen cards designed specifically for digital play!
For twelve dollars, THE EXTRA LIFE gives you everything from the Power-up Pack AND access to the digital version of Tools of Hero-Kind. This digital conversion of our 26-card expansion makes heroes doubly dangerous with magical items and weapons. But if you defeat these pumped-up Heroes, you can claim their Items to use against opponents! At this level, you're getting EVERYTHING currently available for the tabletop and digital versions of the game.
Serious Boss Monster fans, PAPER AND PIXELS is the pledge level for you! Get everything from the Extra Life level AND early access to hard copies of the new digitally-enhanced cards being made specifically for Digital Boss Monster. In addition to your app rewards, you will be shipped a physical pack of 14 cards: two copies of four Room cards, three Boss cards, one Epic Hero, and one Spell. These cards are optimized for digital play, so the paper versions will require the use of tokens and dice. Shipping is free in the U.S. *Note that Canadian backers should use "The Canadian Version" to avoid shipping charges.
What, you've never played Boss Monster? Don't worry, PRESS START TO PLAY and we'll give you everything from the Paper and Pixels pledge level PLUS a copy of the original tabletop version of the game at a considerable cost savings to buying the game elsewhere. Shipping is free in the U.S., and we'll ship as soon as the campaign closes. *NOTE that physical copies of the game will ship in September 2014, NOT September 2015 as is listed in the rewards column.
THE COMPLETE PACKAGE includes everything in the Press Start to Play level AND a hardcopy version of Tools of Hero-Kind, Boss Monster's first expansion. Shipping is free in the U.S., and we'll ship as soon as the campaign closes. *NOTE that physical copies of the game will ship in September 2014, NOT September 2015 as is listed in the rewards column.
If you want to make a true impact on the development of digital Boss Monster, we invite you to JOIN THE PARTY. You will receive TWO copies of everything included in the Paper & Pixels pledge level, allowing you to share the digital Boss Monster experience with a friend. More importantly, you will have exclusive access to one Beta Key. That means you'll be playing the game ahead of its App Store release, you'll have inside access to private Beta Tester forums, you'll be able to participate in two developer chats, and you'll be credited in the game as a Beta Tester.
If you would like to Join the Party but also want physical rewards, you can add printed copies of both Boss Monster and Tools of Hero-Kind to this level. Select this level and add $29 for both (plus $23 to ship outside the US).
Note that there are separate pledge levels for Android or iPad Beta Keys. Due to Apple restrictions, the iPad version of this level is limited to 90 backers.
All Gone! For years a quiet group of mysterious heroes has labored in the shadows of Arcadia's dungeons. They've taken the quests others wouldn't take, slain the most terrifying monsters, braved the most gruesome traps. These Hidden Heroes have done Arcadia's dirty work, and now their time has finally come. An unlockable set of alternate Heroes will be appearing in digital Boss Monster, and 40 lucky backers had the opportunity to help define those characters. For more info on this sold-out pledge level, click here.
*To maintain the thematic integrity of this hero set, all content, including art design, hero theme, and flavor text, is subject to Brotherwise Games approval.
All Gone! In addition to receiving everything in the Complete Package, one high-rolling backer has taken the chance to BECOME A LEGEND. They will personalize one Boss card that will appear debut in digital Boss Monster. This card will become available in-game to everyone who pledges at the Player's Choice level and above. This backer will work with us to immortalize yourself in the card's name, mechanics, and artwork. The backer will be credited as an Executive Producer of the app and treated as a VIP at all Brotherwise events. Finally, the backer will receive twenty physical copies of this card, including signed copies from Brother One and Brother Two!
Unlimited Lives Rides Again
This pledge level is ONLY for those backers who backed the original Boss Monster campaign at the UNLIMITED LIVES level and above. With this pledge level, you have two options: you can just send us a direct message and we'll put you down for a free copy of KEY TO THE DUNGEON, or if you pledge $7 we will give you all digital rewards plus the PAPER AND PIXELS physical reward. To access that level, pledge $7 but do not select a pledge level ("No Reward"). At the end of the campaign, we will send you a survey which will give you a chance to verify your identity and specify your reward.
Add-Ons
If you want to add any of the following rewards to a pledge level, you can include them in your pledge as Add-ons! To include an Add-on, just click on Modify Your Pledge and add extra dollars without changing your pledge level.
Legendary Edition (Kickstarter-exclusive skin pack): Add $2

Extra Life (app key with both promo packs + expansion): Add $12
Paper & Pixels (all of the above + physical 12-card pack): Add $16 (plus $5 to ship outside of the US and Canada)
If you pledge at the Join the Party level, you can also add the physical game and expansion for $29 (plus $23 for International shipping).
Once the campaign closes, as long as you've pledged the right amount of money, you'll be able to indicate your desired rewards during the post-campaign survey. (For example, if you pledge $32 and select Paper & Pixels you can say "I want a second copy of Paper & Pixels" in the post-campaign survey.) Feel free to ask in the Comments if you have any questions!

updates.update_content:
Greetings Digital Boss Monsters,
It's been some time since Digital Boss Monster originally launched, but I'm pleased to announce that with the update released this week for iOS, all promised content is available on all advertised platforms, and the game is playing well on all of them.
After considerable research into a befuddling problem, Plain Concepts has isolated the memory leak that was plaguing the iOS version of the game. And that's not the only improvement. With the latest update, Plain Concepts has made numerous improvements to the UI, to multiplayer, and quite impressively, to the AI. I'm thrilled with what I'm seeing the AI doing during solo games.

Hello all,
It's been a while since you've heard an update from us on digital Boss Monster, but work on the app has continued. Our development partner, Plain Concepts, is moving steadily forward on a complete, stable version of the app with all expansions unlocked. Here's what's going on:
1. All expansions (including the brand-new Tools of Hero-Kind) have been released on Steam, Kindle, and Android, and the most recent update to the game on those platforms has improved playability considerably. If you own Boss Monster on one of these platforms and you haven't played it in a while, we encourage you to try it.

Happy Holidays, Boss Monsters!
We know an update has been a long time coming, but we've been hashing through some Digital Boss Monster issues with our development partners at Plain Concepts, and didn't want to post something until we had a better idea of how we would move forward.
To date, Digital Boss Monster has launched on all promised platforms, and the first promised expansion (The Player's Choice Pack) is up as well. The launch of iOS 9.0 threw a bit of a wrench in the works for the iOS version of Boss Monster, and, frankly, put everything else on hold while Plain Concepts worked on the new bugs that major update created, thus the hold-up on the last two promised expansions.

Greeting Digital Boss Monsters,
It's been a while since our last post, and in that time Plain Concepts has been toiling away at a UI redesign of Digital Boss Monster based on the feedback we've received from you and other players. While we're as eager as you are to see Plain Concept's work on the expansions, we think they've done a great job with this redesign and we take it as further evidence of their commitment to the game that they've put so much time into making the game the best it can be.

Today we have an update on how digital Boss Monster is progressing, but we also wanted to make sure no one missed a key piece of news on the tabletop version.
Boss Monster 2 Kickstarter
Our Kickstarter for Boss Monster 2: The Next Level is ending tomorrow! As we shared in our last update, we did not want to inundate you with messages while some of you are still waiting for the Steam version of digital Boss Monster. However, the Boss Monster 2 campaign is fully funded and we just want to make sure none of your miss out!

Hello Digital Boss Monsters,
Brother One here, stopping in with some updates on Digital Boss Monster and Boss Monster in general.
New patch is live

With digital Boss Monster now live on the App Store, things are moving and shaking in the world of Arcadia. Here's a status update on all things Boss Monster!
App Updates
While we were very excited to launch Boss Monster on iPad last week, the initial version was buggier than we would have liked. Most players are reporting no problems, but some are running into trouble. Here are some things to try if you're having trouble:

Good Morning Boss Monsters,
And a great morning it is! Boss Monster is live on the Apple store and your access codes should be in your inboxes. We do know that some of the emails from our developer referenced the Android version; if you got more than one email, use the link and code in the second one and you should be all set.
We know this was a challenging wait, and we want to thank you for your patience through the delays and false starts. While our partner Plain Concepts will be continuously working on improving game play through regular updates, it was important to them -- and us -- that this first version be the best it could be.

Easy to learn rules with our fully illustrated rulebook.
Exciting game mechanics, designed to engage players and allowing for numerous tactics and strategies. 
45 – 60 minute gameplay allows for dynamic matches, without long waits between turns.
Game variants allow players of all ages and skill to enjoy the game.
Plays equally well with two, three and four players.
Beautiful high quality art by Andrzej Sykut.
Modular tile construction allows countless combinations. No two games will ever play the same way. Explore a new section of the galaxy each and every game.
Players of all types will find Galaxy of Trian engaging. 
Rahdo Runs Through:
Undead Viking:
Punching Cardboard:
podcast review
All Kickstarter backers who purchase a copy of Galaxy of Trian will receive the Deluxe Edition, which comes with the expansion “The Beginning of Conquest” as a sincere thank you for backing our project.
An actual player card from the expansion “The Beginning of Conquest”, the Quuylto.
                        all graphics and differences between the various tiles can be seen here
Galaxy of Trian is a dynamic tile-based sci-fi board game.
During the game, you take command of one alien faction, fighting over the territory and technology left by the powerful Trian race. Players have at their disposal a few kinds of basic units and spaceships, which allow for the exploration and control of the galaxy. Further ships will be released in future expansions.
The game is played in turns, in a clockwise manner. Starting with the first player, in each of their turns, players draw a tile from the stack and place it on the table. The tiles can be placed with either side face up, and must make a legal connection to those already placed on the table.
Tiles are two-sided and stacked in two piles, which gives more tactical possibilities and, at the same time, limits randomness. Special tiles, like teleports, exmitters or trade stations increase the level of interaction and give the players an even greater variety of choices.
                        The “Beginning of Conquest” expansion, available to all Kickstarter backers, introduces two new ship classes to Galaxy of Trian: the Corvette and Rogue.  These new ships allow players to steal minerals and even to block the expansion of other player's planetary systems. The "Begining of Conquest" expansion adds even more replayability to the game.
Here are French translation of Rule book - for now only text without graphics
                      In the "Wealth of the Ancients" expansion, you will get 12 beautifully illustrated, two-sided tiles and 12 large crystals. The rulebook appendix will introduce a number of new rules and mechanisms based on the large crystals. 
The "Wealth of the Ancients" expansion can easily be incorporated with all other expansions to the Galaxy of Trian. Available only with the "TRIAN GEEK SET".
On tiles with crystal symbol appears large minerals that give you lot of additional points. On that tiles you cannot put any resource tokens.
You are guaranteed to love the game. If you don’t enjoy Galaxy of Trian, simply return the game within thirty days and we will gladly refund your money.
“The Beginning of Conquest” expansion, available to Kickstarter backers, comes free!
Because we need you.  Graphic design, preparation of the game prototypes, and selection of producers and suppliers is already complete. Sadly, our budget doesn’t allow us to release the game - for this project to become a reality, we need your support!
Kickstarter Stretch Goals. You have access to the Deluxe edition, which also comes with the ability to claim additional terrific rewards, such as additional races, special tiles, miniatures and more.
Special additional tiles for free.
Hall of Fame membership on our website www.galaxyoftrian.com.
Each edition of the game (including subsequent editions after the Kickstarter) will include the list of all of our backers.
                     
For USA, CANADA & EU backers, shipping is free!
For all other countries, please add fee written in description of pledge.
Trian race
                It was written in the Holy Matrix of Creation: 
Thou shalt share what has been given to thee…
Peaceful creatures, the Trian race became the most enlightened civilization in the known galaxy, garnering respect and admiration from all other races. They were ancient pilgrims, spreading knowledge and technology in every corner of the galaxy.
But at the height of their powers, this ancient race embarked on a journey, carrying on an everlasting mission and sending forth a mighty armada into the stars. They left behind their technology, leaving their cities abandoned as they began their pilgrimage.
And now, deserted and unprotected, the remnants of the Trian civilization stand ready for those willing to take the ancient race’s technology for themselves. The lesser races, which once would never dare trespass into Trian space, begin their slow and dangerous exploration of the Trian’s corner of the galaxy.
Playable races in The Galaxy of Trian
Quuylto - "Technology is the melody of a triumph…"
K’Haarguar - "Anything that lives can kill you…."
Xemh - "Attack is the only solution…"
Borf-Naree - "Everyone has their price…."
Sslyx
Arvori
Details of game plot here
We are planning subsequent expansions, which will enrich the game with new tiles, races, units, missions, special abilities, technologies, artifacts and more. A great number of expansions and game variants await the players.
The game has excellent tournament conditions and we want to make use of it through the creation of a league and tournaments. Game mechanics allow players to play individually or as teams.
 
We are a group of friends who share a great passion for board games. Seweryn Piotrowski is the author of the project, while Grzegorz Kalarus and Sebastian Oliwa are the co-authors.
One day, we simply decided to redirect the energy from our passion to the track of creation. The combination of our experience and skills gave birth to the game Galaxy of Trian, in which we give you a little piece of us. We hope that the immensity of work, energy and time we have devoted will be appreciated and that you will fall in love with our game as we all did.
from left - Sebastian Oliwa, Grzegorz Kalarus, Andrzej Sykut, Seweryn Piotrowski
Author Seweryn Piotrowski
Co-authors Grzegorz Kalarus, Sebastian Oliwa

The whole project was so far funded with our private funds and, if it weren’t for the help of our friends, we wouldn’t be able to achieve such an amazing final outcome.
The creator of all the graphics in the game is an incredibly talented graphic designer – Andrzej Sykut. Thanks to his amazing imagination, the knowledge of many graphic tools and the ability of using various styles, Andrzej created magnificent art and exceeded our expectations. We wanted our game to be a small piece of art and, thanks to Andrzej, it has become one.  For this we are very grateful.
Marcin Halerz and Michał Czekaj put a great deal of work in the direction and montage of promotional videos.
Jack Hiro is the author of the climatic music you can hear in the background of our video.

Risks and challenges
Most of the problems concerning Galaxy of Trian have been dealt with. 

We have contacted manufacturing companies which have a history of successfully delivering high quality products with high quality components. 

Thanks to a great deal of experience in the print processes, we are able to efficiently verify our producer and make quality control changes to our components quickly.

We have prepared all stages of project realization: the materials for print, the suppliers of components, completion of the game and shipment. We are positive that we will provide you with the game “Galaxy of Trian” in December 2014 (TRIAN GEEK SET will be sent at January 2015).

To sum up, we have the knowledge and experience which allows us to create and make our project come true. The only thing we lack is your support.

During project implementation we will you update you on current changes, events and ideas.


GAMEPLAY TESTING

The game tests began in November of 2013. Over 70 people were involved in the process of testing every variant of our game.

Thanks to those who intensely performed tests, Galaxy of Trian is now a well-tested, balanced and complete game. Without our fantastic testers, we wouldn’t have been able to make real our vision.

We are extremely satisfied with the final product. We are confident that our game will meet the expectations of players, both those looking for strategic challenge and those looking for a family game.

The full list of our testers can be found on our page http://www.galaxyoftrian.com/?page_id=46


MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS

When dealing with a great number of orders, there is a possibility that something could go wrong. In the unlikely, but possible, chance of a damaged package, please contact us at grzegorz.kalarus@galaxyoftrian.com

If your package arrives broken or damaged, simply take photos of damaged elements and send them to us at grzegorz.kalarus@galaxyoftrian.com. We will replace all the damaged or missing elements with all haste.

The games will be delivered firmly packed.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Draft still in progress. We still waiting for your feedback!
Upgrade pack
We would like to thank you all for your continuous feedback and the time you spend writing comments. We always remember about our first backers and we have prepared a special Upgrade Pack just for you. Since day one we considered it a non-profit pledge. At the very beginning we were thinking of creating a single upgrade pledge which included components for the owners of both the Emissary as well as the Trian Geek Set. As you have rightly pointed out some components were duplicates. This has now been changed and we have adjusted the upgrade packs to the previous pledges so that no-one feels as if they are paying twice for the same product. We divided this pledge into segments so that everyone can choose what they like. We even prepared a budget version for the ones that just want to get to know the new game mechanics but don’t want to pay for the minis. This division unfortunately means higher costs of packing. Since launching the first edition of Galaxy of Trian two years ago a lot has changed in the gaming market. This includes production and shipping costs. At that time adding shipping costs to the pledges was completely normal. At that time the Trian Geek Set was worth 40$ if you excluded the shipping costs and similarly the Emissary was worth 23$. What is left from the old version are tiles, tile rack, bags and the minerals which are worth 3-4$. Just look how much new content you are getting in the full version. This is not a reprint with minor tweaks. We added a battle mechanic, we fundamentally changed the pointing system. We have added 8 race abilities which make every game feel different. The only element left unchanged is the way you lay out tiles. This is a COMPLETELY NEW GAME. We have analysed this back and forth for the past two days and this is the best way to keep the costs optimised and give you a product you will enjoy.
